itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1715717027" />    <a title="Mohammed Arabey" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13592557-mohammed-arabey"><img alt="Mohammed Arabey" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1364338486p2/13592557.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1715717027?book_show_action=false">Oct 13, 2016</a>      <a title="Mohammed Arabey" class="user" name="Mohammed Arabey" href="/user/show/13592557-mohammed-arabey">Mohammed Arabey</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/29067264-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1715717027" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10495253192294765753">المراجعة العربية لـ<b>هـاري بـوتر والطفل الملعون</b><br><i> <blockquote>دراكو مالفوي: لا اهتم بما فعلته أو من أنقذته، انت دوما لعنة مستمرة علي عائلتي، يا هاري بوتر</blockquote> </i><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470498379i/19935575._SX540_.jpg" width="450" height="367" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>من 2007 ونحن نتمني قصة جديدة…ولكن <b>.."كل شيء علي مايرام" </b>هكذا وأدت جي كي رولينج نهاية الاحداث<br>هاري بوتر لم تؤلمه ندبته ل 19 عاما من بعد معركة هوجوارتس الكبري وسقوط فولدمورت، هو وأصدقائه علي مايرام<br>ولكن لدينا الكثير من الأسئلة من نوعية ماذا لو؟<br><i> <blockquote>ماذا لو البوس بوتر فعلا دخل سليزرين؟<br>ماذا لو لم ينجح زواج رون وهيرموني كما تشك المؤلفة نفسها؟</blockquote> </i><b>وهنا المفاجأة، مغامرة أخيرة،</b></span>  <span id="freeText10495253192294765753" style="display:none">المراجعة العربية لـ<b>هـاري بـوتر والطفل الملعون</b><br><i>  <blockquote>دراكو مالفوي: لا اهتم بما فعلته أو من أنقذته، انت دوما لعنة مستمرة علي عائلتي، يا هاري بوتر</blockquote></i><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470498379i/19935575._SX540_.jpg" width="450" height="367" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>من 2007 ونحن نتمني قصة جديدة…ولكن <b>.."كل شيء علي مايرام" </b>هكذا وأدت جي كي رولينج نهاية الاحداث<br>هاري بوتر لم تؤلمه ندبته ل 19 عاما من بعد معركة هوجوارتس الكبري وسقوط فولدمورت، هو وأصدقائه علي مايرام<br>ولكن لدينا الكثير من الأسئلة من نوعية ماذا لو؟<br><i>  <blockquote>ماذا لو البوس بوتر فعلا دخل سليزرين؟<br>ماذا لو لم ينجح زواج رون وهيرموني كما تشك المؤلفة نفسها؟</blockquote></i><b>وهنا المفاجأة، مغامرة أخيرة، غريبة مليئة بالمفاجأت، لتعلن جي كي رولينج انها نهاية أخيرة لقصة هاري بوتر...الولد الذي عاش<br>مغامرة مختلفة، فهي مسرحية وليست رواية، لكنها مازلت عن الصداقة، الشجاعة، عدم التمييز، الحب<br>مغامرة ايضا عن الحب الزوجي، و المشاكل بين الآباء والأبناء<br>مغامرة اصعب، اكثر خطورة فهي تتضمن تلاعب باخطر شئ..وسؤال طالما راودنا<br></b><i>  <blockquote>ماذا لو تبقت آداة رجوع زمن؟ هل يمكننا أن نعيد أولئك من ماتوا هباءا؟<br>ماذا لو اتضح انها مع أحدهم ونجح في جعل فولدمورت يصنع هوركوركس اخر...او ما هو أفظع؟</blockquote></i><b><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470145280ra/19894194.gif" width="450" height="266" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>مغامرة تتلاعب بتيمة أعشقها، الزمن …فتسافر ذهابا وايابا عبره وتتحمل عواقبه<br>مغامرة أشد قسوة، فقد وضعت رولينج أبطالنا المحبوبين في إختبارات قاسية بحق<br>مغامرة للأسف ليس أبطالها الثلاثي الذي اعتدناه، بل أبناءهم..فهي تبدأ بعد 19 عاما..الكتاب الثامن<br></b><i>  <blockquote>ماذا لو هناك كتابا ثامنا؟</blockquote></i><b>  <u>    <blockquote>هــاري بــوتـــر والأبن المـلـعـون</blockquote>  </u>  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470498788i/19935628._SX540_.jpg" width="450" height="293" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></b><i>  <blockquote>خالة بتونيا : نحن ملعونون! لقد اصابنا بلعنة! الولد 'هاري بوتر ،11 سنة' تسبب في لعنتنا</blockquote></i><b><br><u>**الاحــــداث**</u><br>~~~~~~~~~</b><i><br>"فقط الربع الأول من الكتاب"</i><br>تبدأ الاحداث من المشهد الختامي ل<b>هاري بوتر ومقدسات الموت</b>، في محطة القطار و<b>ألبوس سيفروس بوتر </b>يستعد لعامه الاول، قلقا أن تصنفه قبعة التنسيق لسليزرين … ولكنه قلقا أيضا من المسئولية علي عاتقه، علي إسمه. . ان سكون قدر التوقعات من يحمل اسم دمبلدور، سناب، هاري بوتر..وهو في الحادية عشر<br>هناك <b>روز جرينجر ويزلي</b> والتي أخذت حماسة أمها هيرموني بشكل اكبر من اللازم<br><i>  <blockquote>روز: أل، يجب أن نركز<br>ألبوس: فيم نركز؟<br>روز: في من نختار ليكونوا أصدقاء معنا. أمي وأبي قابلا أبيك في أول رحلة قطار لهوجورتس، ألا تعلم؟<br>ألبوس: إذن فنحن نحتاج أن نختار من سيكونوا اصدقاء لنا للعمر كله؟ هذا مفزع شيئا ما</blockquote></i>وهناك <b>سكوربيس مالفوي</b>، أبن دراكو مالفوي، والذي تحيطه الشائعات بسبب ماضي عائلة أبيه وعلاقتهم بفولدمورت لدرجة شائعة بإنه<b> إبن فولدمورت<br></b>ولكن يتضح أن خوف ألبوس من ان يصنف بسليذرين هي أقل مما سيحدث له بعامه الأول بهوجوارتس<br><i>  <blockquote>هاري: لا تقلق ان الناس تنظر، حسنا، هم ينظرون إلي أنا ليس أنت<br>ألبوس: ينظرون إلي هاري بوتر وابنه المخيب للآمال<br>هاري: ما معني هذا؟؟<br>ألبوس: الي هاري بوتر وأبنه في سليذرين</blockquote></i>~~~~~~~~~~<br>وتمر اول 3 سنوات...وقبل الرابع يحدث كل شئ بسرعة...<b>هاري بوتر</b> يقبض علي أحدهم يملك<b> آداة "رجوع الزمن"</b> مختلفة عن تلك بالكتاب الثالث والتي تدمرت كلها في معركة الوزارة بالجزء الخامس ، وتقرر <b>هيرموني </b>وزيرة السحر الاحتفاظ بها لحين إنتهاء التحقيقات<br>ويظهر فجأة<b> أموس ديجوري</b>، والد<b> سيدريك </b>الذي قتله فولدمورت عند عودته بالجزء الرابع بنهاية دورة السحرة الثلاثية يطالب هاري بإستخدام الآداة لينقذ أبنه الذي مات بلا ذنب<br>ولكن هاري ينكر هذا...ولكن ألبوس سمع كل شئ ويدرك انه يكذب هناك فعلا أداة إعادة زمن بالوزارة...وبمساعدة صديقه الوحيد وابنه عم سيدريك ديجوري سيحاولوا السفر عبر الزمن لإنقاذ سيدريك من موت هباء<br>المشكلة هنا ان صديقه هذا هو ابن دراكو مالفوي الوحيد، سكوربيوس<br>~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br>كل هذا هو مجرد ملخص بسيط لربع الكتاب الاول، الفصل الاول من الفصول الاربع لتلك المسرحية، فقط نسيت ان اخبرك ان هاري بوزارة السحر سيلحظ تحركات للعمالقة والمذءوبين الذين حاربوا في صف فولدمورت من قبل...وسيعاني من احلام سيئة<br><b><br>احم احم، هل قلت لك ان ندبته عادت لتؤلمه…لأول مرة..بعد 22 عاما<br></b><i>  <blockquote>خالة بتونيا : نحن ملعونون! لقد اصابنا بلعنة! الولد تسبب في لعنتنا</blockquote></i><b>يكفي هذا، ولتعلم انك علي موعد مع مغامرة لاهثة بحق، تحبس الانفاس ، قاسية<br>عن الصداقة والشجاعة مرة اخري<br><br>عن إختبار الحياة لنا هل سنقوم بفعل الصح،ام السهل..مرة اخري<br></b><i>  <blockquote>هاري: (يفشل في احتواء غضبه) إن كنت تحاول أن تفعل كما فعلت أنا، فأنت مخطئ بطريقتك تلك. أنا لم أتطوع لمغامرة، لقد تم إجباري بها</blockquote></i><b>وفي هذه المرة ، بالرغم من أبطالنا ليسوا الأبطال الرئيسيين للقصة الا ان مشاكلها اعمق وانضج...كتلك عن المشاكل والهوة بين الأب وابنه<br></b><i>  <blockquote>ألبوس: ماذا تريدني أن افعل؟ أسحر نفسي لأكون محبوبا؟ استحضر نفسي لمنزل-جريفندور- مختلف؟ أغير هيئتي لتلميذ أفضل؟ فقط ألقي علي تعويذة يا أبي، وغيرني إلي ما تريد مني أن أكون .. هذا سيكون أفضل لكلانا</blockquote></i><b>هي أيضاً عن الشعور بالذنب...ومدي جذب الماضي لنا والذي قد يتحول للعنة لحاضرنا<br></b><i>  <blockquote>هاري بوتر: الفتي الذي عاش.. كم من الناس مات من أجل الفتي الذي عاش؟</blockquote></i><b><br>مغامرة مختلفة تماما...بها ديستوبيا..حيث سنري كيف سيكون العالم إذا ما انتصر فولدمورت بمشاهد مكتوبة بعبقرية وتشويق وتفطر القلب من الشخصيات التي ستقابلها او اختلاف بعضهم<br><br>بها احلام مزعجة ومقبضة ، وربما في اجزاء هاري بوتر الثلاث الأولي بالاخص كانت رولينج تقوم بمثل هذه المشاهد من وقت لاخر...هنا ستجدها قاسية ومقبضة...وستفطر قلبك ايضا خاصا انها من ماضي قديم<br><br>ستشعر فعلا أن المؤلفة قاسية جدا علي شخصياتها، بل شخصياتنا المفضلين في أختبار الحياة ذلك<br><br>بها عودة للجزء الرابع، دورة السحر الثلاثية بضجيجها واثارتها وصوت مقدمها الجهور لودو باجمان<br><br>وبها عودة للشخصيات التي طالما ما عشنا معها طوال الاجزاء السبعة...وان بشكل خاطف احيانا، ضبابي، او مجرد ذكر وظهور شرفي<br><br>---------------------<br><br><u>**الشـــخصـــيات**</u><br>~~~~~~~~~~~~</b><i>  <blockquote> مالفوي: أنتم الثلاثة - أنتم تلمعون،أتعلمون ذلك؟ أنتم تحبون بعضكم البعض. تستمتعون معا. لقد كنت أحسدكم تلك الصداقة أكثر من اي شئ<br>جيني: لقد كنت أحسدهم ايضا</blockquote></i><br>للأسف أبطالنا الثلاثي الذهبي ليسوا ابطال تلك المسرحية ، الابطال هنا ثلاثي مختلف تماما ثلاثي من الجيل الجديد وربما لظننا مستحيل ان يكونوا اصدقاء <b><br>ألبوس بوتر</b>...الذي يخلط بين الشجاعة والحماقة<b><br>سكوربيوس مالفوي</b>..الصديق الذي يقف جوار صديقه الوحيد مهما كانت العواقب<br><i>  <blockquote>أستاذة ماكونجال: هذا لا يعد شجاعة ياسكوربيوس و انت يا ألبوس، لكن الدرس الذي حتي ابوك احيانا كان لا ينتبه له هو أن الشجاعة لا تغفر الحماقة..فكر دائما في العواقب</blockquote></i>و<b> دالفي ديجوري</b>..الفتاة التي تتمني انقاذ ابن عمها الذي مات بلا ذنب لتسعد ابيه العجوز<br><br>هناك مصائر لشخصيات اخري ستعرفها وستحزن عليها...وهناك شخصيات من الماضي ستمزق قلبك بظهورها مرة اخري، واخري للاسف لم تحضر هذا الحشد الضخم بتلك القصة/المسرحية<br>ولكن الأهم ستتعرف علي حياة أبطالنا الاهم كيف تسير بشكل فعلا يختم لك اي شكوك او أسئلة طالما طلبنا ان نعرفها منذ نهاية الجزء السابع<br><b><br> هاري بوتر</b>...الاب المنقسم الذي لا يدرك كيف يتعامل مع ابنه المراهق..مع كل هذه الضغوط<br>لا تنس ان هاري بوتر كان يتيما، لم يكن في حياته نموذج للأب بشكل سوي تماما لفترة طويلة ، دمبلدور اختار ان يبتعد عنه لاعوام وطالما اخفي عنه الكثير كي لا يرهقه، سيريوس ظل مطاردا ولم يمهله القدر اكثر من سنة، لوبين لم يكن قريبا جدا له<br>أضف لذلك ان هاري معروف بسخونة رأسه، عصبيته...لذا لا تصدق الدعاية المضادة انهم خربوا شخصية هاري بوتر...وتذكر المشهد الاخير مع دمبلدور في نهاية جماعة العنقاء مثلا، او مع لوبين في مقدسات الموت<br><br>اما <b>جيني ويزلي</b> فستجد برغم دورها الصغير انها ام رائعة وزوجة ممتازة اكثر مما توقعت<br>هل تذكر مقال ريتا سكيتر ببوتر مور منذ عامين؟ عندما شككت بعدم نجاح زواجهما؟ ..حسنا يبدو ان ريتا كانت كالعادة مغيرة للحقائق<br><b><br>هيرموني ورون</b> .. دورهما هنا ليس كبيرا، ولكن اعتقد ان فعلا رون جاء اكثر "سطحية" من اي جزء مضي ، ربما فعلا كانت المؤلفة تنتقم منه لزواجه هيرميوني رغم شكوكها انهما ليسا متوافقان بشكل تام كما صرحت في احد تصريحاتها المفاجئة الصادمة من قبل <br>لا أنكر انني اوافقها الرأي لذا لم اشعر بالضيق من دوره هنا<br>ولكن إختبار الزمن والحياة القاسي الذي قامت به المؤلفة في تلك المغامرة جعلني فعلا اعشق العلاقة بينهما واخاف عليها اكثر بكثير مما سبق في الجزء السابع <br>واعجبتني جدا النهاية باعترافهما انهما كانا صغيرين وقتها...ورون لم يكن مسؤولا بدرجة كبيرة<br><b><br>دراكو مالفوي</b>.. الشخصية المثيرة للجدل<br>بعد سناب يظل دراكو الشخصية الاكثر اثارة للجدل...دائما بالاخص بدءا من الجزء السادس هناك صراع داخلي نفسي رهيب يدور بداخله<br>بصفة ان إبنه هو صديق ألبوس. .. فإن دوره هنا اكبر، اقوي، اقسي واكثر اثارة للمشاعر الحزينة التي ستجعلك تشفق عليه<br>هل تذكر علاقة الاب وابنه بين دراكو وبين ابيه لوسيوس في الاجزاء السابقة...هنا العلاقة مختلفة بينه وبين ابنه سكوربيوس...وبينه وبين هاري بوتر<br><i>  <blockquote>دراكو: أبي ظن أنه يحميني. معظم الوقت - اظن ان عليك إتخاذ اختيار في لحظة معينة عن الرجل الذي تود ان تصيره. أما أبا أو صديق. ولكن إذا كرهت والديك ولم يصر لك اصدقاء فأنت وحيدا. . وهذا قاسي- قاسي بحق. لقد كنت وحيدا وهذا أرسلني إلي مكان مظلم بحق. لوقت طويل...توم ريدل أيضاً كان كان طفلا وحيدا. ربما لا تفهم هذا يا هاري، لكن انا افهم- واعتقد ان جيني* تفهم ايضا<br>جيني: انه محق<br>دراكو: توم ريدل لم يخرج من مكانه المظلم. لذا توم ريدل صار لورد فولدمورت. ربما الهالة السوداء التي رآها 'باين' حول ابنك هي وحدة ألبوس، ألمه، كراهيته. لا تفقد الولد. ستندم، وكذلك هو. لأنه يريدك..و يريد سكوربيوس، سواء يعلم أو لا<br>* في الكتاب الثاني، حجرة الأسرار، مفكرة توم ريدل امتلكتها جيني ويزلي لوقت ما*<br></blockquote></i><br>واحببت جدا النهاية بحق، ووقوفه مع الثلاثي حتي النهاية ، بل وكلامه مع هاري بوتر في مشهد درامي ممتاز عن العلاقة بين الاب والابن بناء علي تجربته <br>فهي قد تسبب لعنة بحق<br><i>  <blockquote>دراكو: لا اهتم بما فعلته أو من أنقذته، انت دوما لعنة مستمرة علي عائلتي، يا هاري بوتر</blockquote></i><b><br>**<u>مـن هـو الطــفــل المـلعــــون؟</u>**</b><br>حسنا هذا هو السر الذي يجب ان تكتمه<br>كما رأيت هاري ، ألبوس، سكوربيوس كلهم وصموا باللقب في تلك المسرحية القاسية<br>ودعني اؤكد لك ان كل الانتقادات حول الطفل الملعون قد تكون بها شئ من الحقيقة، قد لا اكون مقتنع تماما بكشف الطفل الملعون<br>ولكن حقا ما وصلني من القصة هو رسالتها...الشجاعة والغباء..الشعور بالذنب...اخطاء الماضي والزمن الذي قد يطاردنا ،وهذا أكثر ما يمسني<br>وحتي العلاقة المعقدة بين الآباء والأبناء والتي ايضا لمست بداخلي وترا حساسا بحق<br><b><br><u>**المســـرحيـــة**</u><br>~~~~~~~~~~~</b><br>ايقاع مختلف تماما عن الروايات، ربما القليل من الاختلافات هنا ايضا ترجع لأن المسرحية<b> قصة جي كي رولينج</b> ومعها لأول مرة شركاء، <b>جاك ثورن </b>-بل وهو وحده من كتب النص المسرحي، و<b> جون تيفاني </b>مخرج المسرحية<br><br>لربما ستشعر فعلا بغرابة بل وجفاف النص في البداية وهذا سبب انتقادات اكبر هنا<br>فهو نص مسرحي، انت عليك ان تحوله لرواية وفيلما ومشاهد سينمائية في عقلك وقت قراءته، وصدقني اذا كنت ممن قرأ السلسلة كلها، وعاشها واعجبته علي الاقل 70% ،فقبل ان يمر الفصل الأول ستجد انك رجعت تعيش بذلك العالم السحري مرة اخري بلا مجهود في مغامرة ذات ايقاع سريع ، وحوارات درامية مسرحية قوية بحق<br>روح رولينج المرحة، الذكية، والجمل المليئة بالرسائل موجودة هنا كما هي...بإطار مسرحي صنعه رجال لهم مكانة لابأس بها بالمسرح<br>فلا داعي للانتحاب ك<b>ميرتل المنتحبة </b>-ستظهر هنا ايضا- ، وحاول الاستمتاع وقراء© ÙØ§ Ø¨ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ³Ø·ÙØ±<br><br>Ø£Ø±Ø§ÙÙ Ø§Ù Ø¹ÙØµØ±ÙØ© ØªØ¬Ø§Ù Ø§Ø®ØªÙØ§Ø± ÙÙØ±ÙÙÙÙ ÙØ³ÙØ±Ø§Ø¡Ø ÙØ§ Ø£ÙÙØ± Ø§ÙÙÙ ØºÙØ± ÙØ±ØªØ§Ø­Ø§ ÙÙÙÙ..ÙØ§ ØªÙØ³ Ø§ÙÙØ§ ÙØµØ© Ø¶Ø¯ Ø§ÙØ¹ÙØµØ±ÙØ©-<br></i><br>Ø§ÙÙØ³Ø±Ø­ÙØ© ÙÙ Ø¬Ø²Ø¦ÙÙØ ÙÙ Ø¬Ø²Ø¡ ÙØµÙÙÙ Ø 4 ÙØµÙÙ ÙÙ ÙÙÙÙ ÙÙØªÙÙ Ø¨ÙÙØ§Ø¬Ø§Ø© Ø³ØªØ¬Ø¹ÙÙ ÙØªØ´ÙÙØ§ ÙÙØ¹Ø±ÙØ© Ø§ÙØªØ§ÙÙ<br>Ø¨Ø§ÙØ§Ø®Øµ ÙÙØ§ÙØ© Ø§ÙØ¬Ø²Ø¡ Ø§ÙØ§ÙÙ Ø¨Ø§ÙØ²ÙÙ ÙØ£ÙØ§Ù ÙØ³ØªÙØ¨Ù Ø§ÙÙØ§Ø¶Ù<br>ÙÙ Ø´Ø§ÙØ¯Øª ÙÙÙÙ<br>Days of Future Past<br>Ø§Ù <br>The Butterfly Effect<br>ÙØ°Ø§ ÙØ§ ÙØ­Ø¯Ø« ÙÙØ§ Ø¨ÙÙØ© Ø¨Ø³Ø¨Ø¨ Ø§ÙØªÙØ§Ø¹Ø¨ </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1543955081" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543955081" />    <a title="Maxi" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/23901024-maxi"><img alt="Maxi" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472680231p2/23901024.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543955081?book_show_action=false">Aug 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Maxi" class="user" name="Maxi" href="/user/show/23901024-maxi">Maxi</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23901024-maxi?shelf=i-own-it">i-own-it</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23901024-maxi?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543955081" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8458209227548312005">Yep, another review in which I'm gonna say pretty much what everyone already said. <br><br>Before I started writing this review I went on Wikipedia, just to be sure, and found this:<br><blockquote>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child is a two-part West End stage <u>play</u> <u>written by Jack Thorne</u> <b>based on an original new story by Thorne, J.K. Rowling and John Tiffany</b>. [...]The rehearsal script, <u>not a novelization of the play</u>, was released on 31 July 2016 and became the eighth story set in the Harry Potter universe.</blockquote><br>You have to un</span>  <span id="freeText8458209227548312005" style="display:none">Yep, another review in which I'm gonna say pretty much what everyone already said. <br><br>Before I started writing this review I went on Wikipedia, just to be sure, and found this:<br><blockquote>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child is a two-part West End stage <u>play</u> <u>written by Jack Thorne</u> <b>based on an original new story by Thorne, J.K. Rowling and John Tiffany</b>. [...]The rehearsal script, <u>not a novelization of the play</u>, was released on 31 July 2016 and became the eighth story set in the Harry Potter universe.</blockquote><br>You have to understand that, being this a play, the structure is completely different from the other seven books. <br>I totally agree with other reviewers that this book should not exist, or at least not like this.<br>Part of the reason I didn't enjoy this was because of the format, and I would have preferred a novelization for the people that live on the other side of the world and really can't go out and see the play. <br><b>But the format was just the least of my problems</b>. I went into this <i>knowing</i> about the format but I wasn't expecting something so bad. <br><br>This wasn't written by <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">JK Rowling</a>, <i>this</i> meaning the script. She wrote the original story with two other people but then the script was written by someone else, not her.<br>And this explain the fan-fiction feelings most of us experienced. I admit that I haven't read many HP fan-fictions because I'm very specific about my ships and couldn't really find anything to satisfy me in the past (I know, very profound) but in some parts nothing made sense.<br>This felt like the kind of fan-fiction where <b>the characters don't even act like themselves</b>. <br>I'm pissed off because they ruined Ron's character - which is one of my favorites in the whole series, all he did was joking around like the court jester. And don't even let me start with Draco.<br>It was hard to concentrate on the plot when everyone was acting so differently and <i>wrong</i>.<br><br>And the ending... are we supposed to <i>just </i>believe that? <b>Are you fucking kidding me?</b> <br><br><u>This book should not be considered part of the Harry Potter series</u>, I'm sorry. <br>They put effort in it but it was a mess, everyone acted like a totally different character (especially Ron, Harry and Dumbledore) and the plot was repetitive and weak. <br><br>/////////////////////////////<br>Original reaction (I'm keeping it in my review because this gif is way too funny):<br><a href="http://reactiongifs.com/?p=25527" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1452999431ra/17770880.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a></span>  <a data-text-id="8458209227548312005" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1543955081">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1543955081" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1543955081u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1543955081'><a id="like_count_review_1543955081" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1543955081?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">141 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1543955081" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1543955081" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=141u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=2u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1543955081u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1543955081" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1543955081, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1723209881?book_show_action=false">Aug 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Maureen" class="user" name="Maureen" href="/user/show/10762033-maureen">Maureen</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1723209881" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer332834149261469417">So I have a lot of thoughts about this book that will probably come more in video form (or a longer review later) but overall I really liked it?? I went in expecting to hate it so this is news to me.<br />There are a lot, and I mean A LOT of problems and plot holes and I'm kind of viewing this separately from HP as a whole because of that, but it was still so fun! Hecka weird but also fun. <br />My issues are all v spoilery but it has a lot to do with plot holes, character portrayal, and things not being we</span>  <span id="freeText332834149261469417" style="display:none">So I have a lot of thoughts about this book that will probably come more in video form (or a longer review later) but overall I really liked it?? I went in expecting to hate it so this is news to me.<br />There are a lot, and I mean A LOT of problems and plot holes and I'm kind of viewing this separately from HP as a whole because of that, but it was still so fun! Hecka weird but also fun. <br />My issues are all v spoilery but it has a lot to do with plot holes, character portrayal, and things not being well explained (though it is a play so that was bound to happen). <br />What this really left me with is an URGENT DESIRE to see the play. So many times I was picturing things in my head and how cool they would look on stage or thinking "wow, I wonder how they'll do this???" So yeah. I really really want to see it someday.</span>  <a data-text-id="332834149261469417" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1723209881">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1723209881" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1723209881" ref="like" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544060429" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544060429" />    <a title="Sarah (Starry Night Reader)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7883731-sarah-starry-night-reader"><img alt="Sarah (Starry Night Reader)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457112559p2/7883731.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544060429?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Sarah (Starry Night Reader)" class="user" name="Sarah (Starry Night Reader)" href="/user/show/7883731-sarah-starry-night-reader">Sarah (Starry Night Reader)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7883731-sarah-starry-night-reader?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7883731-sarah-starry-night-reader?shelf=five-star">five-star</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7883731-sarah-starry-night-reader?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7883731-sarah-starry-night-reader?shelf=top-16-of-2016-so-far">top-16-of-2016-so-far</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7883731-sarah-starry-night-reader?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544060429" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2806896360121121017">4.5 stars <br /><br />I have to be honest, I wasn't that excited for this. I consider myself a <i>decent</i> Harry Potter fan. I've read the series a few times and consider the series a staple of my childhood and an all-time favorite. Those books got me through hard times where the only thing I could do was escape to a better and magical world through books. I should've felt ecstatic at the thought of a new Harry Potter story but I was just so certain it would be disappointing. I knew I would read it no matter wha</span>  <span id="freeText2806896360121121017" style="display:none">4.5 stars <br /><br />I have to be honest, I wasn't that excited for this. I consider myself a <i>decent</i> Harry Potter fan. I've read the series a few times and consider the series a staple of my childhood and an all-time favorite. Those books got me through hard times where the only thing I could do was escape to a better and magical world through books. I should've felt ecstatic at the thought of a new Harry Potter story but I was just so certain it would be disappointing. I knew I would read it no matter what but my expectations were just so low.<br /><br />The Harry Potter series likely established my love for reading and I always felt like I grew up with Harry. Reading the books now and even watching the films brings true nostalgic feelings, but also a sadness that nothing else will ever be as good. Nothing will bring me those feelings of joy and wonder I experienced the first time I read Harry Potter.<br /><br />But last night I got a little taste of that joy again. This screenplay is not perfect by any means. There are moments where the characters behave so OOC and it's so obvious that JK Rowling did not write this. But then there are parts that reminded me why I love this world and this story so much. Overall I feel like this screenplay captured that same wonderful magical atmosphere that JK Rowling created in her books, while introducing new characters and a new plot. It's the kind of beautiful story I expect from JK Rowling, and I'm delighted to say I enjoyed this so much more than I thought I would.<br /><br />The direction of the plot was completely surprising for me (to be honest I didn't even read the synopsis. Like I said, low expectations) 10% in and my heart was already breaking. The story began unexpectedly sad when I had expected more of a lighthearted adventure. The plot lacked the depth of the books but then this is a screenplay that takes about three hours to read. I really enjoyed the plot and found it totally engrossing (I stayed up til 4 am to read the whole thing in one sitting. No regrets). I don't want to divulge anything about it but I felt it maintained the right balance of revisiting the characters, places, and elements we loved from the series and also presenting some new things. I felt completely immersed back into this world, which was something I didn't think this screenplay would be able to do.<br /><br />I loved the new characters- Albus Severus Potter and Scorpius Malfoy. Albus seems to be nothing like his father. He hates Hogwarts and has no friends (besides Scorpius). He's not athletic and he is really a very average wizard. He feels like a disappointment to his father, like he'll never live up to his father's legacy. This was all pretty unexpected and sad for me. When I envisioned the future for Harry and co. I had basically assumed it would be a happily ever after type of situation, not family turmoil. I had expected Albus to be a lot like his father and the story to be like Harry Potter redux, but that's not what it was and I am so happy for that. This was a beautiful and meaningful story that stands on it's own. Scorpius is also an outcast for reasons you'll have to read about. But Albus and Scorpius form a true friendship and the story of their friendship gave me those same sentimental feelings as the original story where the bond and love amongst friends is more powerful than anything.<br /><br />Harry doesn't know how to communicate with his struggling son who is so different from him. This is where it got sort of weird. Seeing all these characters I loved as a child behaving as adults was just <i>weird.</i> It seemed OOC to me but then I don't know, maybe they're just adults now. Ron is just a jokester now. Ginny has no personality at all. Draco seemed a little too nice/sentimental to me. I debated with myself for awhile about how I felt about this. There's two ways this could go- I could criticize the book for reading more like "fanfiction" and not staying true to the original characters or I can appreciate and love this story for allowing me to experience the joy of immersing myself in the wonder, excitement, and adventure of the wizarding world once again, which is something I never thought would be possible. I'm choosing the latter. Despite its flaws, I found the screenplay to be true to the original series in the sense that it encapsulates the same warm and magical aura of the books and a beautiful story where love and friendship conquer all. To be honest, I didn't go into this expecting the same characters I originally fell in love with, and so I didn't find it that disappointing.<br /><br />Overall, this screenplay far exceeded my expectations. I'm dying to see this play (but that's a far off dream) and kept envisioning what it would look like on stage as I read. Tbh I don't ever read books in screenplay format. I found it off-putting at first but got used to it and then even started enjoying it, it was a very quick and easy read (except for a scene involving polyjuice potion that got a little confusing haha) and something I know I'll read again and again. And now I'm left with the same devastated feeling I had when I finished Deathly Hallows. It's overrrrrrrr and it's time to return to reality D: I guess it's time for another reread :)</span>  <a data-text-id="2806896360121121017" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544060429">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544060429" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544060429u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span (Alright, alright, a <i>lot</i> of them.<a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Most importantly, when in the frickle frackle fUCK did Bellatrix manage to carry the Spawn of Voldy for ninth months in the midst of all those batshit crazy Death Eater shenanigans? No really, just hOW???? Also, <i>wHY?!?!</i> <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>)<br><br> Sure, I've read better fanfiction. (Bex-chan, anyone?)<br><br> Sure, it's just a play script. (One that causes me great agony in knowing I'll never get to expe</span>  <span id="freeText12671512012724007733" style="display:none">Two words: Scorpius. Malfoy.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1477858684i/21001368._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="400" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>↣ Sure, there were some loop holes. (Alright, alright, a <i>lot</i> of them.<a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Most importantly, when in the frickle frackle fUCK did Bellatrix manage to carry the Spawn of Voldy for ninth months in the midst of all those batshit crazy Death Eater shenanigans? No really, just hOW???? Also, <i>wHY?!?!</i> <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>)<br><br>↣ Sure, I've read better fanfiction. (Bex-chan, anyone?)<br><br>↣ Sure, it's just a play script. (One that causes me great agony in knowing I'll never get to experience it in person. *sniffle sniffle* Could you even <i>imagine</i> how they pull off any of the magic scenes? Completely blew my mind trying to visualize the act before my very eyes! It's the way this story's meant to be told, honestly.)<br><br>But I'd still rather have this than nothing at all, and getting to revisit my most precious characters and universe in the history of ever <i>  <b>in canon</b></i> is a gift my inner Potterhead can't deny.</["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544363434" />    <a title="Rose" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36179502-rose"><img alt="Rose" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477863078p2/36179502.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544363434?book_show_action=false">Aug 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Rose" class="user" name="Rose" href="/user/show/36179502-rose">Rose</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36179502-rose?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36179502-rose?shelf=2016-favorites">2016-favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544363434" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14971300450458233002"><blockquote> <b>DRACO:</b> Hermione Granger, I’m being bossed around by Hermione Granger. (<i>She turns towards him. He smiles.</i>) And I’m mildly enjoying it.</blockquote><br><b>[my dramione heart explodes]</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470249554ra/19906799.gif" width="auto" height="auto" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><blockquote> <b>RON:</b> Bloody hell.</blockquote><br>----------------------<br><br>I wrote a review for this and just had to delete it and restart because it was basically me ranting about <i>how much I fucking ship Draco and Hermione</i>.... <b>so there's that</b>. <br><br>But for real, <b>this whole book was basically Harry Potter fan fiction</b>. <i>And I loved every second</i>. Every time I think about the las</span>  <span id="freeText14971300450458233002" style="display:none"><blockquote><b>DRACO:</b> Hermione Granger, I’m being bossed around by Hermione Granger. (<i>She turns towards him. He smiles.</i>) And I’m mildly enjoying it.</blockquote><br><b>[my dramione heart explodes]</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470249554ra/19906799.gif" width="auto" height="auto" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><blockquote><b>RON:</b> Bloody hell.</blockquote><br>----------------------<br><br>I wrote a review for this and just had to delete it and restart because it was basically me ranting about <i>how much I fucking ship Draco and Hermione</i>.... <b>so there's that</b>. <br><br>But for real, <b>this whole book was basically Harry Potter fan fiction</b>. <i>And I loved every second</i>. Every time I think about the last book, my heart kinda hurts because it was such a bittersweet ending, you know? But this one just brought back all the *happiness and innocence* of the first book. <b>The whole crew was back together</b> and trying to defeat evil, only this time with more of my favorite characters included. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470252283ra/19907116.gif" width="auto" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>okay, but onto the spoilery bit: </b><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br><br>1.] <b>ALBUS GOT SORTED INTO SLYTHERIN.</b> AND I SCREAMED. <br><br>2.] <b>SCORPIUS, DRACO'S SON, IS A CUPCAKE.</b> He's so freaking adorable, kind, and such a good friend to Albus. <br><br>3.] <b>ALBUS HAD A CRUSH ON VOLDEMORT'S DAUGHTER.</b> FDKJGKJ. And Draco's son is in love with Hermione's daughter. CAN WE FUCKING JUST. <br><br>4.] <b>Snape breaks my heart once more: </b> <i>"Tell Albus — tell Albus Severus — I’m proud he carries my name. Now go. Go."</i><br><br>5.] <b>DRACO AND HARRY BATTLE IT OUT</b>... <i>AGAIN</i>. I think I was laughing the entire time while reading that, but it was pretty awesome tbh.<br><br>6.] Hermione is the Minister for Magic. <b>Boom.</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1464378554ra/19233988.gif" width="auto" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br> <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br><br>My heart is so happy because we got to see how happily everyone is now living. It has made me feel so at peace with the story, tbh. <b>BASICALLY IM AM SO IN LOVE WITH THIS BOOK.</b> <i>I am Harry Potter trash</i>, and will never stop wanting more from these characters.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470250123ra/19906871.gif" width="auto" height="auto" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="14971300450458233002" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="/user/show/18104163-navessa">Navessa</a>          marked it as to-read            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544261328" class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544261328">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544261328" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544261328u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544261328'><a id="like_count_review_1544261328" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544261328?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">120 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544261328" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544261328" ref="like" review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1544261328' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1544261328/comments?reverse=true">View all 3 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1715005566" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1715005566" />    <a title="Franco  Santos" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/29931457-franco-santos"><img alt="Franco  Santos" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472184998p2/29931457.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1715005566?book_show_action=false">Aug 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Franco  Santos" class="user" name="Franco  Santos" href="/user/show/29931457-franco-santos">Franco  Santos</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29931457-franco-santos?shelf=libros-en-digital">libros-en-digital</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29931457-franco-santos?shelf=le%C3%ADdos-en-ingl%C3%A9s">leídos-en-inglés</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1715005566" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer541178009315535551">Estuve pensándolo mejor y le voy a poner, finalmente, las tres estrellas. Es una nota más sincera con lo que opino de este chasco.<br /><br />Me esfuerzo a ver este libro como un delirio de Rowling, una manifestación de su lado fanático de su propia historia, una especie de proyecto para despertar los grititos estridentes de los lectores insaciables, pero no más que eso. Me niego a verlo como una continuación de la serie, porque, si lo viese así, esto resultaría ser una estafa. Si pensara en lo que he leído</span>  <span id="freeText541178009315535551" style="display:none">Estuve pensándolo mejor y le voy a poner, finalmente, las tres estrellas. Es una nota más sincera con lo que opino de este chasco.<br /><br />Me esfuerzo a ver este libro como un delirio de Rowling, una manifestación de su lado fanático de su propia historia, una especie de proyecto para despertar los grititos estridentes de los lectores insaciables, pero no más que eso. Me niego a verlo como una continuación de la serie, porque, si lo viese así, esto resultaría ser una estafa. Si pensara en lo que he leído en los anteriores siete libros teniendo en cuenta lo que sucede en este, me daría la sensación de que todo lo que pasó a lo largo de aquellos siete libros carece de valor real. La profundidad de <i>Harry Potter</i> se terminaría transformando en un relato superficial y merecedor de mi más intensa rabieta de niño de siete años.<br /><br />Con el paso de los años, <i>Harry Potter</i> se ha ido transformando en una enfermedad pandémica que tiene como principal síntoma la incapacidad de decir adiós a lo que nos ha dado tanta felicidad. No podemos dar por hecho que todo tiene su fin y que hay que aceptarlo. Tenemos que lanzar teorías disparatadas con asiduidad para seguir dándole bombo a una saga que es excelente así como está. Y Rowling, para mí erróneamente, se ha unido al club que se encarga de responder la pregunta "¿qué podría estar pasando ahora en la vida de Harry Potter?". Las elucubraciones entusiastas de la criatura adolescente y chillona (¿y codiciosa?) que habita en el cuerpo de la autora concibió este libro que no debería haberse publicado.<br /><br />No está de más hacer notar el infantilismo. Jamás me pude tomar en serio lo que sucedía. En la única parte que sentí como real lo que pasaba fue en el final, que, sí, lo admito, me conmovió. No obstante, el argumento me resultó forzado y plagado de errores. No sigue una línea coherente y fracasa en hacer verosímiles los hechos. Rowling (y Jack Thorne, lo sé, pero Rowling es la responsable de su historia) hizo algo muy arriesgado, y lamentablemente le salió mal. Si <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> hubiese sido más simple —y más corto—, no tengo dudas de que habría funcionado a la perfección.<br /><br />No me quiero olvidar de los personajes. En este libro los personajes que me eran tan preciados fueron sometidos a un recorte descuidado de su tridimensionalidad. Quizá esto se deba al formato de guion, pero asimismo sus diálogos y lo que se entreveía de sus reacciones me resultaron falsos y endebles. También es evidente, en un intento de tocar las fibras sensibles del lector, el abuso de la emoción y la sensiblería en sus relaciones, y eso le quitó el atractivo a las partes auténticamente sentimentales. Prefiero quedarme con los recuerdos de los personajes que leí en los anteriores libros, no con estas copias quebradizas. <br /><br />Pero no todo es queja. Como dije al principio, veo a esta obra como una historia separada de la saga original; me rehúso a anexarla a las brillantes anteriores entregas. No son congruentes. <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> es un sueño compartido de J. K. Rowling y sus admiradores insatisfechos, un sueño que se rompe en mil pedazos cuando se termina de leer la última página. Tomo este libro como una muy buena historia sobre la amistad, los temores de un padre con su hijo y que me hizo sentir, obviamente, la nostalgia del reencuentro. <br /><br />En fin. No es un libro malo, pero es innecesario. Me duele decir que esta sobreexplotación de la historia hizo más mal que bien. No puedo recomendar leerlo. Como libro aislado está bastante bueno, pero no esperen algo de calidad. <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> es adictivo, entretenido, tiene giros sorprendentes (al menos yo no los vi venir) y es muy probable que te conmueva, no obstante, arruina un poco, irónicamente, la magia de la saga.</span>  <a data-text-id="541178009315535551" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1715005566">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1715005566" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1715005566u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1715005566'><a id="like_count_review_1715005566" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1715005566?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">119 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1715005566" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1715005566" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=119u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=2u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1715005566u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1715005566" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1715005566, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">30 comments</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1715005566?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=2">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1715005566' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1715005566/comments?reverse=true">View all 30 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_155638293" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Luna Fany" href="/user/show/17723404-luna-fany"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442797545p1/17723404.jpg" alt="17723404" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/17723404-luna-fany">Luna Fany</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer9934210815985305811">Soy yo o acabo de leer un fanfic? </span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Aug 16, 2016 08:38PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_157590498" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Flor" href="/user/show/4308472-flor"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1419996496p1/4308472.jpg" alt="4308472" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/4308472-flor">Flor</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer12007655255718078787">Me vine para acá, para ver que andaba diciendo la gente sobre este libro. Desde que me enteré que iba a salir, que entré en una especie de negación.</span>  <span id="freeText12007655255718078787" style="display:none">Me vine para acá, para ver que andaba diciendo la gente sobre este libro. Desde que me enteré que iba a salir, que entré en una especie de negación. Es como vos decís; es la imposibilidad de aceptar que algo se terminó. Todavía tengo mis problemas dándole cierre a esta historia, antes releía y volvía a ver las películas varias veces, pero tanto con el último libro como con las últimas películas, no pude hacerlo. El punto es, al ver que salió este libro, no tuve ningún impulso de leerlo, y me pasa con la nueva película de Animales fantásticos, no me muero por verlo, no se me pone la piel de gallina, nada. Siento que es remover algo que ya está, que fue genial, perfecto y emocionante. Pero bueno, el bichito de la curiosidad pica, y ahora, viendo los comentarios, me dan ganas de leer esta nueva entrega. No sé que va a ganar. Mi parte sentimentaloide, la cuirosidad. Ya veremos. <br /><br />Por cierto, muy buen review. Siento que si lo leo voy a opinar algo mas o menos así de todas formas.</span>  <a data-text-id="12007655255718078787" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/> return false;">4 comments</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1652864139?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=2">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1652864139' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1652864139/comments?reverse=true">View all 4 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_155040859" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Cat " href="/user/show/45743484-cat"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473441311p1/45743484.jpg" alt="45743484" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/45743484-cat">Cat </a>      <span id="freeTextContainer1449670475518420430">Are you going to do a video review for this? I'm really curious to hear why it had such a low rating</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Aug 02, 2016 09:32AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_155044418" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Drew" href="/user/show/27179072-drew"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477082834p1/27179072.jpg" alt="27179072" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/27179072-drew">Drew</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer9201849411713048076">I was a little confuse on who Craig was. But, I think I know now.</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Aug 02, 2016 11:05AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1652864139' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1652864139, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544744661" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544744661" />    <a title="grace" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/32195256-grace"><img alt="grace" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1435349670p2/32195256.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544744661?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="grace" class="user" name="grace" href="/user/show/32195256-grace">grace</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544744661" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10646802521359419831">I haven't given a book a 1 star in over a year. This was just...what even!?!? How was this allowed? I don't like that it gets the title as the 8th book. The only thing I remotely enjoyed was Scorpius. So incredibly bummed right now. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544744661">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544744661" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544744661u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544744661'><a id="like_count_review_1544744661" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544744661?resource_type=Review"><span </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1545376895" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1545376895" />    <a title="Brad" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4213258-brad"><img alt="Brad" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445016710p2/4213258.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1545376895?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Brad" class="user" name="Brad" href="/user/show/4213258-brad">Brad</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4213258-brad?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4213258-brad?shelf=2016-shelf">2016-shelf</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545376895" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2142927496857834985">Aaaaand... Read. :)<br /><br />How was it? Was it everything I'd hoped it would be? Potterfan that I am?<br /><br />Hell yeah. Sure, if you all want something edgy, look elsewhere. No hot slant fiction here. This is a great buddy, father-son, father-daughter fiction. It easily fits into the cannon, with tons of revisited scenes from the originals in the form of dreams and timey-wimey stuff, but there's a reason for all of that and it's not a lack of imagination. At this point, it's both nostalgia and crazy emotional cr</span>  <span id="freeText2142927496857834985" style="display:none">Aaaaand... Read. :)<br /><br />How was it? Was it everything I'd hoped it would be? Potterfan that I am?<br /><br />Hell yeah. Sure, if you all want something edgy, look elsewhere. No hot slant fiction here. This is a great buddy, father-son, father-daughter fiction. It easily fits into the cannon, with tons of revisited scenes from the originals in the form of dreams and timey-wimey stuff, but there's a reason for all of that and it's not a lack of imagination. At this point, it's both nostalgia and crazy emotional crap for the poor kids of Harry and Draco, who just happen to be best buds. Gotta love the drama around those households when the parents get into their shit, right?<br /><br />What's surprising is how much of a pain it is being the sons of these particular famous peeps, and just how much it turns them into loners and losers and misunderstood outcasts, and therefore ripe for our sympathy. It's a tried and true method, even for Rowling, but it's no less effective here than it was for Harry. It's odd how the same sins are always revisited, right? Well it's true across time and surrogate parentages and all the mistakes that everyone keeps making despite the very best of intentions.<br /><br />The drama is pure. <br /><br />And if you're worried that there won't be enough magic and excitement and NUTSO altered realities on huge scales and truly horrific reversals, then just relax and get very anxious, because I sat on the edge of my seat as I saw this play performed in my mind. :)<br /><br />Will I scream bloody murder if this doesn't get made into a movie down the line after the play-cycle has ended?<br /><br />Yes. Yes I will. It's a good Harry Potter book, damn it. It changes the meanings of books 3 and book 4 in their interpretations and their importance. It makes me want to do another close read of them to pick out the pieces and see where they tie back into the play. :) There's some pretty cool nit-picky stuff here for us, folks. I'm loving the easter eggs.<br /><br />Satisfying? Very much so. Fathers and father figures were always big in the series and it's even better now with Albus and Harry. I got all teary. :)<br /><br />Don't worry about all the haters. This stuff is good. :) </span>  <a data-text-id="2142927496857834985" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1545376895">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1545376895" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1545376895u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1545376895'><a id="like_count_review_1545376895" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1545376895?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">121 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1545376895" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1545376895" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=121u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=2u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1545376895u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1545376895" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1545376895, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;);      <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544772885" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544772885u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544772885'><a id="like_count_review_1544772885" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544772885?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">114 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544772885" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544772885" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=114u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=2u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1544772885u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span href="/review/show/1544772885?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=2">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1544772885' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1544772885/comments?reverse=true">View all 13 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1544772885' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1544772885, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1543937513" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543937513" />    <a title="Melanie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3030788-melanie"><img alt="Melanie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474399332p2/3030788.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543937513?book_show_action=false">Aug 11, 2016</a>      <a title="Melanie" class="user" name="Melanie" href="/user/show/3030788-melanie">Melanie</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=witches">witches</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3030788-melanie?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543937513" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8757579469680072589">I want to rate this book five stars and I want to rate this book one star.<br><br><blockquote> <b> <i>“When spares are spared, when time is turned, when unseen children murder their fathers: Then will the Dark Lord return.”</i> </b> </blockquote><br><i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> is a script from <a href="http://www.harrypottertheplay.com/" rel="nofollow">the play</a> (currently only playing in London) that stars Albus Potter, Harry and Ginny's middle child, and his best friend, Scorpius Malfoy. Obviously we are not used to those last names being friends, let alone best friends, but their friendship is th</span>  <span id="freeText8757579469680072589" style="display:none">I want to rate this book five stars and I want to rate this book one star.<br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>“When spares are spared, when time is turned, when unseen children murder their fathers: Then will the Dark Lord return.”</i>  </b></blockquote><br><i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> is a script from <a href="http://www.harrypottertheplay.com/" rel="nofollow">the play</a> (currently only playing in London) that stars Albus Potter, Harry and Ginny's middle child, and his best friend, Scorpius Malfoy. Obviously we are not used to those last names being friends, let alone best friends, but their friendship is the best thing about this story. <br><br>The second best thing is seeing Slytherin in a positive light. We, so far, have only read thing in this series that star Gryffindor's golden child. Reading other perspectives and representations of Hogwarts houses was amazing, and I wish we could get a lot more of it. <br><br>I was hesitant when I found out this script was going to be released as a book. All around me, everyone was jumping up and down, squealing with excitement. I was just going over in my head all the things that could go wrong. The Harry Potter series was perfect, and I didn't want a dark cloud looming over what I consider my childhood.<br><br>I still went to the midnight release party (shout out to Henderson, NV's Barnes u0026amp; Noble for being absolutely amazing, and throwing together an equally amazing and organized event!), I still felt like a kid on Christmas, I still got extremely emotional when actually purchasing this book, I still took a selfie and posted it on all my social media outlets, because I was so thankful to be able to go to a midnight release party that celebrates my favorite books of all time. Especially when I believed there would never be another midnight release after <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/80584156">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows </a> in 2007.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1469957532i/19874541._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The Harry Potter magic is still alive and I was holding it with my own two hands. Every page I turned in Act One was like returning to the best place on Earth. I was even more emotional while reading and I had to stop myself every few pages just to collect my feelings. This, this magic I can't describe, is why I want to give this book five stars. No other series in the world can do this and it's not all about the nostalgia factor. Harry Potter is truly magic, and that magic deserves all the stars in the world.<br><br>I'm sorry, but the rest of this review is going to be filled with <b>*SPOILERS*</b>. I'm really not sure how to express my feelings without talking about major plot (or lack thereof) points. <br><br>The biggest issue I need to address, and hope I'm not alone with this feeling, is that <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> felt like the biggest queer bait in the entire world. This feeling wasn't brought about from me just hoping, there is so much subtext to help establish that Albus and Scorpius had something more than friendship. The evidence was so overwhelming, I was completely convinced and, more importantly, happy that J.K. Rowling was finally giving us something more than "oh, Dumbledore was gay". But alas, the entire book makes you believe these two were in love and it's for nothing. This was <i>by far</i> my biggest disappointment in this book.<br><br>My next biggest disappointment was the fact that Harry Potter was an asshole. Like, a really big asshole. The way he spoke to McGonagall, when trying to force her to monitor his child's every movement, left me speechless. I wanted to stop reading the book right then and there.<br><br>And that terrible conversation came <i>after</i> he already said an unforgivable comment to Albus. I am not a mother, even though I hope to one day be one, but I can't imagine, under any circumstance, would I ever tell my child I wish they weren't my child. What a horrible thing to say, that is completely filled with hate. This is the boy I watched grow up and become to the most powerful wizard of all time, while learning lesson after lesson of how to be a good person? I was dumbfounded. <br><br>But you want to know who was a good father? Draco Malfoy. God, what I would give to read J.K. Rowling canon of Astoria Malfoy, who was able to help shape Draco and Scorpius into the men they are in this play. Draco showed such exponential growth, not only in this script, but since his time at Hogwarts. Such a wonderful character, and <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> portrayed him spectacularly. Oh, and he totally saved the day. <br><br>The other character I liked a lot was Delphi. I'm going to guess others will not feel this way, because Delphi feels like the biggest fan-fiction thing about this book, but I still enjoyed it. For those of you who are masochist and are spoiling themselves by reading my review, Delphi is Voldemort and Bellatrix Lestrange's love child. Now, I know that this timeline feels questionable, because Delphi was supposed to be born before the Battle of Hogwarts, but I still let it slide and just enjoyed the "surprise". I also felt a great deal of empathy for Delphi. I think Act Four in Godric's Hollow was so sad for her, because all she wanted was to have her dad and have him be proud of her. Like, I know she was going to ruin the world, but her reasoning really resonated inside me, and I could understand her pain and desperation.<br><br>I was not expecting Cedric Diggory to play such a major role in this story. As much as I love <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/80584165">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a>, I wasn't crazy about this plot line. I just seemed like a convenient plot they could manipulate into making people feel that Harry Potter nostalgia. <br><br>Speaking of convenient plots, I felt like the time turners were <i>also</i> too convenient. It worked amazing for <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/80584162">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a>, but it felt so wrong here. I hated this plot device, and I have to assume that time turners are all different, because the two in this book didn't work the same as the one in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/80584162">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a>. I didn't like it at all, and I couldn't stop thinking about how freaking dangerous these things are, and how no one has used them in nineteen years, but all of a sudden the Potters have access to two? Talk about a big ass grey area plot point.<br><br><u>Other things that felt horrible:</u><br>-Dumbledore and Harry confessing their love to one another. Like, can you guys not? It felt so forced and awkward. I hated everything about that scene, which could have been a beautiful moment had it happened in the actual series and not nineteen years later.<br>-No one even talking about Teddy Lupin! Like, I've already said Harry was acting like a shitty father in this book; I shouldn't be surprised if he's a shitty godfather as well. <br>-Getting to see Lily get sorted, but no mention of Hugo's sorting. It felt so weird for them to say his name a couple of times, but get nothing about his character. I understand his last name isn't Potter, so he isn't as important to this world, but he felt so neglected to me. <br>-How unlikable Rose, Ron and Hermione's child, was. <br>-The Trolley Witch. Like, what the fuck did I just read? <br>-The baby Harry's blanket. Like, did they sneak into the house and steal baby Harry's blanket so they could write a message on it for present-day Harry? I am not too convinced that Lily and James wouldn't have seen them, since they literally sacrifice themselves to protect Harry a few hours later. <br><br>So why am I giving this book, that I just ripped apart with my review, five stars? Because <b>Act One of this play brought me more joy than any other book has in nine years</b>. Yes, I am disappointed and, yes, I will agree that the majority of this felt like fan-fiction, but I can't even put into words what small parts of this script did to me. I feel so thankful and so blessed that I was able to peak inside this world that was such a big reason for my happiness growing up. And in this world, that unconditional love and happiness deserve more than five stars. <br><br>I'm sorry if this review is all over the place with things I liked and didn't like. I completely apologize if this seems really unorganized to you. I literally just sat down and starting typing all my feelings out and ended up having this cathartic experience. I completely understand the plot holes, and I hope I've listed all the major ones, and I understand that many of these characters that I grew up with were not acting like themselves. I also understand that I'm choosing to ignore a lot of these things, because, honestly, mostly nostalgia. I understand these one star reviews, and if I could separate myself from all the things that Harry Potter means to me, I probably wouldn't give this a five star rating. <br><br><a href="https://meltotheany.wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">Blog</a> | <a href="https://www.twitter.com/meltotheany" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a> | <a href="http://meltotheany.tumblr.com/" rel="nofollow">Tumblr</a> | <a href="https://www.instagram.com/meltotheany/" rel="nofollow">Instagram</a> | <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4RbHEg_fH6CewJrh_0xJ9g" rel="nofollow">Youtube</a> | <a href="http://www.twitch.tv/meltotheany/profile" rel="nofollow">Twitch</a></span>  <a data-text-id="8757579469680072589" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1543937513">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1543937513" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1543937513u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1543937513'><a id="like_count_review_1543937513" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1543937513?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">109 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1543937513" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1543937513" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=109u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=2u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1543937513u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1543937513" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1543937513, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;);
