elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1546830234" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1546830234" />    <a title="jamieson" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7706640-jamieson"><img alt="jamieson" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478436535p2/7706640.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1546830234?book_show_action=false">Nov 07, 2016</a>      <a title="jamieson" class="user" name="jamieson" href="/user/show/7706640-jamieson">jamieson</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781338099133" href="/book/show/29069989-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-parts-1-2">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=drama">drama</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=overhyped">overhyped</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=owned-books">owned-books</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1546830234" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5891451817973189966"><i> <blockquote>“Love blinds. We have both tried to give our sons, not what they needed, but what we needed. We’ve been so busy trying to rewrite our own pasts, we’ve blighted their present.” </blockquote> </i><br><br>So I did it. The book that has been hurting my poor, Harry Potter loving heart since it's release last month. Honestly, I don't know how to feel. <br><br>I went into this with very low expectations. I've read the spoilers, I've seen the reviews. I've seen so many criticisms of this, of J.K, of the writing the plot the characters</span>  <span id="freeText5891451817973189966" style="display:none"><i>  <blockquote>“Love blinds. We have both tried to give our sons, not what they needed, but what we needed. We’ve been so busy trying to rewrite our own pasts, we’ve blighted their present.” </blockquote></i><br><br>So I did it. The book that has been hurting my poor, Harry Potter loving heart since it's release last month. Honestly, I don't know how to feel. <br><br>I went into this with very low expectations. I've read the spoilers, I've seen the reviews. I've seen so many criticisms of this, of J.K, of the writing the plot the characters. You name it - I've seen hate on it. <br><br>I think those criticism are founded. CURSED CHILD does not feel like the Harry Potter I grew up with. It doesn't feel like Hogwarts. It's all so wrong. It really does read like a fanfic. <br><br>The first thing that struck me was like - <b>Wow. Harry Potter and co. are OLD.</b> And I know this might be weird but it immediately disengaged me from them. Immediately I was unable to connect with them as I had before. When I read Harry Potter the first time he was a kid like me - I loved to go on adventures with him, to deal with the trials of school with him. His day to day life was relatable, I mean, I was a kid too. A kid who envied HIS childhood. <br>But I mean ?! 40 year old Harry. I can't roll with that. He's immediately unrelatable to me. Alot of dialogue from Harry / Ron / Hermione was them complaining about the hardships of being old. And it's just ?? It loses the magic. It immediately pulls the magical story of wizard schools and dragons and spells and potions into something so <i>incredibly mundane</i> and Harry Potter should never feel mundane.<br><br>The next thing that struck me was the characterization. These people are not the Harry, Ron, Hermione, Ginny, Draco ect. we grew up with. They're just not. In fact - half the time I was left wondering if Jack Thorne ever read the books - because these portrayals are soo movie. Ron was reduced to a wise-cracking fool who wasn't capable of anything. He felt like a weird stand-in for Fred and George Weasley. He didn't feel like Ron. <br>Hermione was just ? silly ? So many of the things she did were soo out of character. She was stupid, she bent for others, there was a part where she refused to defend Harry and Ron? (I'm sorry but Hermione ALWAYS defends them so smh). I just ? It was all wrong. <br><br>BUT THE BIGGEST ABOMINATION, the absolute heartbreak of this book resides in the charactersation of my <b>#1 son, Harry James Potter.</b> Now you listen here, Harry Potter is my child. I HAVE CRIED FOR THIS BOY TOO MANY TIMES. Ok ay I don't appreciate when people try to mess with his personality and call it Canon. This was not Harry Potter. His dialogue made no sense - it completely disregarded some of the fundamental aspects of his character. His respect ? gone. His sarcastic humour? gone. His unflinching bravery ? gone. His selflessness ? gone. Harry was SO RUDE, he was so mean !?! And so much of it didn't make sense. <br><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ He perpetrates rumours Scorp is Voldy's son even though he, as a child, had to also deal with terrible rumours and should sympathise. And WOULD sympathise since he's a sympathetic guy. The fact he hates Al for being a Slytherin. His treatment of McGonagall who's always been a friend/mentor to him and someone he deeply respects. His treatment of Albus with the whole map thing ?? THE FACT IT WAS EVEN SUGGESTED HE DIDN'T CARE ABOUT CEDRIC DYING. No no no no no no no no.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>the only bit I liked, when I was like ayy it's ma BOY was <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[when he wouldn't let anyone volunteer to take on Delphi like ofc he wasn't gonna let you guys this is Harry Potter  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> ALL IN ALL JACK THORNE GET UR GRUBBY HANDS OFF OF HARRY POTTER HE DIDN'T DESERVE THAT. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472311558ra/20179327.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><i>  <blockquote>“They were great men, with huge flaws, and you know what – those flaws almost made them greater.” </blockquote></i> <br><br>Ok. Plotwise. The plot is kind of fun, if you ignore the huge plot holes and failure to grasp some of the basics of the actual canon. I mean, the time travel aspect was fun, and if you try not to think about it too much and ignore all the crazy conveniences that popped up to move it along it does pass as a plausible plot.<br><br>But jokes because I DO think about it too much. <b> (PS. UNTAGGED SPOILERS FROM HERE ON OUT YOU'VE BEEN WARNED) </b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1394430890i/8852668._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>We'll start with the time turner, shall we? First of all - ok. I could accept it existed, I could allow myself that reach BUT THEN HERMIONE HIDING IT IN A BOOKCASE. wtf nooo. I mean, why tf even hide it with riddles that's ridiculous. Surely she's smarter then this (SHE IS SMARTER THEN THIS)<br><br>Going back in time to save Cedric ????<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472311370ra/20179299.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br> Again, surely Albus and Scorp are smarter than this. Clearly thats a terrible idea. Clearly its not going to work. This whole plot point was just such a stretch. I don't know why they thought it was a good idea. It wasn't and any decent, mildly intelligent wizard should know that. (I know that and I'm a goddamn muggle)<br><br>Okay. The fact that Cedric was so embarrassed it turned him evil ? wtf wtf JUST WHY. The fact he killed Neville and became a Death Eater. Can ! We ! Not ! Disrespect ! His ! Character ! Like ! This ! <br><br>Oooh boy! And we haven't even got into the big thing yet. Delphi . . . .. . fucking Delphi.. GOD just NO. I mean, first of all practically it doesn't even fit in with the canon timeline (Delphi was born @ Malfoy manor before the battle of hogwarts and yet Hermione/Ron/Harry were there before the battle with Bellatrix aND SHE WASN'T PREGNANT FOR SURE. Also, the insinuation Astoria was involved (possibly raped?) by Voldermort was .. really icky. ? I didn't like that at all. Anyway, all in all that whole thing was a mess. EVEN IF voldermort COULD have kids (which lbr he probs can't) Voldermort was never available to do that, he had no reason. ?!?! URGH JUST PLS STOP it was so bad. <br><br>Finally, I was really annoyed the villian was Voldermort yet again. I'm sorry but it's soo lazy. Could they have not thought up something new and funky fresh. It would have been refreshing. Voldermort coming back is So Tired and just destoys the entire point of 7 books. Voldermort is dead! Gone ! finished ! We didn't go on that horcrux hunt for nothing !!!!!! just urrrrrrgh<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472311370ra/20179300.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>okay other weird plot points. <br>Albus kissing his aunt ??? g ross. <br>The convenience of Draco HAPPENING to have another (flawless) time turner <br>The weird outbursts from Harry at Minerva?<br>The "Evil base" being in a wizards old people's home (what ) <br>TeDDY LUPIN WASN'T IN IT<br>Rose ? ? ? ?? Rose and Scorp ??? ( sorry but there's NO chemistry there and Al and Scorp are canon boyfriends) <br>The bit when they watch James/Lily die. The fact Harry is all 'I have to see it' even though he has seen it. Deathly Hallows. In extreme detail. It was just really uncomfortable to me. <br><br>THE BIT WHEN THE TRAIN LADY ATTACKED THEM WHAT WAS THAT WHAT THE ACTUAL HECK<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472311558ra/20179328.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>OTHER NOTE</b><br>I was also disappointed on an authorial level by J.K in this. Honestly, I was expecting more diversity. J.K champions diverse Lit on twitter, but lets be real she had a great oppurtunity to implement that and it fell through. TRUE, you can argue Hermione is black but it's not explicit so it doesn't mean anything. They could have made anyone more diverse. (The queerbaiting on Al and Scorp was REAL) but instead it's all "white and straight" and idk I'm just a bit disappointed in her for that. <br><br>-------------------------------------------<br><br><b>Ok. But what did I like ?</b><br><br>Okay. It is fun. In a fanfic kind of way it is a fun story. We should never consider this canon, but it is entertaining. I did read it in one day. And I'm damn willing to bet the stage is amazing. The stage directions and settings were really amazing and I think implemented this show would be, aesthetically, really nice. <br><br>I also appreciated Draco's redemption arc. That was nice, and you know what, deserved. I appreciated Snape's a little less, because I hate snape forever and always but if you're a fan I can see you'd appreciate that too. <br><br>I appreciated Ginny's take on being possessed and how NO ONE helped her after Chamber of Secrets .. which .. was true. I AM SO SHOOK ABOUT HOW RON SAID EVERYONE THOUGHT SHE'D BE A SLYTHERIN LIEK GODFUCKING DAMN YES YES BEAUTIFUL <br><br>I also quite liked Draco's little revelations about being jealous of the trio, and of not revealing Harry at Malfoy Manor which - ok yeah was solid work. <br><br>It was just everything else that was a mess. You cannot take this seriously because it wILL fall flat. But if you are able to detach yourself from the characters and try not to view them as the one's we know and love perhaps you'd really enjoy it. I'm not able to do that, however. Which is why I can't give this any more than a 3*. It deserves a 2, sentimentality makes me bump it up to a 2.5 and that's my FINAL RATING. <br><br><b>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child? 2.5*. Sorry, not sorry. </b><br><br><b>NOTE:</b> Sick of people telling me I didn't like this because it's a script. No. No I've read scripts before, I've read scripts and loved them. This isn't bad because it's a script. It's bad because it reduces our characters to uninspired tropes, because it's full of plot holes and because it's lazy. Bye !<br><br><br><br></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>            swapContent(lessLink);          }        });      });//]]></script>  <script type="text/javascript">  //<![CDATA[      var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');      var $copy;      if ($ratingGraph.length > 0) {          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');          $copy.find('script').remove();          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);      }  //]]>  </script></div><div id="bookReviews">    <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1547429268" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1547429268" />    <a title="Anja" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6054186-anja"><img alt="Anja" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1447346915p2/6054186.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1547429268?book_show_action=false">Aug 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Anja" class="user" name="Anja" href="/user/show/6054186-anja">Anja</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1547429268" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16449120684234787119"><b>*4 MAGICAL STARS*</b><br /><br /><i> <b>“Those we love never truly leave us, Harry. There are things that death cannot touch."</b> </i><br /><br />Ahhhh, it felt <b>so</b> good to be back in the <i>world of Witchcraft and Wizardry</i> after all this time.<br />I went into this basically without expectations because I <b>knew</b> this was a script for a play and it was probably going to be totally different from the original <i>Harry Potter</i> books, and it most definitely was. It was a totally different reading experience but I loved it nonetheless! I'm not a big fan o</span>  <span id="freeText16449120684234787119" style="display:none"><b>*4 MAGICAL STARS*</b><br /><br /><i>  <b>“Those we love never truly leave us, Harry. There are things that death cannot touch."</b></i><br /><br />Ahhhh, it felt <b>so</b> good to be back in the <i>world of Witchcraft and Wizardry</i> after all this time.<br />I went into this basically without expectations because I <b>knew</b> this was a script for a play and it was probably going to be totally different from the original <i>Harry Potter</i> books, and it most definitely was. It was a totally different reading experience but I loved it nonetheless! I'm not a big fan of the format but oh well, I'd do anything for a little bit more Harry Potter!<br /><br />Because of the format, this whole thing took some getting used to. You didn't get nearly enough <b>information</b> about the characters, especially the new ones we didn't already know from previous books. Because of that I had some trouble connecting to the characters, I kind of <i>disliked</i> Albus in the beginning, but Scorpius I immediately loved! <br /><br />There were also almost no <b>descriptions</b> of the scenery or the places the characters went to, like Hogwarts, Godric's End, the Ministry and so on. The only thing we read was what happened to the stage during the various scenes/acts. That also took some getting used to but that also meant we had to use our own imagination more, which isn't <i>necessarily</i> a bad thing.<br /><br /><i>Full review coming soon!</i></span>  <a data-text-id="16449120684234787119" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1722700079" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1722700079" />    <a title="Nayra.Hassan" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/44531801-nayra-hassan"><img alt="Nayra.Hassan" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453752005p2/44531801.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1722700079?book_show_action=false">Nov 23, 2016</a>      <a title="Nayra.Hassan" class="user" name="Nayra.Hassan" href="/user/show/44531801-nayra-hassan">Nayra.Hassan</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/29067264-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1722700079" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10632922994708007446">مهما كنت حذرا"سيصفعك الزمن في غفلة منك<br />فالأبناء أقوياء حقا..و صفعاتهم مؤلمة ..فهم كنز الآباء و خيبتهم<br />و مع تأرجح اصغر آلة سحرية للزمن ..ستتارجح أسئلة. .من هو الطفل الملعون ..حقا؟؟<br />بعد سبع ملاحم منحت للامومة و الصداقة مجدا غير مسبوق.. كان على رولينج ان تقدم ملحمة اخيرة عن الابوة<br />فلنطرح في البداية سؤال..ما الذي يجعل سيدة في عمري تتعلق بالسلسلة الى هذا الحد؟<br />هل انت ساحرة؟هل انت مراهقة؟هل انت يتيمة؟<br /><br />لا ،و لكن دائما كان صمود هاري الطفل اليتيم الفقير يخجلني..تحمله لعبء لا يطاق كان دائما ملهما"لي..الهمني خوض</span>  <span id="freeText10632922994708007446" style="display:none">مهما كنت حذرا"سيصفعك الزمن في غفلة منك<br />فالأبناء أقوياء حقا..و صفعاتهم مؤلمة ..فهم كنز الآباء و خيبتهم<br />و مع تأرجح اصغر آلة سحرية للزمن ..ستتارجح أسئلة. .من هو الطفل الملعون ..حقا؟؟<br />بعد سبع ملاحم منحت للامومة و الصداقة مجدا غير مسبوق.. كان على رولينج ان تقدم ملحمة اخيرة عن الابوة<br />فلنطرح في البداية سؤال..ما الذي يجعل سيدة في عمري تتعلق بالسلسلة الى هذا الحد؟<br />هل انت ساحرة؟هل انت مراهقة؟هل انت يتيمة؟<br /><br />لا ،و لكن دائما كان صمود هاري الطفل اليتيم الفقير يخجلني..تحمله لعبء لا يطاق كان دائما ملهما"لي..الهمني خوض بعض المعارك بدلا"من الهروب منها<br />دفعني للاستمرار مهما كانت الخسائر..لقد واجه شرا يسري حوله و في دمائه رغما عنه..و انتصر بنبل<br />و هذا كل ما نبغاه من الادب: الهام يمنحنا العزم <br /><br />اجمل و اسوأ ما في الزمن ،انه يمر بسرعة..<br />باسلوب مختلف و حبكة أثارت غيظ البعض.. مع نفس الاجواء المعتادة لهوجوارتس و تحت اسقفها وجوه حبيبة ..قديمة و جديدة و في احداث تدور بين 2016 الى 2020نواجه مع هاري اقسى معاركه..مع ابن متطلب صعب المراس..سحر مختلف ..زمن لا يرحم و..ماضي يأبى الزوال<br /><br />ا"كم مرة اكتشفت يا هاري ان الوقت كان ضدك؟<br />صعد الى اعلى المراتب و كذلك هيرميون و معهم رون..و لكن ها هو ابنه الاوسط الباس سيفروس بوتر"و يا له من عبء ثقيل يلقيه عليك الاسم يا بني!!..بينما انت تجسيد حي لمقولة "الولد لخاله"نعم :رون <br />تتذكرون غيرة رون و ثورته على هاري في الجزء الرابع والسابع..حسنا عندما وجد الباس نفسه خارج جريفندور.... <br />و اختار بقلبه صديقا ذكيا منبوذا من الجميع" سكوربيوس دراكو مالفوي " عندما اعتقد انه قد يكون عبئا على والده..او قد يخجله<br />..هنا خطرت على ذهنه هذه الجملة القاتلة"اذا عاد بي الزمن الى الوراء لفعلت و فعلت"و تبدأ الحماقات..و تتعدد الافتراضات السوداوية..و التي منحت المسرحية تشويقا خاصا<br /><br />الزمن قنديل فتيله الانجاز.. و السحر هنا لا يفعل المعجزات <br />ا"هاري كنت دائما اكثر من سعيد للتضحية بنفسك لاجل العالم باكمله.. لكن الباس يريد حبا مخصوصا"تهمس جيني<br />حسنا يا الباس بوتر..توترت منك كثيرا.. فقد شاءت ظروفك معي ان اكون في موقعك و موقع والدك ايضا<br />لقد نشات في ظل اب عبقري في مجاله مشغول دائما بجلائل الاعمال..لا يمنحني وقتا طويلا او فهما كثيرا ..و كذلك امي!!اهل ظللت انتحب؟ هل تملكتني الغيرة انني لست عبقرية؟ابدا..مثلي مثل جيمس و ليلي بوتر<br />قنعت بما يمنحه لي من ميزات..<br />و مثل هاري تماما ..صار لدى مراهقين فحاولت منحهم كل ما حرمت منه ..و لكن هل هذا ما ينقصهم حقا؟<br /><br />ماذا يعني ان تكون هاري بوتر؟ اهي نعمة ام "لعنة"؟سؤال حاولت رولينج و من معها الاجابة عنه بعد سنوات<br />..ان تقوم حرب كاملة بسببك ..قدرك جعلك النبوءة<br />منذ مقتل والدك.. و انت تخسر كل من حاول ان يكون لك ابا" سيريوس..دمبلدور...سناب..لوبين..رحلوا لتعيش <br /> ا"هل لاحظتم ان الكل يموت قتلا في هذه الملحمة..لا يوجد موت طبيعي او مرض ..فقط لعنات و تعاويذ قاتلة "ا<br /><br />الحب يعمينا..صدقت دمبلدور..اعمى حب هاري لابنه بصيرته احيانا..ابنه لم يرث منه الا اندفاعه..اخبره هاري: ا<br />ا"لقد فُرضت على المغامرات..و لم اسعى اليها"و لكن ظل الباس راكضا باصرار وراء ما فرضته عليه الاقدار <br /> "من خلال رحلات الباس و سكوربيوس و كنت اتمني حقا لو صحبتهم روز ابنة هرميون..اجابت رولينج على عدة اسئلة معلقة<br />..اعادت لنا دمبلدور كما لم يظهر من قبل..<br />سناب هل سيختار الخير ..دائما؟.. سيدريك ديجوري :ماذا لو عاش؟<br />دراكو مالفوى !!!اجبرته الوحدة على اختيار طريق الشر و لكنه هنا فاجأني كثيرا<br /><br />منذ البداية صنعت لنا رولينج رجل احلامها و منحته لنا جميعا..عبر سنوات صباه رايناه كيف تحول للبطل الاكثر كمالا في الادب الحديث حتى لو أكدت رولينج ان "المثالية بعيدة كل البعد عن ايدي البشر و بعيدة عن السحر ايضا"ا<br /> البعض يرى ان العودة انقصت من قدر هاري ومن معه<br />..و لكن لا<br />كان لابد ان يصل هاري للاربعين لتكتمل شخصيته..لنرى ما خلف الانتصارات من هزائم خفية و مرارات دائمة..و ضمائر مؤرقة<br />ا"لم يكن علي ان ابقى لقد كان قدري ان اموت.. و رغم كل شيء عشت! و كل هؤلاء رحلوا"ا<br /> و انا معك..فحياة بهذه القسوة لا تستحق بطل مثلك <br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="10632922994708007446" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1714375148" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1714375148" />    <a title="Aras Redan" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6377291-aras-redan"><img alt="Aras Redan" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1365327940p2/6377291.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714375148?book_show_action=false">Aug 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Aras Redan" class="user" name="Aras Redan" href="/user/show/6377291-aras-redan">Aras Redan</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6377291-aras-redan?shelf=bad-in-the-book-exchange">bad-in-the-book-exchange</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714375148" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5515197164315776094">SPOILERS AHEAD <br /><br />Okay so as far as I'm concerned, the events of this 'book' are not canon. Really the only reason why it's advertised as the eighth story is to make money. Plus the fact that it's not written by JK is another reason I'm not taking it seriously. Just because she endorsed it doesn't mean I have to. <br /><br />My biggest problem with this book is the awful characterisation. Everyone, I mean EVERYONE was out of character. First Hermione was too unrealistically mean to students just because she di</span>  <span id="freeText5515197164315776094" style="display:none">SPOILERS AHEAD <br /><br />Okay so as far as I'm concerned, the events of this 'book' are not canon. Really the only reason why it's advertised as the eighth story is to make money. Plus the fact that it's not written by JK is another reason I'm not taking it seriously. Just because she endorsed it doesn't mean I have to. <br /><br />My biggest problem with this book is the awful characterisation. Everyone, I mean EVERYONE was out of character. First Hermione was too unrealistically mean to students just because she didn't marry Ron, which would never happen. Hermione is a kind person regardless of her love life. And in the 'normal' world she just lacked so many things: her passion, her intelligence, her spark. Same with Ron. Ron was only there for comic relief. It was like Movie!Ron but ten times worse. None of his depth, fierce loyalty and intensity was there. And his humour wasn't even his humour. I don't think he said bloody or blimey once. <br /><br />And Harry, oh god. For starters the idea that he would be a bad father or force his son to stop being friends with another student because of his parentage is ludicrous. Also where was that Potter snark I know and love so much. There was just nothing, he was so two-dimensional. <br /><br />Hell even Snape's characterisation was a hot mess. <br /><br />Ginny and Draco weren't too bad, but I feel like that's just because we didn't see them enough in the books for me to be able to judge them properly in The Cursed Child. <br /><br />Then there was the plot which was just as ridiculous. In order to suit the plot, the rules of Time Turners were changed. Now you can go as far back as you want AND you can change what happens to affect the present which is a direct contradiction of what we learnt in the Prisoner of Azkaban. <br /><br />And Delphi, oh my god. What even was that? The mere fact that Voldemort supposedly had a child messed with his characterisation too. He would've never desired any sexual activity with anyone for that to even happen. Delphi herself was a very uninteresting character and she made the script seem very kiddish? <br /><br />Which is yet another thing that bothered me: The writing. The tone was so off for a Harry Potter book. There was no emotion or depth, no darkness even in the parts that were intended to be. I mean Voldemort Day? Really? The script was 90% comic relief with very bad humour. I just can't get over how childish the entire story felt. The fact that everyone was saying exactly what they were thinking was so odd. Like none of the characters are actually like that, but in order to suit the play format everyone was saying exactly how they felt and what they thought and it just didn't translate well at all.<br /><br />I feel like the only good things that came out of this script is Scorpius Malfoy and the cute Romione moments but they're not worth keeping this atrocity on my shelf. <br /><br />I was just massively disappointed with this. Even knowing how much of a trainwreck it was going to be because of spoilers, I still went in hopeful,but it was just not reminiscent of any of the Harry Potters books. <br /><br />Sidenote: Albus Severus Potter kissed Hermione Granger and that was all sorts of fucked up. <br /><br />Now I need to find a way to Obliviate it from my mind. </span>  <a data-text-id="5515197164315776094" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1728535508" />    <a title="Rachel Reads Ravenously" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously"><img alt="Rachel Reads Ravenously" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476518708p2/14514998.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1728535508?book_show_action=false">Aug 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Rachel Reads Ravenously" class="user" name="Rachel Reads Ravenously" href="/user/show/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously">Rachel Reads Ravenously</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781338099133" href="/book/show/29069989-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-parts-1-2">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=library-checkout">library-checkout</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=ya-fantasy">ya-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=hardcover">hardcover</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=august-2016">august-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1728535508" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13179854240498604931">3.5 stars<br><br>So I am a huge Harry Potter fan, I grew up with the series, became an adult when the characters did. This is a series that affected my life. I wasn't eager to read this book as some HP fans were because it wasn't really written by Rowling, so I honestly didn't get the big deal. Yes, she was involved and it's based on her story but it's not another Harry Potter novel, at least not to me. <br><br>I enjoyed the plot, seeing where all of our favorites ended up and the introduction of new characters</span>  <span id="freeText13179854240498604931" style="display:none">3.5 stars<br><br>So I am a huge Harry Potter fan, I grew up with the series, became an adult when the characters did. This is a series that affected my life. I wasn't eager to read this book as some HP fans were because it wasn't really written by Rowling, so I honestly didn't get the big deal. Yes, she was involved and it's based on her story but it's not another Harry Potter novel, at least not to me. <br><br>I enjoyed the plot, seeing where all of our favorites ended up and the introduction of new characters. Scorpious was probably the best part of the book. I can't say much without spoilers, but I liked the idea of how the past can affect the present and how little moments can change the course of the future.<br><br>But overall, I wasn't in love with this book. I'd like to see a production, but I wish it hadn't been published as a play and instead as a story JK Rowling wrote herself. There were several awkward moments written in the play's instructions that I had long pauses at. And mostly I wish Ron hadn't been turned into a bumbling idiot. That and I felt it dragged on a little bit too much. Near the end there was a plot twist that came out of left field and the explanation even more bizarre.<br><br>Overall like I said I enjoyed it (but I can't talk about what I enjoyed because SPOILERS). But ultimately this book just made me want to reread the originals. <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1455783307i/18148833._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="13179854240498604931" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1728535508">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1728535508" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1728535508u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1728535508'><a id="like_count_review_1728535508" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1728535508?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">52 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1728535508" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1728535508" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=52u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1728535508u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1728535508" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1728535508, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1586150884" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1586150884" />    <a title="Jenna Major" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/14772037-jenna-major"><img alt="Jenna Major" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470348110p2/14772037.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1586150884?book_show_action=false">Nov 23, 2016</a>      <a title="Jenna Major" class="user" name="Jenna Major" href="/user/show/14772037-jenna-major">Jenna Major</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">EVERY HARRY POTTER FAN</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14772037-jenna-major?shelf=2016-reads">2016-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14772037-jenna-major?shelf=fantasy-reads">fantasy-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14772037-jenna-major?shelf=4-star-books">4-star-books</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1586150884" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9108801599631861106"><b>!!BLIMEY!!</b><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470085891ra/19887023.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>That went by so quickly but wonderfully.</b><br>I am an avid fan of scriptwriting and plays so this change in format did not phase me. I have READ many negative reviews but <b>shame on you if you thought these PLAYS were going to be written like the previous 7 novels. </b> There is definitely a different mood and feel to it, but that should have been EXPECTED. It is a different format meant for performance. If you are feeling this way when you are reading it, try to picture the performance in your he</span>  <span id="freeText9108801599631861106" style="display:none"><b>!!BLIMEY!!</b><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470085891ra/19887023.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>That went by so quickly but wonderfully.</b><br>I am an avid fan of scriptwriting and plays so this change in format did not phase me. I have READ many negative reviews but <b>shame on you if you thought these PLAYS were going to be written like the previous 7 novels. </b> There is definitely a different mood and feel to it, but that should have been EXPECTED. It is a different format meant for performance. If you are feeling this way when you are reading it, try to picture the performance in your head, it might help you process what it is supposed to be like. Personally, I loved it. I dove into the 2 plays with such fervor. I dove in headfirst and it met my expectations and more. I must say I loved the character dynamics, comedic attributes and I really respected the way Rowling approached the intertwining of the new generation with the old.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470085891ra/19887024.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Overall I gave these scripts 5/5 stars as it rose above my expectations and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I REALLY WOULD LOVE TO SEE THE TWO PLAYS PERFORMED WITH THE ORIGINAL CAST but sadly that probably won't happen since I live in Canada.</b><br><br><b> The next part of my review will contain SPOILERS so fair warning!!!</b><br><br>I would first like to discuss the questions, observations and little disappointments I had while reading. I was disappointed that it no where mentioned or brought up the fact that Neville could have also fulfilled the prophecy. I was questioning why George was never mentioned, especially since Ron is now helping run the joke shop. Where is Teddy Lupin????? I know he wasn't really relevant to the story line but I would have loved to read SOMETHING about how he is doing, it would have been nice. <br>Near the end of the play, Harry faces off against Voldemort's daughter and he... SUCKS. He is terrible. <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1388185797ra/7757855.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"> Yes Harry there was some hardcore judgement there. BECAUSE YOU SUCKED. YOU SHOULD HAVE BEEN GOOD. We read the 7 books with Harry as our protagonist and as a good wizard. I get that the point the curse child was trying to make was that he was never alone, he always had help. They could have done this without completely trashing Harry's magical abilities. He could have held out longer in the duel or showed some sort of knowledge/experience!!!! He unfortunately was extremely lacking in that department. <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1475077190i/20678370.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Which was extremely frustrating to read.<br>There were a lot of plot holes, but we must keep in mind that this is a PLAY and not full fledged novel.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467032496ra/19543120.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>My number one praise WAS HOW FUNNY IT WAS!! Of course since it's written as a play, there was more comedic elements and I loved it! Every thing Ron said was hilarious. Also when Albus took the polyjuice potion and was pretending to be Ron. Then Scorpious pointed out he kissed Hermione like 5 times, Albus just stated that Ron was 'an affectionate guy'. I thought that was hilarious.<br>SCORPIUS AND ALBUS THO! I loved their characters<br>Sidenote: I also thought they would be gay and become a couple, I felt that vibe but it never went that way.<br>Scorpius Malfoy was undoubtedly my favorite character in the scripts. <br>In the original 7 novels, I actually really liked Malfoy as a character and was really proud to have the other characters recognize is aptitude and respect him as a person. <br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470086670ra/19887146.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>sidenote #2: I got a picture with Tom Felton (who is one my celebrity crushes) I will put it below BECAUSE LOVE.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470086670i/19887147._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>I also have a picture with the Phelps twins and Rupert Grint but I won't bug you all by putting those here too.<br>I have so many positive things to say, but they aren't coming to mind this moment. I will just say that I loved it and I hope you guys did too! You can message me if you want to discuss certain moments or comment! Obviously I love reading and would love to discuss this instalment!</span>  <a data-text-id="9108801599631861106" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1672276099" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1672276099" />    <a title="Brian Murray" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10090461-brian-murray"><img alt="Brian Murray" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1429580433p2/10090461.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1672276099?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Brian Murray" class="user" name="Brian Murray" href="/user/show/10090461-brian-murray">Brian Murray</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10090461-brian-murray?shelf=drama">drama</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10090461-brian-murray?shelf=21st-century">21st-century</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10090461-brian-murray?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10090461-brian-murray?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10090461-brian-murray?shelf=children">children</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1672276099" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12621743135997104318">1.5<br /><br />It is plain and simple: this is not "Harry Potter."<br /><br />The Eighth Story. Nineteen Years Later. Everything has heralded this as the return to the Harry Potter saga. You want it back. The characters. The story. The magic. But it is just not there.<br /><br />This review will naturally be spoiler free. So forgive me for being vague.<br /><br />It starts off well enough. We begin right where we left off. It's exciting. Through the opening conflicts, I was excited to see what this new generation had in store. It wasn't as gr</span>  <span id="freeText12621743135997104318" style="display:none">1.5<br /><br />It is plain and simple: this is not "Harry Potter."<br /><br />The Eighth Story. Nineteen Years Later. Everything has heralded this as the return to the Harry Potter saga. You want it back. The characters. The story. The magic. But it is just not there.<br /><br />This review will naturally be spoiler free. So forgive me for being vague.<br /><br />It starts off well enough. We begin right where we left off. It's exciting. Through the opening conflicts, I was excited to see what this new generation had in store. It wasn't as great as the books. You don't have Rowling's effortless writing or the wealth of following the exact same characters, but this is the wizarding world. In a 5.5 hour play, there are so many possibilities ahead.<br /><br />Then it quickly nosedives into a tired and ridiculous plot. The Harry Potter series is full of enchanting and original adventure. Everything here, though, is too...easy. We retread familiar plots (both Potter and other). The scenes and character dynamics are predictable. There was no ingenuity or imagination here. I never felt joy. That was heartbreaking.<br /><br />But there are some diamonds in the rough here. For example, Scorpius Malfoy is an original, complex, and utterly "Rowling-esque" character. He fits right in to the world she has created over seven books. And towards the end, despite the play's steady decline into absurdity, there are some genuine and unexpected moments of pathos. I teared up a bit.<br /><br />But why? Was it because this play created an emotional build? Did I become attached to these characters? No. It was nostalgia. Nothing else. <br /><br />And that is the ultimate fault of this play. It never aims to work on its own. Each of Rowling's books have been able to stand on their own. They are each satisfying. They continue a larger narrative without sacrificing telling one, good story at a time. And this play has no interest in independence. It hopes to capture all the magic, emotion, and themes of Rowling's original work. But it just doesn't know how.<br /><br />So, this is an unfortunate disappointment. This is not "the eighth story," and honestly, we never needed one. Some things are just more magical when left to the imagination.<br /><br />Update:<br />I read this very quickly, so I did not get to digest the story while reading. I still stand by all the comments I made, but at the same time, I think I am going to reread it at some point this year to see if anything changes for me down the line.</span>  <a data-text-id="12621743135997104318" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1721356051" />    <a title="Gorgona Grim" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/17672459-gorgona-grim"><img alt="Gorgona Grim" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473005143p2/17672459.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1721356051?book_show_action=false">Sep 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Gorgona Grim" class="user" name="Gorgona Grim" href="/user/show/17672459-gorgona-grim">Gorgona Grim</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9786127498500" href="/book/show/31361778-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-i-and-ii">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1721356051" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16266401820730913441">Imala sam nekoliko pretpostavki oko toga šta bi mogla biti tema nove knjige u serijalu koji je zaokružen i završen na najbolji mogući način. Naznaku smo dobili na kraju sedme knjige i očekivano, osma počinje ponovljenim poglavljem. Sa informacijama koje sam imala pre čitanja, a to je da je nova priča zapravo pozorišni komad koji će biti izveden u Londonu i da će stoga knjiga imati formu scenarija, moje pretpostavke su počivale na izvesnosti da će se radnja bazirati na prošlim događajima, a da će</span>  <span id="freeText16266401820730913441" style="display:none">Imala sam nekoliko pretpostavki oko toga šta bi mogla biti tema nove knjige u serijalu koji je zaokružen i završen na najbolji mogući način. Naznaku smo dobili na kraju sedme knjige i očekivano, osma počinje ponovljenim poglavljem. Sa informacijama koje sam imala pre čitanja, a to je da je nova priča zapravo pozorišni komad koji će biti izveden u Londonu i da će stoga knjiga imati formu scenarija, moje pretpostavke su počivale na izvesnosti da će se radnja bazirati na prošlim događajima, a da će nosilac radnje biti Hari koji prepričava svoje događaje Albusu i Lili.<br /><br />Iskreno me je iznenadio zaplet jer sam negde u svojim mislima otpisala takvu mogućnost kao previše laku i očiglednu opciju. Onog trenutka kada sam prihvatila takav sled događaja, počela sam da uživam u priči i likovima koji su mi pomalo nedostajali. Ipak, oduševljenje je izostalo, a sam kraj mi je bio donekle mlak i neuverljiv. Ono što ovu priču izdvaja od prosečnosti su prikazani likovi Albusa i Skorpijusa koji su pokazali veličinu koja je krasila sve likove u serijalu, a koja je kulminirala kroz njihovo drugarstvo.<br /><br />Ostaje žal za pozorišnom predstavom koju verovatno (<i>sigurno, nažalost</i>) neću pogledati, iako me jako zanima kako su postavili celu predstavu sa svim "začkoljicama" koje radnja nosi sa sobom. Više o predstavi (zapravo, o predstavama) može se saznati ovde <a target="_blank" href="http://www.digitalspy.com/showbiz/harry-potter/feature/a655261/everything-you-need-to-know-about-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-opening-date-tickets-plot-and-more/" rel="nofollow">http://www.digitalspy.com/showbiz/har...</a> </span>  <a data-text-id="16266401820730913441" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1545040389" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1545040389" />    <a title="Kjell" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27949612-kjell"><img alt="Kjell" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475378869p2/27949612.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1545040389?book_show_action=false">Aug 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Kjell" class="user" name="Kjell" href="/user/show/27949612-kjell">Kjell</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27949612-kjell?shelf=read-in-english">read-in-english</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27949612-kjell?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27949612-kjell?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27949612-kjell?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27949612-kjell?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27949612-kjell?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27949612-kjell?shelf=plays">plays</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27949612-kjell?shelf=jk-rowling">jk-rowling</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545040389" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer536963656680782339"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1469956335i/19874247._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>OMG, this was fantastic!!!! Nostalgia galore! <b>WARNING: this rave of love and passion definitely contains spoilers! So only read this, if you've already read the book, please.</b><br><br>Added note: I see many people criticising this for being fanfiction or being too fast-paced. Remember, this is not a novel. It's a play, a script. That's how it should be read. You don't want the audience to fall asleep, do you?<br><br>So, this really felt like a rollercoaster ride! It was extremely fast-paced and I read this in a m</span>  <span id="freeText536963656680782339" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1469956335i/19874247._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>OMG, this was fantastic!!!! Nostalgia galore! <b>WARNING: this rave of love and passion definitely contains spoilers! So only read this, if you've already read the book, please.</b><br><br>Added note: I see many people criticising this for being fanfiction or being too fast-paced. Remember, this is not a novel. It's a play, a script. That's how it should be read. You don't want the audience to fall asleep, do you?<br><br>So, this really felt like a rollercoaster ride! It was extremely fast-paced and I read this in a matter of hours in total. It was soooo heart-warming! By the way, was I the only one shipping Scorpius and Albus??? Too bad, they turned out to be straight in the end.. I really loved that both Albus and Scorpius were put in House Slytherin! Now I definitely want to become a Slytherin as well!<br><br>The characters in this play were fantastic! Scorpius, ohhh Scorpius! He was without a doubt my favourite character! I loved him so much. He was very likeable and very sweet. <br>I loved the complex relationship between Harry and his son, Albus. It made the play very believable. To see such a complex bond between father and son. Clearly there is love, they just have trouble understanding each other and expressing their feelings. <br>I also really liked that the time-turner made us visit old characters from the past. That was the nicest part of the play, in my opinion. It was like visiting old friends. The eventual friendship between Harry and Draco was stunning. For them to become bonded because of the friendship between their sons! Ahhh, the feels.<br><br>I loved the plot twist at the end!! Omg, Voldemort had a daughter!! That was insane. The whole plot of this play was so good and interesting. It never became a bore and it kept me interested till the very end. The funny thing was, I never really pictured a stage. I pictured all the scenes like I was reading a book. I saw Hogwarts and Godric's Hollow very vividly in my imagination. That being said, though, I desperately want to see this play being performed now!!<br><br>I give this work 5 stars! Without a doubt. And WHAT... Rowling is going to publish more work in the Harry Potter world! Can't wait! </span>  <a data-text-id="536963656680782339" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1545040389">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1545040389'><a id="like_count_review_1545040389" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1545040389?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">48 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1545040389" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1545040389" ref="like" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1543973998" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543973998" />    <a title="Vitor Martins" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5000720-vitor-martins"><img alt="Vitor Martins" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472682327p2/5000720.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543973998?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Vitor Martins" class="user" name="Vitor Martins" href="/user/show/5000720-vitor-martins">Vitor Martins</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/29058155-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5000720-vitor-martins?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5000720-vitor-martins?shelf=ebook">ebook</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5000720-vitor-martins?shelf=mli-2016">mli-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543973998" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1358709678527010559"><b>Essa com certeza é a avaliação mais difícil que eu já fiz. <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> é uma peça e precisa ser avaliada como tal. Ler o roteiro não é o bastante porque temos, basicamente, os diálogos e as locações. Então não vou avaliar isso aqui nem como peça (porque não assisti) nem como livro (porque não é). Vou avaliar como uma HISTÓRIA.</b><br /><br />E como história, é bem ruim. <br /><br />Mas vamos lá! Tenho muito pra dizer. Todos os spoilers estarão escondidos, então se quiser clicar e ler, fique à vontade.</span>  <span id="freeText1358709678527010559" style="display:none"><b>Essa com certeza é a avaliação mais difícil que eu já fiz. <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> é uma peça e precisa ser avaliada como tal. Ler o roteiro não é o bastante porque temos, basicamente, os diálogos e as locações. Então não vou avaliar isso aqui nem como peça (porque não assisti) nem como livro (porque não é). Vou avaliar como uma HISTÓRIA.</b><br /><br />E como história, é bem ruim. <br /><br />Mas vamos lá! Tenho muito pra dizer. Todos os spoilers estarão escondidos, então se quiser clicar e ler, fique à vontade. <br /><br />Vamos começar pelos pontos positivos então. A história é cheia de fan service legal. Basicamente todas as cenas do Ron e da Hermione são fofas, vários personagens que amamos aparecem, e alguns são apenas citados mas eu fiquei feliz em saber que está tudo bem com eles (Neville, te amo). <br /><br />Scorpius Malfoy é, sem dúvidas, a melhor coisa que saiu da existência dessa peça. Ele tem o carisma que o Harry nunca teve, é bem humorado, sensível e tem muita história por trás dele. Seria maravilhoso ler sete livros sobre o Scorpius e conhecer mais esse personagem. <br /><br />Mas é claro que não temos a chance de conhecer Scorpius porque essa história é ALL ABOUT HARRY FEELING SORRY. Como se sete livros não tivessem sido o bastante. O plot é uma repetição infinita de tudo que já vimos e as motivações dos personagens são bem fracas.<br /><br />Sabe as INÚMERAS teorias e piadas que nós vimos ao longo do tempo do tipo "JK Rowling, se você é tão esperta me responde: Pq não usaram o vira tempo pra matar Voldemort e tudo ficar bem de novo?????"<br /><br />Com essa história ela nos responde essa questão, e a resposta é insatisfatória e tudo se resolve de uma maneira óbvia e conveniente demais. São poucos os momentos de grande emoção e as suspresas são forçadas demais (e olha que eu li esse roteiro sem saber de spoiler nenhum). <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Quero dizer, A FILHA DE VOLDEMORT? SERIOUSLLY?????? LARGA ESSE OSSO PFV! <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />É uma história bem estruturada e ler esse roteiro não foi uma tortura nem nada do tipo. Em alguns momentos é até gostosinho e nostálgico. Mas é bem triste saber que essa história com cara de fanfic é canônica e, agora, faz parte do universo de Harry Potter. <br /><br />Sabe aquelas sequências de filme que saem para TV e ninguém dá muita bola? Tipo o terrível "Cinderela 3 - Uma Volta no Tempo" (sim, existe). The Cursed Child é exatamente isso. Uma sequência que não acrescenta muita coisa à história original e revisita personagens que amamos e sentimos saudades. Mas, pra ser bem sincero, acho que vale mais a pena reler os sete livros e fingir que isso aqui não existe. <br /><br />Minha única motivação para amar a existência de Cursed Child era o relacionamento entre Albus e Scorpius. Sério, gente. ALBUSCORPIUS TEM QUE SER REAL. Eu shipei esses dois com todas as minhas forças, mas é claro que no final <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[os dois tinham que falar de NAMORADINHAS ETC, destruindo completamente meus sonhos de que no futuro eles fossem um maravilhoso casal de gays bruxos poderosíssimos. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Ai, tem também a <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[aparição gratuíta de Dumbledore EM FORMA DE QUADRO, que sinceramente, WTF? <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />E a coisa toda do <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[vira tempo destruído que foi resolvida com Draco convenientemente tendo UM OUTRO VIRA TEMPO just in case. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Claro que não estou falando NÃO LEIAM ETC, até porque cada um faz o que quer. Mas acho interessante que todo mundo leia, tire suas conclusões, e converse com os amigos. <br /><br />Enfim, foi uma pequena decepção, mas eu não estava esperando MUITA COISA. Li, confirmei meus pensamentos e estou pronto para seguir com a vida fingindo que isso aqui nunca existiu. </span>  <a data-text-id="1358709678527010559" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1543973998">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1543973998" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1543973998u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1543973998'><a id="like_count_review_1543973998" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1543973998?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">49 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1543973998" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1543973998" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=49u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1543973998u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1543973998" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1543973998, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); data-text-id="14837454067630529411" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Aug 27, 2016 06:48PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1543973998' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1543973998, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1714492313" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1714492313" />    <a title="sweet jane" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/47263528-sweet-jane"><img alt="sweet jane" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479606071p2/47263528.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714492313?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="sweet jane" class="user" name="sweet jane" href="/user/show/47263528-sweet-jane">sweet jane</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714492313" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7612776801246757339">Δεκαεννιά χρόνια μετά την πρώτη έκδοση του Χάρι Πότερ και η Φιλοσοφική λίθος, ο ξακουστός μάγος επιστρέφει στα ράφια των βιβλιοπωλείων με το όγδοο βιβλίο της σειράς κάνοντας εκατομμύρια οπαδών, μαζί και εμένα, καταχαρούμενους! Πρόκειται, φυσικά, για την έντυπη έκδοση του σεναρίου του ομώνυμου θεατρικού έργου που παρουσιάζεται στο Λονδίνο. Στα ελληνικά θα κυκλοφορήσει τέλη Σεπτεμβρίου από τις εκδόσεις Ψυχογιός, όπως και τα υπόλοιπα βιβλία της σειράς, με τίτλο ο Χάρι Πότερ και το Καταραμένο παιδί.</span>  <span id="freeText7612776801246757339" style="display:none">Δεκαεννιά χρόνια μετά την πρώτη έκδοση του Χάρι Πότερ και η Φιλοσοφική λίθος, ο ξακουστός μάγος επιστρέφει στα ράφια των βιβλιοπωλείων με το όγδοο βιβλίο της σειράς κάνοντας εκατομμύρια οπαδών, μαζί και εμένα, καταχαρούμενους! Πρόκειται, φυσικά, για την έντυπη έκδοση του σεναρίου του ομώνυμου θεατρικού έργου που παρουσιάζεται στο Λονδίνο. Στα ελληνικά θα κυκλοφορήσει τέλη Σεπτεμβρίου από τις εκδόσεις Ψυχογιός, όπως και τα υπόλοιπα βιβλία της σειράς, με τίτλο ο Χάρι Πότερ και το Καταραμένο παιδί.<br /><br />(Για όσους δεν έχουν διαβάσει ολόκληρη την σειρά να προειδοποιήσω ότι ακολουθήσουν <b>spoilers!</b>)<br /><br />Το βιβλίο ξεκινά με την τελευταία σκηνή των Kλήρων του Θανάτου. Ο Χάρι παντρεμένος με την Τζίνι και πατέρας τριών παιδιών αποχαιρετά τους δύο γιους στο Hogwarts Express. Είναι η πρώτη χρονιά για τον μικρότερο γιο, τον Άλμπους Σέβερους, και την κόρη της Ερμιόνης και του Ρον, την Ροουζ. Τα παιδιά βρίσκουν ένα σχεδόν άδειο βαγόνι. Μέσα κάθεται ήσυχο ένα κατάξανθο αγόρι, ο Σκόρπιους, o μοναχογιός του Ντράκο Μαλφόι. Μεγαλώνοντας, μοιράζονται τον ίδιο κοιτώνα και το ίδιο οικογενειακό βάρος. Ο Αλ κουβαλάει ένα επώνυμο το οποίο αισθάνεται ανίκανος να σηκώσει, ενώ ο Σκόρπιους κουβαλάει μια φήμη που τον έχει στοιχειώσει. Πολλοί υποψιάζονται ότι είναι απόγονος του Βόλντεμορτ. Ο καιρός περνάει, τα αγόρια μπαίνουν στην εφηβεία και ένα βράδυ πριν την έναρξη της τέταρτης σχολικής χρονιάς ο Αλ παρακολουθεί μια συζήτηση του πατέρα του μ έναν άγνωστο άνδρα. Πρόκειται για τον Άμος Ντίγκορι, τον πατέρα του αδικοχαμένου Σέντρικ. Ο λόγος της επίσκεψης του δεν είναι άλλος από το να παρακαλέσει τον Χάρι να φέρει πίσω το παιδί του ζωντανό με μια φημολογούμενη χρονομηχανή που έχει στην κατοχή του το Υπουργείο Μαγείας. Ο Χάρι αρνείται ξέροντας καλά ότι η αλλαγή της ιστορίας μόνο μπελάδες μπορεί να προκαλέσει και ο Άμος φεύγει με την ανιψιά του. Η επαναστατική ανάσα της εφηβείας και η κακή σχέση με τον πατέρα του σπρώχνουν τον Αλ να κάνει το αδιανόητο. Το σπάει μαζί με τον Σκόρπιους, κλέβουν την χρονομηχανή και προσπαθούν να σώσουν τον Σέντρικ. Τα πράγματα όμως μόνο εύκολα δεν είναι και έτσι βρίσκονται μπλεγμένοι με διαφορετικές προοπτικές της πραγματικότητας, αλλαγμένες με βάση τα γεγονότα του παρελθόντος.<br /><br />Το καταραμένο παιδί είναι γραμμένο σε μορφή θεατρικού διαλόγου, μακριά από τον μέχρι τώρα συνηθισμένη γραφή της Ρόουλιγκ. Θεωρητικά μπορεί να ξενίζει αρκετούς αυτή η αλλαγή, πιστέψτε με όμως είναι ευεργετική για την πλοκή. Τα χρονικά ταξίδια των πρωταγωνιστών και η επανάληψη σκηνών δίνονται με ζωντάνια και παραστατικότητα μέσω του διαλόγου, κάτι που ίσως να κούραζε στο πεζό λόγο. Όπως και τα προηγούμενα βιβλία του Πότερ είχαν κύριο θέμα την αξία της φιλίας και της αγάπης. Εξάλλου, σύμφωνα με τον μεγαλύτερο μάγο όλων των εποχών, τον Άλμπους Νταμπλντορ, μόνο αυτή είναι που μετράει!<br /><br />Τι να πρωτοπώ για τους χαρακτήρες, παλιούς και νεότερους. Πόσο μου είχαν λείψει! Αισθάνθηκα τόσο όμορφα που διάβαζα πάλι για τον αυθορμητισμό του Ρον και για την γλυκιά αυστηρότητα της Ερμιόνης. Περισσότερο όμως χάρηκα που ξαναδιάβασα το όνομα του καθηγητά Σνέιπ... Αν αγαπάτε τον Χάρι, να το διαβάσετε το βιβλίο. Θα σας ταξιδέψει!<br /><br /><b>Still, if I had to choose a companion to be at the return of eternal darkness with, I’d choose you.</b></span>  <a data-text-id="7612776801246757339" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1714492313">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1714492313" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1714492313u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1714492313'><a id="like_count_review_1714492313" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1714492313?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">50 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1714492313" rel="nofollow" id="freeTextContainer2949670539271249982">August 2016<br /><br />ALL OF MY PREDICTIONS FROM 2007 PRETTY MUCH CAME TRUE.<br /><br />I LOVED THIS BOOK BUT ONCE AGAIN I FEEL EMPTY :(<br /><br />More thoughts soon!<br /><br /><br />February 2016<br /><br />I AM HYPERVENTILATING.<br /><br />I feel like I've traveled back in time to the early 2000s when I would eagerly await the Harry Potter books. I HAVE SO MANY FEELINGS AND MEMORIES GOING THROUGH ME RIGHT NOW. <br /><br />My mom never let me go to any midnight release parties AND NOW HERE IS MY ONE AND ONLY CHANCE! <br /><br />JULY 31, 2016. href="/user/show/23798965-ziba"><img alt="Ziba" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1421871753p2/23798965.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1713924508?book_show_action=false">Aug 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Ziba" class="user" name="Ziba" href="/user/show/23798965-ziba">Ziba</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1713924508" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17078458272162734883">The magic continues - 19 years later. I finished this last night so I read it pretty much in one sitting. As bumpy as it might be to read Harry Potter in script format you'll get used to it after a while. I cried. I laughed and I even laughed out loud. We get to re-live some of our best and worst moments and it's a wonderful journey down memory lane. The old and the new, the perished and the few - all wrapped up in one book. By honoring Rowling's own wishes of #KeepTheSecrets I will leave my</span>  <span id="freeText17078458272162734883" style="display:none">The magic continues - 19 years later. I finished this last night so I read it pretty much in one sitting. As bumpy as it might be to read Harry Potter in script format you'll get used to it after a while. I cried. I laughed and I even laughed out loud. We get to re-live some of our best and worst moments and it's a wonderful journey down memory lane. The old and the new, the perished and the few - all wrapped up in one book. By honoring Rowling's own wishes of #KeepTheSecrets I will leave my review at this. </span>  <a data-text-id="17078458272162734883" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>   </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544709861" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1043237141891646149">5 stars for the fact that this books completely brought me back into the Potter universe and I LOVED reading about all the characters!<br /><br />The story itself wasn't as amazing as I wanted it to be. I did really enjoy this book and couldn't put it down, but the plot wasn't as catchy as the original series.<br /><br />Can't wait to see the play though!</span>          </span>        </div>
