class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/29058155-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8837962-lucia?shelf=paranormal">paranormal</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8837962-lucia?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545850976" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer865056174124094932"><b>I’m starting this review with two (subjective) facts: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child reads only like really good fanfiction and Albus Severus got on my nerves even more than Harry did in original books. </b><br /><br />I know that this book was written for theatre in different format than other Harry Potter novels so I should not compare them. But this is 8th book and part of series, not a standalone, so I’m going to treat it the same way as previous books. All in all, Harry Potter and the Cursed Child is a</span>  <span id="freeText865056174124094932" style="display:none"><b>I’m starting this review with two (subjective) facts: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child reads only like really good fanfiction and Albus Severus got on my nerves even more than Harry did in original books. </b><br /><br />I know that this book was written for theatre in different format than other Harry Potter novels so I should not compare them. But this is 8th book and part of series, not a standalone, so I’m going to treat it the same way as previous books. All in all, Harry Potter and the Cursed Child is a far cry from first seven Harry Potter books and definitely did not do original series a justice. And I can’t believe that I would ever say no to more from this world but in my opinion, Harry Potter series should have ended with book #7.<br /><br />Yes, there were some scenes that I truly enjoyed. And yes, it was lovely to revisit my childhood heroes. However, whole storyline was way over the top. It brought nothing new only recycled old storylines. And worst of all, all characters seemed like caricatures of their old selves. And that was very very disappointing. <br /><br />Would I recommend it? Yes and no. Harry Potter and the Cursed Child is not a bad book on its own, but as huge Harry Potter fan I have to say that this is absolutely unnecessary addition to otherwise one-of-a-kind series.<br /><br />MORE REVIEWS ON MY BLOG <a href="http://readingismybreathing.blogspot.cz/" rel="nofollow">  <b>Reading Is My Breathing</b></a></span>  <a data-text-id="865056174124094932" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer1544412799" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2793488720199816830"><b>Update: 10/31/16</b><br />The more I think about this book, the more I dislike it. None of what happened is canon in my head. None of it. And although I do think it's an enjoyable read whilst in the moment, I can't give it a good rating considering the amount of shit wrong with it. The queer-baiting, for one. Then the entire thing with who the villain's parents were? Literally, what the fuck? I just... no. /rant<br /><br /><b>Previous updates:</b><br />I feel so bad about bumping this down to 4 stars, but let's be honest. It wasn</span>  <span id="freeText2793488720199816830" style="display:none"><b>Update: 10/31/16</b><br />The more I think about this book, the more I dislike it. None of what happened is canon in my head. None of it. And although I do think it's an enjoyable read whilst in the moment, I can't give it a good rating considering the amount of shit wrong with it. The queer-baiting, for one. Then the entire thing with who the villain's parents were? Literally, what the fuck? I just... no. /rant<br /><br /><b>Previous updates:</b><br />I feel so bad about bumping this down to 4 stars, but let's be honest. It wasn't a 5-star read. It was my bias showing. D: But heck, it was still hella fun.<br /><br /><b>How to read The Cursed Child</b><br />I have constructed a short manual on <a href="https://aimalfarooq.wordpress.com/2016/07/31/how-to-read-the-cursed-child-a-short-manual-to-help-you-avoid-disappointment/" rel="nofollow">how to read <i>The Cursed Child</i> and avoid disappointment.</a><br /><br /><b>Immediate rambling:</b><br />OH MY GOD. SO MUCH DRACO. SO MUCH SCORPIUS WHO IS A BALL OF GOO AND EVERYTHING CUTE IN THE WORLD. <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30983445-anna-enchanted-by-ya?shelf=action-packed">action-packed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30983445-anna-enchanted-by-ya?shelf=fell-for-the-hype">fell-for-the-hype</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30983445-anna-enchanted-by-ya?shelf=super-ending">super-ending</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30983445-anna-enchanted-by-ya?shelf=male-protagonist">male-protagonist</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30983445-anna-enchanted-by-ya?shelf=great-characters">great-characters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30983445-anna-enchanted-by-ya?shelf=one-sit-read">one-sit-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544088800" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8194163563832381176">I could very easily be critical towards this book, listing the things I loved and those I didn't.<br />Personally however, I don't see a point, because it all comes down to the fact that I enjoyed reading it.<br /><br />For years I've wanted more in this world and here it is, with my favourite characters having matured in a way that's true to their personalities/situations, plus the introductions of other characters that quickly found a place in my heart (Scorpius is too precious).<br /><br />While this book may not have fol</span>  <span id="freeText8194163563832381176" style="display:none">I could very easily be critical towards this book, listing the things I loved and those I didn't.<br />Personally however, I don't see a point, because it all comes down to the fact that I enjoyed reading it.<br /><br />For years I've wanted more in this world and here it is, with my favourite characters having matured in a way that's true to their personalities/situations, plus the introductions of other characters that quickly found a place in my heart (Scorpius is too precious).<br /><br />While this book may not have followed my ideas or expectations, I'm glad I had the chance to read it.</span>  <a data-text-id="8194163563832381176" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1545000042" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1545000042" />    <a title="Nishat" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36859595-nishat"><img alt="Nishat" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473849387p2/36859595.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1545000042?book_show_action=false">Aug 24, 2016</a>      <a title="Nishat" class="user" name="Nishat" href="/user/show/36859595-nishat">Nishat</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36859595-nishat?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545000042" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5570456277937017833">A script serves as a mere outline of a play. Using the least amount of words possible, a script speaks through dialogues as opposed to in the prose of the description and relies heavily on an actor's interpretation. There must exist nevertheless a pinch of flaw and reason, the precise rhythm and the proper flow. <br /><br />As much as the ambitious script of the Cursed Child is visually compelling, I can only consider the addition of a playscript, not actually penned by JK Rowling, to the memorable Harry Po</span>  <span id="freeText5570456277937017833" style="display:none">A script serves as a mere outline of a play. Using the least amount of words possible, a script speaks through dialogues as opposed to in the prose of the description and relies heavily on an actor's interpretation. There must exist nevertheless a pinch of flaw and reason, the precise rhythm and the proper flow. <br /><br />As much as the ambitious script of the Cursed Child is visually compelling, I can only consider the addition of a playscript, not actually penned by JK Rowling, to the memorable Harry Potter book series a mistake.<br /><br />Albus Severus Potter and Scorpious Malfoy engages in an unlikely adventure. And the prophetic past of great men they knew, may after all change all that stands now between good and evil. The boys set out to destroy the world, the boys set out to save the world. <br /><br /><i>“Bravery doesn’t forgive stupidity.”</i><br /><br />The script lacks in magic. Therefore shouldn't be necessarily claimed as the next big one of the series. The script instead deals with personal conflicts and yearning for redemption. Draco's finely executed transformation and his inherent contradiction demands praise. The burden of legacy often overpowers the young characters and they seek to define themselves anew. The philosophy behind the change of the tide is eloquently remembered.<br /><br />The characterization, except of Scorpious's and Draco's, mostly was humorless and lame in the most unmagical way possible. The introduction of Delphini served nothing. Our favourites were pitifully butchered. And there remained an unrealistic setting for the story to progress. On the other hand, a script is meant to be staged and the acting of the performers eventually outdoes the script's natural stiffness.<br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>“In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, show your pain. To suffer is as human as to breathe.”</i></blockquote><br /><br />In the Deathly Hallows, we bade an incredible adieu to the brave boy who lived. To the unwavering friendship in times of doubt and mortal peril. To the courage the boy mustered to choose life in the face of inevitable death. To the good heart and its nobility, that made in the end all the difference.<br /><br />The magic for us, did end there, at the King's Cross Station for good.</span>  <a data-text-id="5570456277937017833" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1545000042">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1545000042" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1545000042'><a id="like_count_review_1545000042" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1545000042?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">47 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1545000042" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1545000042" ref="like" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1545890620" />    <a title="Nicklein Mae" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6058998-nicklein-mae"><img alt="Nicklein Mae" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476583255p2/6058998.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1545890620?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Nicklein Mae" class="user" name="Nicklein Mae" href="/user/show/6058998-nicklein-mae">Nicklein Mae</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6058998-nicklein-mae?shelf=2016-most-anticipated-reads">2016-most-anticipated-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545890620" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7329982247162816175">I was expecting it to be good (duh) but what I read was PHENOMENAL!<br /><br />This book was everything I never knew I needed in my life. A life-changing read--- that's what this book was. Everything was on point. It was bittersweet. It was cry-worthy AND laugh-out-loud-worthy. It was worth the wait. It was amazing.<br /><br />I can't form anything discernably english at this point, sorry.<br /><br />All I can coherently think right now is that Scorpius is the fictional version of me. Here's the glaring proof:<br /><blockquote>“How to distract Scor</blockquote></span>  <span id="freeText7329982247162816175" style="display:none">I was expecting it to be good (duh) but what I read was PHENOMENAL!<br /><br />This book was everything I never knew I needed in my life. A life-changing read--- that's what this book was. Everything was on point. It was bittersweet. It was cry-worthy AND laugh-out-loud-worthy. It was worth the wait. It was amazing.<br /><br />I can't form anything discernably english at this point, sorry.<br /><br />All I can coherently think right now is that Scorpius is the fictional version of me. Here's the glaring proof:<br /><blockquote>“How to distract Scorpius from difficult emotional issues. Take him to a library.” <b>(Albus)</b></blockquote><br /><br />Are you me, Scorpius?<br /><br />*gives Scorpius a hug*<br /><br />In reality I just look like a psycho hugging a book.<br /><br />But I stopped caring about reality at this point anyway.<br /><br />I'll be re-reading this tonight. And I recommend this to every person on earth.</span>  <a data-text-id="7329982247162816175" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1715377819" />    <a title="Bee (Heart Full of Books)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/18364457-bee-heart-full-of-books"><img alt="Bee (Heart Full of Books)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450780960p2/18364457.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1715377819?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Bee (Heart Full of Books)" class="user" name="Bee (Heart Full of Books)" href="/user/show/18364457-bee-heart-full-of-books">Bee (Heart Full of Books)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer1715377819u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1715377819" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer425845096008653882">Umm? I experienced so many 'I'm sorry WHEN?' moments during this book.<br /><br />I have some points:<br /> 1. NAME MEANINGs. Delphi, as in Oracle of? Her true purpose was NOT as surprise at all. <br />2. WHEN THE HECK DID VOLDY HAVE THE CHANCE TO GET IT ON WITH BELLATRIX? When was she pregnant? I think that's something we would've noticed?? How can this be canon?<br />3. I honestly don't believe that Harry would be a shitty dad. SUBPOINTS:<br /> a) He had SO many beautiful father figures: Sirius, Remus, Dumbles, Hagrid, ARTHUR.<br /> b</span>  <span id="freeText425845096008653882" style="display:none">Umm? I experienced so many 'I'm sorry WHEN?' moments during this book.<br /><br />I have some points:<br /> 1. NAME MEANINGs. Delphi, as in Oracle of? Her true purpose was NOT as surprise at all. <br />2. WHEN THE HECK DID VOLDY HAVE THE CHANCE TO GET IT ON WITH BELLATRIX? When was she pregnant? I think that's something we would've noticed?? How can this be canon?<br />3. I honestly don't believe that Harry would be a shitty dad. SUBPOINTS:<br /> a) He had SO many beautiful father figures: Sirius, Remus, Dumbles, Hagrid, ARTHUR.<br /> b) He had SO many people who loved and cared for him: MOLLY and legit all of DA. <br /> c) Teddy?? (Where he got to be one of that boy's many many parental figures) James Jr.?? He's got the experience of being a loving dad.<br /> d) He knows what NOT to do aka: the Dursleys. <br />Fight me on this if you will but I stand by the idea that HP would be a brilliant dad.<br />4. Hermione and Ron felt sooo 2D. Ron was just a comic relief and basically turned into a replacement Fred where was his Bloody Hell! personality? Hermione was far too strict. YES, she's a bit bossy but this just felt too far. I know I know her work at the ministry probably puts a lot of strain on her but once again Hermione is compassionate more than anything!<br />5. Don't get me wrong I love the idea of Scorpius and Rose but Scorpius and Albus was a seriously missed opportunity. <br /><br />The only things I really liked was a) SCORPIUS. What a sweetheart. So cute. and b) Hermione and Ron's eternal love for each other no matter what timeline. I feel like this needed to be reiterated after the 'Hermione should've been with Harry' bomb from a while ago. <br /><br />Overall, I don't think I'm counting this as canon. It might technically be, but personally I've read some better fan fiction. <br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="425845096008653882" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544212102" />    <a title="Mariah of the Night Court" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/29456303-mariah-of-the-night-court"><img alt="Mariah of the Night Court" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475361360p2/29456303.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544212102?book_show_action=false">Oct 18, 2016</a>      <a title="Mariah of the Night Court" class="user" name="Mariah of the Night Court" href="/user/show/29456303-mariah-of-the-night-court">Mariah of the Night Court</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544212102" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14185565636132053582"><b> <u>Edit 10/18/16---</u> </b>I've been thinking about how I've rated this book and the more I do, the more negatives about it there are. It didn't have that "Harry Potter" feel to it as I was hoping it would. You can easily tell it wasn't written by J.K. Rowling which was kind of disappointing. It was still enjoyable to read though! So I now give this book 3/5 stars. <br /><br /><b> <u>Review from 08/02/16---</u> </b><br /><br /><b>I FINISHED THIS IN A DAY AND WAS BLOWN AWAY</b> haha I made a rhyme<br /><br />Scorpius is my absolute favorite character in this bo</span>  <span id="freeText14185565636132053582" style="display:none"><b>  <u>Edit 10/18/16---</u></b>I've been thinking about how I've rated this book and the more I do, the more negatives about it there are. It didn't have that "Harry Potter" feel to it as I was hoping it would. You can easily tell it wasn't written by J.K. Rowling which was kind of disappointing. It was still enjoyable to read though! So I now give this book 3/5 stars. <br /><br /><b>  <u>Review from 08/02/16---</u></b><br /><br /><b>I FINISHED THIS IN A DAY AND WAS BLOWN AWAY</b> haha I made a rhyme<br /><br />Scorpius is my absolute favorite character in this book. And omg so glad that Albus <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[was sorted into Slytherin house <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Many new and old faces, a great message, and a very unexpected plot that made me craving for more. 5/5 stars.</span>  <a itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544052783" />    <a title="Kristina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9176531-kristina"><img alt="Kristina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452098221p2/9176531.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544052783?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Kristina" class="user" name="Kristina" href="/user/show/9176531-kristina">Kristina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544052783" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4795577281426359916">I finished it yesterday and still don't know how to review the nostalgic beauty I just read. <br /><br />I know. I admit it. It has flaws. It is far from perfect but it doesn't need to be. It brought me back in time with my old beloved squad and I will be forever grateful for that only. <br /><br />It got all the feels and it was a major throwback. I loved seeing the famous trio back together in action and I liked the fact that Draco joined them! <br /><br />Albus and Scorious were totally adorable and yes, I would have liked it i</span>  <span id="freeText4795577281426359916" style="display:none">I finished it yesterday and still don't know how to review the nostalgic beauty I just read. <br /><br />I know. I admit it. It has flaws. It is far from perfect but it doesn't need to be. It brought me back in time with my old beloved squad and I will be forever grateful for that only. <br /><br />It got all the feels and it was a major throwback. I loved seeing the famous trio back together in action and I liked the fact that Draco joined them! <br /><br />Albus and Scorious were totally adorable and yes, I would have liked it if they became a couple but oh well. Still love them both u0026lt;3 <br /><br />What can I say more? Don't go in reading the book expecting something fabulous and extraordinary because it is not but it is warm, nostalgic and providing us with closure :) <br /><br />Thank you, Rowling u0026lt;3 <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="4795577281426359916" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544052783">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544052783" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544052783u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544052783'><a id="like_count_review_1544052783" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544052783?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">47 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544052783" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544052783" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=47u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1544052783u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1544052783" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1544052783, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">comment</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1544052783?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1544052783' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1544052783' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1544052783, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1714747000" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1714747000" />    <a title="Maddie (Heart Full Of Books)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/18523225-maddie-heart-full-of-books"><img alt="Maddie (Heart Full Of Books)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476128058p2/18523225.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714747000?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Maddie (Heart Full Of Books)" class="user" name="Maddie (Heart Full Of Books)" href="/user/show/18523225-maddie-heart-full-of-books">Maddie (Heart Full Of Books)</a>          added it            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714747000" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5383284554229089245">That was the weirdest, whackiest piece of fan fiction I've ever read.<br /><br />Five stars to Scorpius Malfoy, though. What a beautiful child. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1550550292" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1550550292" />    <a title="Eda** # Dax Lahnu0026#39;s Golden Tigress  # " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6285155-eda-dax-lahn-s-golden-tigress"><img alt="Eda** # Dax Lahnu0026#39;s Golden Tigress  # " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467808077p2/6285155.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1550550292?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Eda** # Dax Lahnu0026#39;s Golden Tigress  # " class="user" name="Eda** # Dax Lahnu0026#39;s Golden Tigress  # " href="/user/show/6285155-eda-dax-lahn-s-golden-tigress">Eda** # Dax Lahnu0026#39;s Golden Tigress  # </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1550550292" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8522696996656116804"><br><b> <i>** 1.5-2 “<u>After all this time? –Well, not always.</u>” STARS **</i> </b><br><br><blockquote> <b> <i>“Harry, there is never a perfect answer in this messy, emotional world. Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those who you love, show your pain. TO SUFFER IS AS HUMAN AS TO BREATHE.”</i> </b> </blockquote><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1386557002ra/7390327.gif" width="400" height="180" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Being the son of Harry Potter isn't as sweet as it sounds. <b>Albus Severus Potter</b> feels the weight of his</span>  <span id="freeText8522696996656116804" style="display:none"><br><b>  <i>** 1.5-2 “<u>After all this time? –Well, not always.</u>” STARS **</i></b><br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>“Harry, there is never a perfect answer in this messy, emotional world. Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those who you love, show your pain. TO SUFFER IS AS HUMAN AS TO BREATHE.”</i>  </b></blockquote><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1386557002ra/7390327.gif" width="400" height="180" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Being the son of Harry Potter isn't as sweet as it sounds. <b>Albus Severus Potter</b> feels the weight of his fathers success on his shoulders every day, and even more so now that he will start his magical journey at Hogwarts. He has grown up with the stories of the incredibly strong friendship of his father, his Aunt Hermione and Uncle Ron. He knows that in order to survive in Hogwarts, to be happy and to feel like he belongs there, he needs to find a friend. Someone worthy, someone that understands him, someone that would listen and not judge him. And he does. He finds the boy no one wants to get associated with. He finds <b>Scorpius Malfoy</b>, and yet theirs is a rather unlikely pact, it's also strong and full of love.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470047363i/19882018._SX540_.jpg" width="200" height="150" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470047363i/19882019._SX540_.jpg" width="200" height="150" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Disappointed.<br><br>How can you manage to do that to a freakish Potterhead who's been obsessed with anything and everything Harry Potter since the age of 8?<br><br>I believe we've been cheated into believing we'd be getting our hands onto another brilliant story from the pen of JK Rowling. I refuse to believe Rowling even touched this script. I can't even understand HOW on earth she approved of this mockery and let them put her name on it. This is not Harry Potter.<br><br>This right here feels like nothing but a blatant cash grab. Regardless of how great the stage production and the acting may be, the plot was weak, predictable, dull and most importantly a break from book canon. It is nothing more than a very poorly written fan-fiction. Too much pandering and not enough concrete story. The main conflict is ludicrous, the side conflicts more so...<br><br>Some characterization and dialogues were way off, painfully absurd and cringe-worthy. Especially the way Ron Weasley was reduced to an absent-minded lackey, and was so irrelevant and useless. I can forgive every wrong about this...even the whole Moldy Voldy “twist”, but not THAT. Never that. Undermining a main character who we've grown to love is unacceptable. <br><br>Don't get me wrong. I am SO grateful for another glimpse into the wizarding world, I am, but this script does in no way measure upto the novels. Kind of underwhelming. <br><br><b>  <u>OVERALL:</u></b> The incredibly cute friendship of lovely Scorpius (who is officially in my favourite HP characters top 5 list now) and Albus, my delusional LGBT ship (which sadly didn't happen at the end, even while all the hints were there) and some of the scenes where Harry gets closure with people that we've lost made reading this book WORTH IT. Read it. But lower your expectations, and don't forget that it's just a screenplay, and that it might feel more MAGICAL on screen!</span>  <a data-text-id="8522696996656116804" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1550550292">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1550550292" title="Flag this review as <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1550550292'><a id="like_count_review_1550550292" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1550550292?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">43 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1550550292" rel="nofollow" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=43u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1550550292u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1550550292" href="#" href="/review/show/1550550292?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1550550292' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1550550292/comments?reverse=true">View all 4 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1550550292' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1550550292, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1549275092" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1549275092" />    <a title="Meredith" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22181170-meredith"><img alt="Meredith" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469931480p2/22181170.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1549275092?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Meredith" class="user" name="Meredith" href="/user/show/22181170-meredith">Meredith</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22181170-meredith?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22181170-meredith?shelf=library-books">library-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22181170-meredith?shelf=owned-books">owned-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22181170-meredith?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22181170-meredith?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22181170-meredith?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22181170-meredith?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22181170-meredith?shelf=print">print</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1549275092" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12999267362279063931">Join the group to discuss:<br /><br /><a target="_blank" href="https://www.goodreads.com/group/show/195178-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">https://www.goodreads.com/group/show/...</a><br /><br />4.5 Stars<br /><br />I was able to get my hands on a copy of this due to working in a library. Copies had already come in and I was able to borrow one before they go out to the general public on July 31st. I have one pre-ordered from Amazon as well, but I since I was able to get my hands on a copy, I wasn't waiting!<br /><br />I would usually be cautious about writing a review for a Potter based book, but as this is a play and it has had a soft opening f</span>  <span id="freeText12999267362279063931" style="display:none">Join the group to discuss:<br /><br /><a target="_blank" href="https://www.goodreads.com/group/show/195178-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">https://www.goodreads.com/group/show/...</a><br /><br />4.5 Stars<br /><br />I was able to get my hands on a copy of this due to working in a library. Copies had already come in and I was able to borrow one before they go out to the general public on July 31st. I have one pre-ordered from Amazon as well, but I since I was able to get my hands on a copy, I wasn't waiting!<br /><br />I would usually be cautious about writing a review for a Potter based book, but as this is a play and it has had a soft opening for a month now, I feel it is fine to talk about. <br /><br />Short observation with longer thoughts to follow… book and movie lovers of the original Potter series will notice many Easter Eggs. What I loved especially is that both the books and the movies were referenced. As book fans know… a movie doesn't capture everything in the book and the movies may add things that were not in the books to begin with. (Hi, shrunken heads! LOL u0026lt;— excellent edition, btw). So, we see this subtle nod to both franchises.<br /><br />Longer review below:<br /><br />I always felt Rowling wasn't sure she wanted to go back to her original series because if it ain't broke, why fix it? As a fan you can tell she was having this push and pull with the idea. An encyclopedia was planned, but we got Pottermore that you can not really easily flip through and refer to certain things without getting very lost. It serves as a wonderful tool for Rowling to dispense related items to her Potterverse without having fully to commit to another series. Which is bitter sweet for fans because you are getting loads of backstory that was not included in any of the series but with no solid foundation. I find that frustrating because I believe she should expand from the series both before the original series and after. Yet. As we know, Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them is being expanded upon from a very small book to a three part movie, with novels accompanying the movies as they go along. Very nice and not something I would complain about since it is more Potterverse items.<br /><br />But what we all wanted was the continuation of the series we loved (well not all of us, but a lot of us). I am still holding out for a book or several on the Maunders being a prequel to the original HP series. I am holding my breath I guess! <br /><br />I digress, we are blessed with a play that happens 19 years later and picks exactly where the epilogue in Deathly Hallows leaves off with the same exact scene. Love it! Like I mentioned before and I felt this while reading Cursed Child… I feel Rowling wants to return to this series but I almost wonder she doubts herself and her fandom. There was so much going on in this play that could and should be expanded out into more in-depth novels. This play covers more than a couple of years and though it doesn't concentrate solely on the Golden Trios and supporting characters' children… we do back to Hogwarts. So many questions spring up from that alone? What does Hogwarts look like today? Is it vastly different or look the same after the battle? (remember I am a book reader and have not seen the play with it's accompanying sets… so I do not know nor will most of us in this case because we are a play transcript as of right now). How old is Professor McGonagall and can she fill us in on this longevity surviving how many wiazrding wars now? The lady is made of steel! <br /><br />All fun aside… here come the spoilers and you have been warned… <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ The Golden Trio expands for someone who everyone knows was always looking from the outside in and gets his wish to be part of the cool kids group. Love it! And though I did put a spoiler tag, if you don't get that vague reference, then you are not a true Potter fan. Sorry, not sorry. :P<br /><br />An unlikely friendship is forged by a Potter and a Malfoy offspring and that makes my heart sing. We do not bare the sins our fathers made and this book speaks to that throughout regarding both Harry and Draco. Many people may not like this play/book because of that… but that is the reality in any way you cut this. Those beloved main characters are now adults with families and two of the major male characters had either no parents or incredibly shitty parents that didn't now a thing about parenting. So, take those children out of their childhood and have them raising their own kids in somewhat normal circumstances and you are going to have conflict. Not because they are bad people, but because they were brought up in terrible situations. I like seeing that dynamic because we are all living in a fantasy world within a fantasy world if that is not touched upon especially with Harry Potter and Draco Malfoy<br /><br />Long Story short: We may need Doc Brown to explain the space time continuum because the time turner may have replaced the Delorean. No joke, while reading, I kept thinking about Back to the Future. <br /><br />. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Back to Rowling and why this play needs to go beyond the stage or even screen (because I can see this going the movie route) and back to the page where it all began. Rowling is expanding her talent and I love that, but as someone who is a booklover, I selfishly want more because this play has more to offer than it gives. <br /><br />How do you top Voldemort? By exploring some of his own family roots and I ain't talking about his mommy and daddy. That's all you get from me because you have to read the play to know what I am talking about. By what Rowling and the other writers did, was open this play up for a potential for many other books. I can't see a second play being made (maybe they will), but a book series to expand from when we are back on Platform 9 3/4 to the ending of this play and outward. However, a character that was introduced for this play specifically could carry several new books. Which most likely will happen because as we know 'He Who Shall Remain Nameless' wasn't a one and done deal. *wink* Also, when everyone reads this, can we all sit and talk about this particular situation? Seriously, I have so many questions and I know fellow readers are going to go "OH, Really? Right, okay. Interesting. Crazy. Trying to erase that image from my mind… thanks."<br /><br />I was very pleased and enjoyed returning to this series. It makes me want Rowling to sit down and write prequels and sequels in her original form… the novel. Please, Jo! The transcript is well written enough to envision what is going on and how the play sets move from one scene to another without being confused. Which is excellent because many of us will not see the stage production of this. Which I am fine with in a way because it is how we all came to love the books before the movies came out. The writing at times could be a bit cheesy but we have to remember that this is still a children's/teen series. Nonetheless, character growth is shown in many places. <br /><br />I want more and I might have to wait another 10 years cause Rowling loves to play mind games not only with her fans but herself as well. Go, figure! Ha! We all know Rowling is better at long story arcs that cover several books, i.e. her Potter series and Cormoran Strike novels and not so good with stand alone… i.e. The Casual Vacancy. An excellent book in a series I know I never want to end. Thank you Jo for giving us a bit more. Here's to hoping we get more. ;)</span>  <a data-text-id="12999267362279063931" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1549275092">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1549275092" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1549275092u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1549275092'><a id="like_count_review_1549275092" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1549275092?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">42 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1549275092" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1549275092" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=42u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1549275092u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1549275092" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1549275092, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;);          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');          $copy.find('script').remove();          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);      }  //]]>  </script></div><div id="bookReviews">    <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1714523488" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1714523488" />    <a title="Larry Hoffer" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5872506-larry-hoffer"><img alt="Larry Hoffer" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1439469046p2/5872506.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714523488?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Larry Hoffer" class="user" name="Larry Hoffer" href="/user/show/5872506-larry-hoffer">Larry Hoffer</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714523488" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9503342687633424863">So, let me collect myself...<br /><br />I was a little late to the party with the Harry Potter series, but that was a good thing, so there were three or four books already published when I got hooked. Eventually I had to wait until J.K. Rowling wrote each one, and although I tried to demonstrate some self-control, I'd usually devour them fairly quickly. When the last book was released, I think I waited about six months to read it, because I couldn't fathom the idea of not having any more time with Harry, He</span>  <span id="freeText9503342687633424863" style="display:none">So, let me collect myself...<br /><br />I was a little late to the party with the Harry Potter series, but that was a good thing, so there were three or four books already published when I got hooked. Eventually I had to wait until J.K. Rowling wrote each one, and although I tried to demonstrate some self-control, I'd usually devour them fairly quickly. When the last book was released, I think I waited about six months to read it, because I couldn't fathom the idea of not having any more time with Harry, Hermione, Ron, and the gang. But then I broke down, read it, and broke down again (emotionally).<br /><br />So when <b>  <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i></b> came out, you'd think I might want to hoard it for a while, especially in light of Rowling's recent announcement that this would be the last story in the series. Well, I just couldn't. It's Harry freaking Potter, for pity's sake! But given my attachment to the series, would this new story—a play, to boot—live up to my expectations? Would the chemistry between the characters feel the same? Would this generate the same emotional reactions I've felt before?<br /><br />Yes, yes, and yes.<br /><br /><b>  <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i></b> takes place 19 years after the last book. Harry is married with three children (if you've still not read the last book in the series, I'll not spoil the surprise of who his wife is), and is barely keeping things afloat as a high-level employee at the Ministry of Magic. His younger son, Albus Severus Potter, is about to start Hogwarts, and isn't too keen on the legacy of being Harry Potter's son following him through school. It doesn't take him long to distinguish himself as utterly different than his father, and his choice of best friend causes him even more alienation at the hands of his fellow students.<br /><br />As his time at Hogwarts rolls on, Albus grows more and more disenchanted with school and his father. After an argument with Harry one night, Albus makes a decision in the heat of the moment that he wants to undo a wrong his father caused a number of years ago. Little does he know this will set into motion a chain of events which will cause the present, the past, and the future to collide, bringing the threat of danger, grief, loss, and the possible return of He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named. All in all, it's a lot to face.<br /><br />I'll stop here with the plot description for fear of giving anything away. I absolutely loved this story. Even though it was a little strange reading it as a play rather than a book, I got the old, familiar feelings as I was reading, became both excited and melancholy as old characters returned, and definitely was struck by suspense and trepidation as I wondered how the plot would wrap itself up. This is definitely more a book about Albus than it is about Harry, Ron, Hermione, Draco, and the rest, but it still touches on the Potter-esque themes of friendship, hope, anger, abandonment, grief, and fear.<br /><br />"People think they know all there is to know about you, but the best bits of you are—have always been—heroic in really quiet ways."<br /><br />This is truly a perfect quote to sum up what is so special about Harry Potter. I'm so glad to have had another chance to spend even a short amount of time with these characters, back in their world. I hope Rowling will reconsider again allowing the world more visits with Harry and crew, but until then, this was a worthy nugget to hold on to. <br /><br />See all of my reviews at <a target="_blank" href="http://itseithersadnessoreuphoria.blogspot.com" rel="nofollow">http://itseithersadnessoreuphoria.blo...</a>.</span>  <a data-text-id="9503342687633424863" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" This is magic."<br /><br />"Hogwarts will always be there to welcome you home." <br /><br />I rated this with 5 stars because that's just how i roll. In truth it could've been better but i got so emotional because HARRY POTTER sequel, and i would have loved it no matter what. The story was meh, and the writing was nothing special, since it was written like a script so you cant expect much from that one,can you? But also the brutal and sad truth is that i've read fan-fiction better than that xD Still, th</span>  <span id="freeText2060599751260111519" style="display:none">"This is chaos. This is magic."<br /><br />"Hogwarts will always be there to welcome you home." ♥<br /><br />I rated this with 5 stars because that's just how i roll. In truth it could've been better but i got so emotional because HARRY POTTER sequel, and i would have loved it no matter what. The story was meh, and the writing was nothing special, since it was written like a script so you cant expect much from that one,can you? But also the brutal and sad truth is that i've read fan-fiction better than that xD Still, the magic of coming back to the characters that i grew up with was out of this world. I felt like a kid again. Seriously my generation grew up with the books and the movies and its just so hard NOT to love Harry Potter ♥ ALWAYS ♥ <br /><br />I loved Scorpius Malfoy. I'M IN LOVE with this kid and his potential with Rose. I SHIP IT. *i'm going down with thiiiiis ship* <br />Oh and the bromance between him and Albus. RIGHT IN THE FEELS. <br />Also the Romione scenes were killing me!! I JUST CANT.<br /><br />FEELS EVERYWHERE. I'M DROWNING. SAVE ME. elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1543943154" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543943154" />    <a title="fenrir" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4723171-fenrir"><img alt="fenrir" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473168085p2/4723171.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543943154?book_show_action=false">Sep 06, 2016</a>      <a title="fenrir" class="user" name="fenrir" href="/user/show/4723171-fenrir">fenrir</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4723171-fenrir?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4723171-fenrir?shelf=not-worth-reading">not-worth-reading</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4723171-fenrir?shelf=hogwarts">hogwarts</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543943154" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9840216291386743437">Riassunto del libro in una quote u0026lt;u0026lt; and Albus is missing againu0026gt;u0026gt;<br /><br />Cominciamo a demolire il protagonista, prima gli onori di casa li fa Albus Severus Potter ovviamente.<br />Un nome un programma! della famiglia c'è poco da dire perché ha un fratello o una sorella (di cui onestamente avrei voluto sapere di più) ma tranquilli verranno nominati solo una volta in tutto il libro e poi spariranno ed i meno attenti penseranno che Albus sia figlio unico (non lo è, ma tecnicamente è come se lo fosse p</span>  <span id="freeText9840216291386743437" style="display:none">Riassunto del libro in una quote u0026lt;u0026lt; and Albus is missing againu0026gt;u0026gt;<br /><br />Cominciamo a demolire il protagonista, prima gli onori di casa li fa Albus Severus Potter ovviamente.<br />Un nome un programma! della famiglia c'è poco da dire perché ha un fratello o una sorella (di cui onestamente avrei voluto sapere di più) ma tranquilli verranno nominati solo una volta in tutto il libro e poi spariranno ed i meno attenti penseranno che Albus sia figlio unico (non lo è, ma tecnicamente è come se lo fosse perché sia JK che i genitori cagano solamente il piccolo Albus 'sono un emo' Potter).<br />Albus, James e Lily infatti vanno anche a scuola insieme ma non si parlano, non si vedono, in pratica non esistono proprio ma JK non ci spiega neanche il perché. Sembra che Albus sia invidioso di James ed un po' anche di Lily (perché pure lei è stata smistata a grifondoro, tranne il piccolo albus insomma anche i muri di casa Potter sono stati smistati a grifondoro) quindi semplicemente non ci parla. Punto. Non ci dice nemmeno come è il rapporto in famiglia, semplicemente vengono cancellati dopo le primissime 10 pagine.<br />Davvero ridicolo che alla fine Harry dica che suo figlio James non gli assomigli affatto, perché Harry precisa di aver dovuto sempre faticare per ottenere dei risultati, proprio come Albus! ...aspettate, come Albus?! Albus ha dovuto faticare? Non mi sembra, chiaramente deve essermi sfuggito vediamo di fare due conti. Albus fa un piano e quel piano miracolosamente subito funziona anche (o meglio sopratutto) quando questo piano è impossibile. Ad esempio entra al ministero fischiettando 'i'm walking on sunshineee whoooa!' ed assolutamente nessuno lo nota, anche se è stato così geniale da prendere, con i suoi amici, le sembianze di una persona famosa come Harry Potter e del ministro della magia aka Hermione, insomma persone sconosciute che nessuno noterebbe. <br />Qual è il suo piano geniale? la polisucco! dico geniale perché è una pozione mai usata nella storia di HP quindi avrà fatto piacere a tutti scommetto ritrovarla tra le scatole (che colpo di scena, eh?). Si ecco, ovviamente ci vuole un mese per fare una pozione polisucco, ed ovviamente normali studenti non la sanno fare! ma questo non conta niente perché per Albus u0026amp; friends è tutto fattibile. Anche perché la storia avanza veloce come l'espresso di Hogwarts quindi non ci sarebbe stato tempo per inventare qualche cosa di meno banale della polisucco, contando che in 200 pagine passiamo ben cinque anni di Hogwarts e quattro li facciamo nelle prime quaranta pagine. Non mi lamento, insomma pensate che tortura sette libri con Albus Severus come protagonista?! <br />Nonostante le misure di sicurezza di Hogwarts (ai suoi tempi si diceva che non esisteva posto più sicuro di Hogwarts) Albus riesce a far entrare Delphi nella foresta proibita come fosse niente (effettivamente si era già preso gioco delle divese di un altro posto che avrebbe dovuto essere impenetrabile come il Ministero con una banalissima polisucco, si spererebbe che dopo tutte le cose successe in passato qualcuno avesse pensato a delle misure di sicurezza con una grazia? ed invece no. Cioè Hermione ministro della magia, Hermione la stessa che è entrata nel Ministero ai tempi di Voldemort proprio con una polisucco non ha pensato a mettere qualche cosa che impedisse alal gente di entrare e fare i suoi porci comodi con una cosa come una polisucco? Insomma Hermione che ci stai a fare lì allora?! <br />Per spiegare brevemente l'incredibile fortuna che accompagna Albus per tutto il libro dico solo che se Albus fosse stato il protagonista dei primi sette libri al posto di Harry sarebbe salito sulla barca per Hogwarts già con la pietra filosofale in tasca ed avrebbe rotto il primo horcrux prima ancora di venire smistato.<br /><br />Il "piano della coperta" poi è così sbagliato che nemmeno spiego nei dettagli quanto sia completamente sbagliato (suggerimento: si ogni punto), dico solamente che era impossibile che Harry proprio in un momento del genere con tutte le cose da fare ed a cui pensare, con il figlio disperso, eccetra eccetra andasse in camera del figlio (dove a detta di ginny NON poteva entrare) a prendere proprio quella coperta che non gli serviva a niente in quel momento ed oltretutto si mettesse a leggere, perché guarda una coperta in cui non c'è mai stato niente vediamo un po' se appare qualche scritta. Impossibile.<br />La descrizione che vogliono darci di Albus è 'poor kid has saved the world' quando per colpa sua è successo tutto, per colpa sua è morto un ragazzino, per colpa sua a momenti morivano tutti. Avrebbe dovuto essere mandato fuori da Hogwats a calci in culo, ma ovviamente è figlio di Harry Potter quindi pacca sulla spalla e 'non farlo più campione, va bene?'. Ovvio.<br />La differenza fondamentale tra Harry ed il suo inutile figlio è che Harry faceva cose illegali non perché voleva ma perché era costretto, Albus invece non rispetta una regola che sia una. Lo hanno appena punito con una pacca sulla spalla dopo che ha fatto un casino incredibile? perfetto! il secondo dopo già sparisce di nuovo a combinare altri danni! Il bello è che nessuno lo vede come uno che fa come gli pare e piace, no! Albus è l'eroe!<br /><br />Il pezzo nella realtà alternativa con Snape mi ha fatto talmente ridere che boh.<br />Snape così OOC che nemmeno nelle fanfiction. Quando gli dicono che è morto lui 'vabbé fa niente, sono morto da eroe no? quindi che problema c'è?' eeeh chi non prenderebbe la cosa così irrealisticamente bene?. Snape che dava della mezzosangue ad Hermione anche nell'ultimo libro mentre parlava con il quadro di Silente ora improvvisamente è amicone di tutti, ammira Hermione (che a quanto pare non considera miracolosamente più una dal sangue sporco) e fa battutine con Ron (non si sono mai potuti reggere a vicenda), insomma non so chi sia quello ma chiaramente non è il personaggio complesso che era Severus Snape.<br />Dato che ho citato Ron ed Hermione parliamo della figlia, ovvero Rose, ovvero personaggio inutile e odioso che scommetto non è piaciuta a nessuno. <br />Non prende il premio come peggior personaggio del libro perché per fortuna sparisce dopo 10 pagine, altrimenti lo sarebbe stata visto l'andazzo prometteva di essere uno di quei personaggi che prenderesti volentieri a badilate sui denti. Il modo in cui tratta Albus è inqualificabile 'facciamo gli amiconi solo finché ci guardano i grandi, poi non provare a guardarmi eh!', anche perché non ha nessuna ragione per odiare fino a questo punto Albus (che fino ad allora non aveva dato tendenze insopportabili) ed oltretutto è stata tirata su da due genitori che mi sono sempre sembrati piuttosto aperti mentalmente e non così pronti ad affossare gli altri per "salvarsi la faccia" e passare per quelli cool della scuola. Hermione e Ron che andavano in giro con Harry anche quando tutta Hogwarts gli andava (ripetutamente) contro ora hanno una figlia che fa la bulletta, ottimo proprio quello che volevo scoprire.<br />Il fatto che prenda in giro Scorpius e che lui le muoia anche dietro alla fine è una poracceria incredibile. Poi mi raccomando deve precisare sempre che lei è una Granger, sia mai che sia presa per una Weasley visto che i Weasley e sopratutto Ron sono trattati come la peggio merda in questo libro. Non è che Albus è chiamato un Potter-Weasley perché di Ginny chiaramente non importa a nessuno, però che Rose sia una GRANGER-Weasley invece mettiamolo chiarissimo fin da subito e sottolineamo sopratutto che è una Granger nel caso qualcuno malauguratamente dovesse ricordare che è figlia pure di Ron!<br />A proposito di Ginny: povera, povera Ginny! mai piaciuta nei vecchi libri di HP, ma piazzarla in questo libro e renderla inutile pure qui che senso ha?! come nei vecchi libri solo che peggio.<br />Non solo non conta niente nell'educazione dei figli (e nemmeno nei loro nomi visto che li ha chiaramente scelti TUTTI harry) ma oltretutto ha pure il coraggio di accusare il marito se hanno un figlio fuori di capoccia come Albus. Davvero Harry, tuo figlio è odioso, ti dice che ti odia, ti incolpa dei suoi fallimenti, dice che non vorrebbe essere tuo figlio come OSI rispondere e dire che anche a te lui ha rotto le scatole? suvvia, dovevi dire che aveva ragione lui e dargliela buona infondo non sta affatto crescendo viziato no? Esatto.<br /><br />Scorpius clamorosamente personaggio migliore del libro, dico clamorosamente perché pensavo fosse il Draco 2.0 invece del padre non ha niente (per fortuna). Sarebbe un incrocio tra un tassorosso ed un corvonero ma indovinate in che casa finisce? serpeverde ovviamente. Perché JK conosce solo due case: Serpeverde e Grifondoro, tutte le altre sono FUFFA! E poi si chiede come mai nessuno vuole Tassorosso, cavolo quando hai la possibilità rifare la storia e mettere finalmente qualcuno anche nei corvi e nei tassi che fai? niente ovviamente, tutti grifi e serpi come al solito! La sua cotta per Rose è senza senso, se ne invaghisce subito e sembra uno stupido vicino a lei perché lei lo offende, gli da due di picche, ecc. e lui sembra felice di essere mandato educatamente a quel paese. Il suo rapporto con Rose è inesistente, davvero perché forzare la romance a questo modo proprio non l'ho capito (dubito che ci sia qualcuno che shippi Rose/Scorpius per le loro interazioni nel libro).<br /><br />Ciligina sulla torta: Harry u0026amp; Co. sono usciti DISTRUTTI da questo libro, il magico trio non è più tanto magico per niente.<br />Il rapporto Harry/Ron è INESISTENTE. Vi ricordate Ron ed Harry, migliori amici sempre ad aiutarci a vicenda, sempre pronti uno per l'altro? Dimenticateveli. In pratica non si parlano, ma quando si parlano non direste mai e poi mai che sono migliori amici. Al massimo si nota un lieve amicizia Harry/Hermione ma basta, niente che faccia ricordare i bei tempi d'oro.<br />Draco è un altro personaggio che leggendo il libro ho pensato: ma tu chi sei? perché ti Draco Malfoy non è che hai poi molto. Capisco il voler far "redimere" un personaggio che non era positivo ma che ai fan era piaciuto molto, ma così non so a me è sembrato praticamente azzerato e molto noioso. Diceva spesso cose giuste in compenso, tipo quandoo che si lamenta della posizione di Hermione come ministro della magia mi ha trovato incredibilmente d'accordo, insomma è indubbio che sia una maga capace ma dimostra in questo libro quanto poco fosse pronta ad una posizione di comando (tenere una giratempo perché pensavi ce ne fosse un'altra? davvero JK? una scusa migliore proprio non c'era?).<br />Il povero Ron invece merita un paragrafo a parte perché povero povero povero Ron! Sembra un idiota in questo libro. Ron che è stato prefetto di Grifondoro deve per forza passare come il cretino del gruppo. E' indubbio che JK lo ami meno degli altri due membri del trio: tutti ovviamente sono di successo tranne Ron, che anche lui rimane deluso nella realtà alternativa quado gli dicono che lavorerà per un negozio di scherzi. Pensava quello che pensavamo tutti; 'insomma Harry ha raccomandato mezzo mondo ma a me essere migliore amico del bambino che è sopravissuto non ha portato un cavolo di vantaggio?' no, infatti. <br />Ha 40 anni ma si comporta in maniera più immatura di quando ne aveva 11, crisi di mezza età?<br />Il suo problema poi è la coppia Ron/Hermeione perché vedere gente sul web impazzire per la Dramione per una singola frase e fare certi commenti mi ha fatta molto sorridere. Insomma Ron ed Hermione in questo libro si amano anche quando lui è sposato con un'alttra donna in una realtà alternativa, si baciano più di ogni altra coppia del libro, lui le chiede di sposarlo una seconda volta giusto per ripetere il matrimonio, decide di rimanere con Hermione e di morire assieme a lei pur di non abbandonarla (quando potrebbe fuggire e salvarsi la vita), ecc. ma 'Romione non sono una coppia!1 Hermione merita di meglio!" ma quando Draco dice che gli piace venire comandato a bacchetta da Hermione 'Dramione è così bella!! vedo l'amore u0026lt;u0026lt;3' ok, siete strani.<br />Se Harry difende Ginny oltretutto è così 'coraggioso, oh Harry così innamorato!' se Ron fa la stessa cosa con Hermione è impiccione, doveva pensare ai fatti suoi, omg è di nuovo Ron che dice cose senza usare il cervello! Hermione sa difendersi da sola, che pensavi Ron? Insomma boh, non so che pesi e misure usi chi ha scritto questa cosa, ma chiaramente sono tutti sfasati.<br />Perché quando Hermione non si mette con Ron passa da ministro della Magia a insegnante di Hogwarts? fatico a capire il collegamento, casomai il contrario era più fattibile. Se hai dei figli e vuoi occuparti di loro (cosa che comunque Hermione non ha fatto visto che ha detto che se ne è occupato solo Ron) dovrai ridimensionare le tue ambizioni, ma se non sei sposata e sei capace ed ambiziosa come Hermione è allora che cosa ti ferma?!<br /><br />Dobbiamo proprio parlare di Delphi poi? dobbiamo? va bene: Delphi ridicola, partendo dal nome arrivando a tutto il resto.<br />Nessuno si chiede come è possibile che questa sia apparsa dal nulla, ma non ha amici, parenti, qualcuno Amos Diggory?! che poi una con i capelli di quel colore si dovrebbe notare, no!? e invece no. Poi viene allevata da due mangiamorte estremisti, scusate ma come è possibile che questi due visto che erano pro Voldemort e lo sapevano TUTTI non solo non li hanno sbattuti ad Azkaban ma gli hanno fatto pure crescere una bambina?! Strega super brillante poi a quanti anni? è una ragazzina ed a momenti fa il culo ad Harry Potter, vabbé non è una forzatura giuro!<br />Altre cose senza senso;<br />Theodre Nott mangiamorte così a random poi, quando la Rowling non lo aveva dipinto in un estratto con Draco mai uscito ufficialmente come uno assolutamente non interessato a Voldemort ed ai mangiamorte? (al contrario di Draco). Sembra che abbia detto: "chi dei vecchi personaggi di HP posso riutilizzare? oh tò! c'è theodore nott, usiamolo tanto nessuno si ricorderà nemmeno di sia!" geniale proprio.<br />Senza senso voler sminuire Lucius e Narcissa, quando per quanto personaggi negativi hanno sempre avuto come qualità che li poteva redimere l'amore per il figlio ora improvvisamente nemmeno quello così senza motivo (per rendere Draco un po' emo e solitario probabilmente). <br />Il Voldemort day, siete seri?<br />Cedric mangiamorte! insomma tassorosso GIUSTI E LEALI, ma dato che ha fatto un figurone di merda al torneo dei tre maghi allora diventa malvagio BUAHAHAH. Ha senso? No direi, io ne ho fatte di figure di merda in vita mia questo non mi ha fatto diventare un serial killer (ed io oltretutto non verrei nemeno mai smistata a tassorosso, quindi ho più possibilità di cedric di diventare mangiamorte sicuramente). Oltretutto non diventa mangiamorte dopo come tutti, cioè non è che dopo quando voldemort sale al potere uno ha paura e dice 'chi me lo fa fare di ribellarmi? non ce l'ha con me, se sto buono almeno posso vivere' no! lo fa PRIMA! perché alla battaglia di hogwarts cedric era già un mangiamorte ed ha addirittura ucciso neville (neville che è uno dei personaggi importanti di hp, neville che insegna ad hogwarts dove succedono le cose, neville che giustamente non ha nemmeno UNA battuta!). Si perché dopo una figura di merda uno a 18 anni decide di andare ad uccidere ragazzini, HA SENSO! ...solo che non ne ha. Ci rendiamo conto di quanto ha voluto distruggere un personaggio, L'UNICO personaggio che aveva dato ai tassorosso ovviamente? Taassorosso ribellatevi!<br /><br />Ho aspettato tutti questi anni per questa cosa? Sai che ti dico JK? il libro dei malandrini se devi farlo così non lo voglio più.</span>  <a data-text-id="9840216291386743437" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> If I hadn't had that obligation I might have DNF'd it</span>  <a data-text-id="3795610400439643115" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Oct 20, 2016 09:21AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1787758233' style='display:
