class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544336956" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544336956" />    <a title="José" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/35062854-jos"><img alt="José" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474660683p2/35062854.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544336956?book_show_action=false">Aug 15, 2016</a>      <a title="José" class="user" name="José" href="/user/show/35062854-jos">José</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35062854-jos?shelf=fantasy-read">fantasy-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544336956" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16100774193740009957">(Reseña en español más abajo).<br /><br />I'll write a longer review someday, for now I'll only say that the plot was awful and the only reason why I didn't rate it lower was because of the nostalgic value. The whole story makes no sense at all and it seemed to be a fan-fiction script.<br />I prefer to pretend that this is a standalone book and not part of a series that I love so much. <br />----------------------<br /><a href="http://rincondellectorconstante.blogspot.com/p/resenas.html" rel="nofollow">Puedes leer ésta y otras reseñas en mi blog.</a><br /><br />La verdad que no tenía grandes expectativas con respecto a esta</span>  <span id="freeText16100774193740009957" style="display:none">(Reseña en español más abajo).<br /><br />I'll write a longer review someday, for now I'll only say that the plot was awful and the only reason why I didn't rate it lower was because of the nostalgic value. The whole story makes no sense at all and it seemed to be a fan-fiction script.<br />I prefer to pretend that this is a standalone book and not part of a series that I love so much. <br />----------------------<br /><a href="http://rincondellectorconstante.blogspot.com/p/resenas.html" rel="nofollow">Puedes leer ésta y otras reseñas en mi blog.</a><br /><br />La verdad que no tenía grandes expectativas con respecto a esta historia y también pensé que era una pésima idea por parte de Rowling. Para mí la historia de Harry ya se terminó con las Reliquias de la Muerte, todo lo demás es fan-fiction. Peeero, como los libros de Harry Potter fueron grandes responsables de que hoy tenga el hábito de leer prácticamente todos los días, inevitablemente tenía que leer este "libro". <br /><br />Lo primero que tengo que decir es que fue muy lindo volver a leer una historia ambientada en el universo creado por Rowling, fue como reencontrarse con viejos amigos. Al igual que me sucedió cuando era chico devoré este libro en apenas una noche, algo que hoy en día me resulta difícil. En ese sentido la magia de Harry Potter está intacta, fue imposible despegarme de esta historia una vez que me acostumbré al hecho de que en realidad no es una novela, sino el guión de una obra de teatro. <br /><br />Lo cual me lleva a hablar de la estructura del libro. Al principio me resultó un poco incómodo, y extrañé muchísimo las descripciones extensas, perderme en aquel maravilloso mundo lleno de magia. Obviamente, por tratarse de un guión, se saltean muchas cosas que hubiesen sido interesantes de conocer en detalle (los dos primeros años de Albus en Hogwarts pasan en un par de páginas, por ejemplo). Por suerte, acostumbrarme a la forma en que está escrito no se me hizo tan difícil como pensaba, y en apenas un par de capítulos me enganché como con cualquier otra historia de Harry Potter. <br /><br />Hasta ahí todo bien, pero luego está el pequeño gran inconveniente de esta historia: el contenido. Todo me pareció muy traído de los pelos y hubo un montón de cosas que no tienen ningún sentido (que obviamente no voy a revelar para no spoilear). Sinceramente hubo algunos "giros" que no sorprenden para nada y muchas cosas convenientemente inventadas para esta historia que no son coherentes con los libros anteriores. En vez de ser una historia original, con nuevas aventuras y centrada en nuevos personajes, la obra recurre a hechos anteriores y apela más bien a la nostalgia que uno siente por el universo de Harry Potter en lugar de intentar algo innovador (seguramente por miedo a cagarla).<br />Ejemplo de esto último hay varios a lo largo de toda la obra: aparecen algunos viejos personajes muy queridos por los fans, pero que en mi opinión no tienen cabida en la historia o son completamente diferentes a como eran en los libros anteriores; como que son demasiado "acartonados" y unidimensionales (de nuevo, posiblemente se deba a que es un guión y no estoy acostumbrado a leer este tipo de textos). <br /><br />Si algo disfruté de los libros de Harry Potter fue esa mezcla de misterio y magia, con las revelaciones al final de cada libro que te dejaban boquiabierto. Por desgracia, nada de eso ocurre en este libro.<br />Por suerte los personajes nuevos (sobre todo Scorpius Malfoy) y el emotivo final hacen que esta historia valga la pena, de lo contrario estaría ante uno de los peores libros que leí en los últimos años. <br /><br /><b>Calificación 5/10:<br />Como parte de la saga, Harry Potter y el Niño Maldito deja mucho que desear. En lugar de intentar crear algo nuevo, recurre a eventos de los libros anteriores para basar prácticamente toda su trama. Hay muchos detalles que se pierden por tratarse de una obra de teatro y otros aspectos que simplemente son producto de la falta de ideas. <br /><br />Estoy siendo generoso con la calificación porque me encantó reencontrarme con Harry, Ron y Hermione, y el mágico mundo creado por J. K Rowling. Sin embargo, si consideramos este libro como parte de la saga, resulta espantoso; parece escrito por un fanático debido a ciertos cameos que no tienen mucho sentido y otros giros que resultan muy poco creíbles.<br /><br />Personalmente prefiero hacer de cuenta que este libro es una historia extra y que no forma parte de la saga.</b><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="16100774193740009957" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1715909349" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1715909349" />    <a title="Cristina Leitón" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4579079-cristina-leit-n"><img alt="Cristina Leitón" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478207891p2/4579079.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1715909349?book_show_action=false">Aug 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Cristina Leitón" class="user" name="Cristina Leitón" href="/user/show/4579079-cristina-leit-n">Cristina Leitón</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4579079-cristina-leit-n?shelf=english">english</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4579079-cristina-leit-n?shelf=plays">plays</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4579079-cristina-leit-n?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1715909349" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2818731764576154050">Harry Potter y sus aventuras fueron parte de mi infancia y siguieron acompañándome mientras crecía, y estaría mintiendo si dijera que no siguieron formando parte de mi vida cuando terminaron. Porque terminaron, ¿recordáis? Cuando salió la última película y todos lloramos en el cine cuando sonó la música de la primera película justamente en la última escena de Las reliquias de la muerte, Parte 2, ese epílogo que tanta gente odió en el libro y que es precisamente el inicio de <i>Harry Potter and the</i></span>  <span id="freeText2818731764576154050" style="display:none">Harry Potter y sus aventuras fueron parte de mi infancia y siguieron acompañándome mientras crecía, y estaría mintiendo si dijera que no siguieron formando parte de mi vida cuando terminaron. Porque terminaron, ¿recordáis? Cuando salió la última película y todos lloramos en el cine cuando sonó la música de la primera película justamente en la última escena de Las reliquias de la muerte, Parte 2, ese epílogo que tanta gente odió en el libro y que es precisamente el inicio de <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i>. Y no sé si esperaba algo o no de él, pero a mí me ha chiflado y me muero por verlo representado, que es cuando creo que podrá disfrutar de la historia al cien por cien.<br /><br />La octava historia, diecinueve años después. Y es precisamente eso lo que nos encontramos: otra historia. No la considero continuación, sino una parte más de la historia del mundo mágico y, en específico, de las familias y amigos del trío protagonista de la saga principal. Lo primero que hay que tener en cuenta es que <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i> es un guión. <b>No se puede leer sin tener en cuenta todos los factores que se añaden a la historia, como las interpretaciones de los actores y actrices, la iluminación, el movimiento y el propio escenario</b>. Por lo tanto, hay que leerlo sabiendo y entendiendo que faltan muchos elementos, y que la octava historia no se puede valorar realmente hasta verla representada, porque todo lo que aporta la descripción o el propio formato de novela no se puede encontrar aquí.<br /><br />Sea necesario o no (qué tontería, por cierto, el arte en todas sus formas siempre es necesario), creo que <b>un mundo como el que creó Rowling hace tantos años y que ha seguido creciendo sin parar en la cultura popular puede y merece ser recuperado las veces que se quiera</b>. No tenía que estar a la altura de los demás libros, porque simplemente no puede: no es una novela, las novelas acabaron con el séptimo libro y eso lo sabemos todos. Esto es, simplemente, <i>otra cosa</i>. He reído con las bromas de Ron, me he emocionado con algunas escenas maravillosas (¡la página 137 es perfecta, no hay más que imaginarla en vivo!), he alucinado imaginándome cómo llevarían a cabo algunas acotaciones sobre hechizos y otras indicaciones más propias de un guión de cine que de teatro y me he enamorado de los nuevos personajes, más de unos que de otros.<br /><br />Algunas acotaciones son pura magia. Llama la atención que sean precisamente los fragmentos de texto que no están pensados para decirse en voz alta, sino que son puras indicaciones para representación, los que pueden considerarse más literarios dentro de la obra. Por eso es genial leerlo, porque las acotaciones tienen tantos detalles y transmiten tantas sensaciones que uno puede imaginárselo a su manera pero siempre como algo llenísimo de magia.<br /><br />Scorpius Malfoy me ha robado el corazón. Ese chico que solo quiere un amigo, el chico gracioso y tímido y valiente que lo daría todo por las personas que quiere. Para mí es él el verdadero protagonista de la obra, y no Albus o Harry. Y en cuanto a los demás, me ha gustado mucho ver <b>cómo han evolucionado las relaciones entre los personajes que ya conocíamos, y también poder descubrir cómo llevan sus nuevos roles, ya sea de trabajadores del ministerio o como padres y madres de una nueva generación</b> de la que me hubiera gustado ver mucho más, pero para la que hay tiempo y aventuras suficientes esperando.<br /><br />Como punto negativo, es verdad que algunos puntos de la trama se pasan un poco por alto y no se tratan en profundidad. Sin embargo, como ya he dicho, esto no es una novela. <b>El tiempo en una obra de teatro no se trata de igual manera que una novela, y todos los elementos de la historia deben adaptarse al formato</b>. Por lo tanto, es normal que se centre la atención en los personajes y sus relaciones y se deje un poco más de lado que todas las tramas se traten extensamente; la acción no es más que una excusa para mostrar las relaciones entre padres y madres y sus hijos e hijas, al igual que entre amigos, que es la base de toda la obra de Rowling. Y es precisamente esa amistad sin límites con lo que me quedo de <i>Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</i>. Nadie puede destruirla, ni si quiera el paso del tiempo.</span>  <a data-text-id="2818731764576154050" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1546541245" />    <a title="Kassie" class="left imgcol"      <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1546541245?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Kassie" class="user" name="Kassie" href="/user/show/30107088-kassie">Kassie</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/29058155-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1546541245" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16530496353727407263">Okay so I knew I was going to be iffy about this one because of the formatting of a play but we're going to not talk about that because it couldn't be helped.<br /><br />The beginning of this book (the first half) had me very "meh" about the plot. It just was okay. It was a lot of if these kids weren't so dumb then there would literally be no problem to make this story.<br /><br />There were some things I loved especially in the second half of the book. There's a scene between Scorpius and a man that I can't say who it</span>  <span id="freeText16530496353727407263" style="display:none">Okay so I knew I was going to be iffy about this one because of the formatting of a play but we're going to not talk about that because it couldn't be helped.<br /><br />The beginning of this book (the first half) had me very "meh" about the plot. It just was okay. It was a lot of if these kids weren't so dumb then there would literally be no problem to make this story.<br /><br />There were some things I loved especially in the second half of the book. There's a scene between Scorpius and a man that I can't say who it is without spoilers that made me almost cry and I couldn't handle it!!<br /><br />I also loved the scene with Harry when he's speaking to the portrait of Dumbledore, that hit me emotionally as well.<br /><br />I do have a vlog review that will be going up on my channel, inspired by Sierra from SierraReads that has plenty of spoilers in it if you want to know specific thoughts on specific moments of the book. <br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="16530496353727407263" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1546541245">  <td id="freeTextContainer9097890540477472942">No sabía qué esperar (a pesar de habérmelo spoileado entero), pero me ha gustado mucho. Tal vez no llegue al nivel del resto de la saga, pero es una obra muy digna.<br /><br />EDITO: En este vídeo cuento mi opinión con más detalle <a target="_blank"     <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1714409001">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1714409001'><a id="like_count_review_1714409001" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1714409001?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">41 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1714409001" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1714409001" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=41u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=6u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1714409001u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1714409001?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=6">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1714409001' style='display: none;'></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1745874008" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1745874008" />    <a title="Matthew" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16254355-matthew"><img alt="Matthew" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464987365p2/16254355.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1745874008?book_show_action=false">Sep 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Matthew" class="user" name="Matthew" href="/user/show/16254355-matthew">Matthew</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781338099133" href="/book/show/29069989-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-parts-1-2">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16254355-matthew?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16254355-matthew?shelf=library">library</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16254355-matthew?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16254355-matthew?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1745874008" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4550969933949960532">I wasn't sure if I was going to read this book. I heard some people rave about it and some people curse it (pun fully intended). When my wife happened to get a copy without much of a wait at the library, I figured I might as well give it a shot. <br /><br />I actually enjoyed it quite a lot!<br /><br />It is a script, so it is and easy and quick read. I thought the story was interesting and as original as it could be in a world as developed as Harry Potter's.<br /><br />At times, it did feel a bit like fan fiction. Also, there was</span>  <span id="freeText4550969933949960532" style="display:none">I wasn't sure if I was going to read this book. I heard some people rave about it and some people curse it (pun fully intended). When my wife happened to get a copy without much of a wait at the library, I figured I might as well give it a shot. <br /><br />I actually enjoyed it quite a lot!<br /><br />It is a script, so it is and easy and quick read. I thought the story was interesting and as original as it could be in a world as developed as Harry Potter's.<br /><br />At times, it did feel a bit like fan fiction. Also, there was a reference to almost every person, potion, spell, and event in the original series. Because of this, at time it felt a little forced and cheesy, but not enough to make me not like it.<br /><br />I could easily see this being another movie, but there seems to be almost too much in it and the settings/actions too complicated for a stage play. <br /><br />If you liked Harry Potter (and I think most people did), you should give this a shot.</span>  <a data-text-id="4550969933949960532" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1745874008">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1745874008" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1745874008'><a id="like_count_review_1745874008" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1745874008?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">48 </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544817104" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544817104" />    <a title="Francesca" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/31502192-francesca"><img alt="Francesca" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1446156110p2/31502192.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544817104?book_show_action=false">Nov 22, 2016</a>      <a title="Francesca" class="user" name="Francesca" href="/user/show/31502192-francesca">Francesca</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31502192-francesca?shelf=i-own-a-copy">i-own-a-copy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31502192-francesca?shelf=2016-reading-challenge">2016-reading-challenge</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31502192-francesca?shelf=plays">plays</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31502192-francesca?shelf=male-authors">male-authors</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31502192-francesca?shelf=female-authors">female-authors</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31502192-francesca?shelf=200-to-400-pages">200-to-400-pages</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31502192-francesca?shelf=hardback-owned">hardback-owned</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544817104" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16571405461738430420">I'm going to start this review with a warning. This review is going to have some spoilers dotted about in it. I would try not to include any but I really don't see it happening as it's hard to me to explain the things I did and didn't like about it without saying exactly what those things are. I won't be putting in spoiler tags because there will probably be a lot. If you don't want any spoilers, I would suggest you just don't read this review and skip to someone else's but if you don't mind</span>  <span id="freeText16571405461738430420" style="display:none">I'm going to start this review with a warning. This review is going to have some spoilers dotted about in it. I would try not to include any but I really don't see it happening as it's hard to me to explain the things I did and didn't like about it without saying exactly what those things are. I won't be putting in spoiler tags because there will probably be a lot. If you don't want any spoilers, I would suggest you just don't read this review and skip to someone else's but if you don't mind getting spoilers or you've already read it/seen the play and you're intrigued by my opinion then go ahead. I will be starting with the things I liked and then moving onto the things I didn't.<br /><br /><br />The things I liked:<br /><br />1. Scorpius Malfoy. How could I not love him? How could anyone not love him? Although, I don't really understand how he was a Slytherin. He clearly fitted Hufflepuff or Ravenclaw better but then I guess A) he may not have met Albus and become such good friends and B) the Harry Potter books have always overlooked Hufflepuff and Ravenclaw as secondary houses, with the exception of Luna and a few side characters.<br /><br />2. Draco Malfoy. I fully support the idea that Draco would've turned himself round and been a great and accepting Dad. We saw his hesitations when he was younger, we saw how he realised in Half Blood Prince that he wasn't cut out for the life his Father wanted for him, we saw in Deathly Hallows how he realised he was on the wrong side and changed his way. I am in full support of this portrayal of him as someone who as an adult is accepting of their child no matter what and who raised a good, decent human being because he realised the errors of his Fathers ways and learnt from his own mistakes. Draco Malfoy that marries a woman that his Father doesn't approve of and who protects and cares about his wife and child so fiercely and passionately is the Draco Malfoy that I am on board with. 100%.<br /><br />3. The scene with Hagrid when he picks up baby Harry to take him to the Dursleys because that was too precious for this world. Hagrid is too precious for this world.<br /><br />4. The plot was fairly fun and entertaining. I read it incredibly fast and found it hard to put down.<br /><br />5. Some of the quotes and lines were good. I liked Draco and Ginny opening up about their experiences and how they felt at Hogwarts. I liked that every timeline they ended up in, Hermione and Ron still had feelings for each other and were still shown as basically meant to be (mostly because as someone who has shipped those two forever and will continue to do so, it was great to see it confirmed for all the people that still deny that pairing).<br /><br />6. I can imagine the stage play being at least visually amazing. The sets that were described, I could picture and I felt like it would be great to watch. (Although, I still don't understand why they sell the tickets for part 1 and 2 separately. I mean, I do understand because they want more money even thought the tickets are ridiculously expensive as it is but expecting people to pay twice so that they get the whole story is absurd) <br /><br /><br />Things I disliked (hold onto your sorting hats because this is where I release the fantastic beast):<br /><br />1. Albus Potter and Rose Weasley. Albus came across as a bit of a brat to me, there was nothing very appealing about him, and nothing about him drew me in and made me feel very much for him. Rose was rude and snobby. I refuse to believe that Hermione and Ron would raise someone like her. Hermione was fairly rude and snobby at the start of the first book, but she changed and developed and grew out of it. By the end of the books she was basically the opposite to how she was in the first book with the exception of still being incredibly intelligent. Her child would not be raised to be like that. Ron would not raise a child who was that far up her own ass.<br /><br />2. The characterisation of the main trio. There is no way in hell that Harry would be a bad Dad. That was not Harry Potter. I don't know who that was. Harry who was raised by a family that hated him, that searched for and yearned for loving fatherly figures. Who basically had four loving fatherly figures in the shape of Hagrid, Arthur Weasley, Sirius Black, and Remus Lupin who he could watch and learn from. After all of that he would not treat any of his children that poorly. He would not tell his son 'it's fine if you get into Slytherin because there are still great people that have come from that house' and then when his son gets sorted into Slytherin be disappointed and pissed off about it and fail to hide it from him. Harry Potter would never speak that way to McGonagall. Never! I am expected to believe that he would talk to the woman who he has so much respect for that he stepped in front of a wand and cursed someone that dared to spit at her in such a disrespectful, rude, and nasty way? Hell no. Hermione Granger was so bland. Where was her fiery attitude, where was her stubbornness, where was her passion, most importantly where was her intelligence?? Hermione is too intelligent to have thought hiding a time turner in her bookcase was a great place to hide it. She is too clever to not have better protection at the ministry and for her office, especially considering that she broke into the ministry herself before and should know to use some sort of spell to stop people who are using polyjuice potion to come in. She is too passionate and caring to allow her child to be mean and rude towards other people that she views as less than. Hermione is too fiery to be unable to keep people's attention at a meeting she has called. Ron Weasley was basically movie Ron as opposed to book Ron. Movie Ron was always just a shell of the character he is in the books. Apart from the perfect casting, the writers of the movies stripped away his great moments and positive personality traits and they either gave his great moments to Hermione or they just disregarded them entirely. They made him the joke of the trio. The one who didn't really do much to help and just cracked a joke all the time. That was how they wrote him in this play as well. Ron has so much depth to his character and the movies and this play erased all of that.<br /><br />3. I'm always a sucker for time travel stories and stories about people going back and changing something and then coming back to see everything different. The butterfly effect (phoenix effect or hippogriff effect, in this case maybe?) is a plot that I am always on board with. However, it has to be done right and in this case, I had a lot of issues with it. There was no real logic or consistency with it and with how it worked. It was all over the place.<br /><br />4. The plot holes. In general, I find it quite easy to look past certain plot holes, especially when necessary but in this case they were all so glaringly obvious that it was hard to see past them. In what logical way was going to the first task to mess up Cedric a good place to start in the plan? In what logical way was going to the second task to mess him up a good plan when the first one, unsurprisingly, didn't work? Neither of those made sense. How well the contestants of the Triwizard Tournament did in the first two tasks had no real bearing on whether or not they would be able to get the cup in the last task. Him being tied with Harry meant that he could enter the maze first at the same time with him but after that they were separated and just managed to find each other again to grab the cup at the same time. Even if Cedric had entered the maze after Harry, there's no reason why he couldn't have beaten him to the cup or made it there at the same time again anyway. Not to mention the fact that Cedric came second in the first task anyway so sabotaging him in that one was unnecessary. Also, the plan was to embarrass him to the point where he'd drop out? That is a terrible plan to risk traveling back in time for. Delphi being Voldemort's daughter makes zero sense. If she had been introduced in the original books and had been conceived when Voldemort was first in power, maybe I could be on board with it but trying to claim the Bellatrix had her at Malfoy Manor just before the Battle of Hogwarts is absolute BS. Bellatrix wasn't pregnant, and showed no signs of either being pregnant or just having a baby, either when the trio ended up there or when she was at the battle of Hogwarts. If she had just had a baby before either of those then she deserved a damn medal. Plus, Draco would've known about it! She was his aunt and Voldemort and Bellatrix were staying at Malfoy Manor. Draco was there. He would've known that she was pregnant. He would've known that it was Voldemort's. His parents would've definitely known about it and they weren't ones for keeping things from Draco. The whole thing just doesn't work.<br /><br />5. Cedric Diggory. I'm expected to believe that it's possible that Cedric could/would become so embarrassed that he would turn to dark magic and become a death eater? Cedric Diggory?! The boy who believed in fair play and justice and doing the right thing every single time, no matter what. The boy who won a Quidditch match by default and refused to accept it and called for a redo because it was unfair. The boy who told Harry how to figure out the second task because Harry had let him know about the first one. The boy who refused to take the cup because he didn't think it was fair and felt that Harry deserved it for saving his life. The boy who was kind and good and true. You expect me to believe that there is anyway in any universe or any timeline that he could possibly become a death eater? Witch, please! GTFO! You don't deserve to even utter Cedric's name. He was a damn Hufflepuff for crying out loud!<br /><br />6. Albus and Scorpius were clearly gay or at least bi. It was made blatantly obvious throughout that they had feelings for each other that went well past friendship and yet they both fancied girls and Scorpius for some reason was really into Rose despite how horrible she was. I'm not even one that usually picks up on things like this or complains about them but this was so blatant and it was so obvious that I can't believe (although, sadly, I think I actually can) that they refused to acknowledge it.<br /><br />Overall, the book was OK. I was disappointed with a lot of it and I don't accept it (or at least most of it) as canon but, as a separate story which I consider as a fan fiction, it is a decent story that's fairly fun and entertaining.</span>  <a data-text-id="16571405461738430420" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544817104">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544817104" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544817104u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544817104'><a id="like_count_review_1544817104" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544817104?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">41 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544817104" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544817104" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=41u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=6u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1544817104u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1544817104" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1544817104, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">comment</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1544817104?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=6">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1544817104' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1544817104' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1544817104, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1714591714" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1714591714" />    <a title="Kris Taylor" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3036032-kris-taylor"><img alt="Kris Taylor" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_50x66-6a03a5c12233c941481992b82eea8d23.png" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714591714?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Kris Taylor" class="user" name="Kris Taylor" href="/user/show/3036032-kris-taylor">Kris Taylor</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3036032-kris-taylor?shelf=just-for-fun">just-for-fun</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714591714" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5792833634834656541">I'm so disappointed. I wanted to love this...I love Harry Potter and everything about the Harry Potter world. I wanted to immerse myself in 320 pages of old friends and new friends and walk away with the warm fuzzy feelings of nostalgia and joy. Instead, I put the book down as I finished it and just thought "eh." <br />1) The plot -- weak beyond weak. 'Going back in time causes changes in the present' is one of the oldest 'what ifs' in history, and authors have used it beautifully to explore possibili</span>  <span id="freeText5792833634834656541" style="display:none">I'm so disappointed. I wanted to love this...I love Harry Potter and everything about the Harry Potter world. I wanted to immerse myself in 320 pages of old friends and new friends and walk away with the warm fuzzy feelings of nostalgia and joy. Instead, I put the book down as I finished it and just thought "eh." <br />1) The plot -- weak beyond weak. 'Going back in time causes changes in the present' is one of the oldest 'what ifs' in history, and authors have used it beautifully to explore possibilities. Unfortunately, this book used the "what if" as a cheesy excuse to stick scenes from past books in almost word for word. Not only that, but the "effects" of the "changes" were weak and not substantiated by the cannon of Harry Potter. <br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ So many problems with this story line -- lets start with the most basic -- we are supposed to believe that Harry Potter's child doesn't realize that going back in time can change the future?The writers don't even give the audience enough respect to make up some kind of explanation behind why Albus thinks HIS change to history isn't going to have any effect aside from an offhanded "oh, Cedric was the spare" comment. Weak. But the plot holes keep growing: Cedric Diggory gets embarrassed and turns into a Death Eater? Ummm....no. Not the Cedric from the book who stays on Potter's side even after he DIES! How about Snape who buys that Scorpius is from an alternate reality with just a 3 minute talk? Not the Snape we know and love! So many more...  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />2) The characters -- see the above...if you're a Harry Potter superfan you know these characters like your own best friends - but even if all you've done is read the books, you still have clear expectations of characters. Rowling's series is YA literature, and despite the classes that have tried to read depth into them, the characters are unarguably clear. Having those characters change dramatically in a story with no catalyst besides "getting older" or "thinking" is a huge plot weakness. <br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Harry telling his son he wishes he wasn't his father? No way. This is the child who grew up WITHOUT a father, he KNOWS the power of a father. Ron and Hermione become side notes and almost caricatures of themselves. We've all loved Ron's lovable oafishness for years, but this book takes it to the extreme - he's a bumbling fool, and a total joke. Even Hermione -- who was always the brains of the operation -- is stupid enough to store the time turner in her own library with such a weak protection on it that Albus and Scorpius are able to break in and find it? While we're at it - lets talk about that break in scene -- the painful "Albus as Ron" moments making a joke of Ron and Hermione, but then it never comes back up? No discussion of "I want to have another baby or a vacation" disappearing from Ron's memory? And I haven't even gotten to DRACO becoming warm fuzzy??? "We can hug too if you want..." ummm...WHAT? Now don't get me wrong - I am one of the few people who actually LIKED Draco. I like the constant struggle he showed between his natural inclination to be evil, his desire to please his father, and his intrinsic tug of goodness. He has moments, and those moments are beautiful...but he is not going to be Harry POtter's new BFF just because they bonded over "gosh it was lonely growing up." WHAT IS THIS?? AN AFTER SCHOOL SPECIAL???  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />3) The writing....this is the death knell in my eyes. It doesn't ring with JK Rowling's language. Reading this is basically like reading a cliff notes version of a weak fan fiction piece. The language, the voice, the diction -- all of it basic and weak. Don't try to tell me it's because it's a play.....I read plays fairly frequently, and depth and beauty of language is even more important on stage -- see Tennessee Williams, or even Miranda's recent Hamilton. This just feels rushed and forced. I'm sure great actors could make it feel better - but as a pure script it fails. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ No real spoilers here -- the writing is just WEAK. In the words of one of my friends, it's "all sizzle no steak.." only the sizzle is pretty dang weak too.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />Overall, my final review is that this feels like a very weak attempt to keep the Harry Potter money train moving forward. I hate to say anything against Rowling, but this is clearly NOT her work...and why she would put her name on it is beyond me unless she just wants the money. My suggestion -- check it out from the library, don't waste your money. </span>  <a data-text-id="5792833634834656541" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1714591714">  <td colspan="2">    <div itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544188124" />    <a title="AleJandra Guido" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25897549-alejandra-guido"><img alt="AleJandra Guido" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1428033995p2/25897549.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544188124?book_show_action=false">Oct 19, 2016</a>      <a title="AleJandra Guido" class="user" name="AleJandra Guido" href="/user/show/25897549-alejandra-guido">AleJandra Guido</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25897549-alejandra-guido?shelf=fantasia">fantasia</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544188124" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11542144998430097226"><b>****4 <i> Love blinds</i> STARS****<br><br><blockquote> <i>"Bravery doesn't forgive stupidity."</i> </blockquote></b><br><br>Y el premio al peor padre del año es para.... HARRY POTTER <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470160866i/19896344._SX540_.png" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>No comentaré mucho de la historia, mi reseña será mas sobre mi experiencia con el libro. <br><br>Empezaré aclarando que yo no he leído todos los libros de la saga, solo leí el segundo cuando era adolescente, por qué solo el 2 y no el 1?, o por qué solo ese y no el resto?, la respuesta es que no lo se, no recuerdo la razón. <br><br>Se que algún día los leeré, pero ese día aun no llega. Si</span>  <span id="freeText11542144998430097226" style="display:none"><b>****4 <i> Love blinds</i> STARS****<br><br><blockquote><i>"Bravery doesn't forgive stupidity."</i> </blockquote></b><br><br>Y el premio al peor padre del año es para.... HARRY POTTER <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470160866i/19896344._SX540_.png" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>No comentaré mucho de la historia, mi reseña será mas sobre mi experiencia con el libro. <br><br>Empezaré aclarando que yo no he leído todos los libros de la saga, solo leí el segundo cuando era adolescente, por qué solo el 2 y no el 1?, o por qué solo ese y no el resto?, la respuesta es que no lo se, no recuerdo la razón. <br><br>Se que algún día los leeré, pero ese día aun no llega. Si soy fan de las películas y crecí con ellas, pero aun no estoy lista para los libros. Así que no tenia planeado leer este libro, pero leí tan buenas reseñas que no me pude resistir. <br><br>El formato de screenplay me pareció interesante y me sorprendió, no he tenido buenas experiencias leyendo screens, pero este en particular termino funcionando como lectura, ya que todo es directo al grano, no tenemos relleno, información innecesaria o descripciones.<b> Los diálogos son fluidos y todo avanza con buen ritmo. </b><br><br><u>Aunque al mismo tiempo debo recalcar que el plot principal de la historia me gusto mucho, y si me hubiera gustado que lo hubieran desarrollado en una novela completa, hubiera sido genial y un posible inicio a una nueva serie.</u><br><br>Ya que el libro nos queda debiendo, la historia central es buena pero nos queda faltando ver mas, saber mas. <br><br><b>Mi parte favorita:</b><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470506057i/19936388.jpg" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Me gusto mucho ver este futuro alterno, y como todo fue resultado de un pequeño cambio. Cedric sobrevive, se vuelve malo, mata a Neville y PUM Voldemor triunfa. <br><br>Me encanto regresar justo a mi parte favorita de la serie, El torneo de los 3 magos. Es obvio que los viajes en el tiempo tienen muchos huecos argumentales, ejemplo: Si Cedric no gano la primer prueba, entonces no consiguió el huevo dorado, por lo cual Harry no hubiera sabido como prepararse para la segunda prueba. Solo por mencionar uno. La verdad las paradojas de los viajes en el tiempo me causan dolor de cabeza.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>Sin duda nuestra generación, es la generación que vive ansiando volver al pasado, queriendo aferráramos a una vida mas simple y sencilla, tenemos un presente tan complicado que apreciamos cualquier cosa que nos haga recordar ese pasado lejos de nuestros problemas de adultos. Y si, este libro logra exactamente eso, ahogarnos en nostalgia. <br><br><b>Este libro fue como una reunión con los viejos amigos de la escuela, donde platicas de las aventuras que pasamos, las locuras que hicimos, los lugares que visitamos, reímos, recordamos y luego volvemos a nuestro presente con un poco de amargura. </b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470171635ra/19897678.gif" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Coment extra:</b>Soy la única pervertida que imagino sexy times entre Albus y Scorpius.? Scorpius fue mi personaje favorito.<br><br></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span> </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1715411273" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1715411273" />    <a title="Charlotte Jones" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/8943949-charlotte-jones"><img alt="Charlotte Jones" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1361900141p2/8943949.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1715411273?book_show_action=false">Aug 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Charlotte Jones" class="user" name="Charlotte Jones" href="/user/show/8943949-charlotte-jones">Charlotte Jones</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8943949-charlotte-jones?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8943949-charlotte-jones?shelf=play">play</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1715411273" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16945002292500554609">As many people are probably aware, I am a huge fan of Harry Potter. However, I was never excited to see this book released; I think the seven books were a complete story and although it would be great to see more novels set in this world, maybe the story of the Marauders for example, I think that the characters we all grew up with, such as Harry, Ron and Hermione, should be left well alone. I read this because my partner pre-ordered it and so I thought I'd give it a go.<br /><br />Straight away I was disapp</span>  <span id="freeText16945002292500554609" style="display:none">As many people are probably aware, I am a huge fan of Harry Potter. However, I was never excited to see this book released; I think the seven books were a complete story and although it would be great to see more novels set in this world, maybe the story of the Marauders for example, I think that the characters we all grew up with, such as Harry, Ron and Hermione, should be left well alone. I read this because my partner pre-ordered it and so I thought I'd give it a go.<br /><br />Straight away I was disappointed. Though the original story may have been thought up by J. K. Rowling, I felt as though this was horrendously written fan-fiction. The characters didn't feel like those that I grew up with. Despite the trio playing a huge part in this story, none of them felt like the writers knew them at all; they were pale shells of themselves, playing off the main character traits that almost made them seem ridiculous. <br /><br />I'm not going to go into the plot holes, the bad characterisation or the disappointing writing any further because I don't want to get into spoilers. Overall I would say to skip this one. I think seeing this performed would definitely be a better experience, though I'm not sure how they could ever fix all of the issues I have based on this script. There were several points in this book where I actually laughed out loud at things that happened, not because they were funny, almost because they made me feel sad. This isn't part of the canon to me, despite what J. K. Rowling has said. Honestly, it feels as though it was written by somebody who has only ever watched the films, has never read the books, and wanted a stage production/book that they knew would sell. Highly disappointing.</span>  <a data-text-id="16945002292500554609" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1715411273">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1715411273'><a id="like_count_review_1715411273" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1715411273?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">39 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1715411273" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1715411273" ref="like" comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1543984828" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543984828" />    <a title="Nikoleta" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13362307-nikoleta"><img alt="Nikoleta" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466461770p2/13362307.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543984828?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Nikoleta" class="user" name="Nikoleta" href="/user/show/13362307-nikoleta">Nikoleta</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13362307-nikoleta?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543984828" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12635028728994797277">Λοιπόν, ξεκίνησα να διαβάζω το Harry Potter and the Cursed Child με φόβο και πάθος. Είχα προετοιμαστεί ότι αυτό που θα διάβαζα είναι ένα θεατρικό σενάριο. Και δεν με πείραζε. Ακόμα δεν με πειράζει. Η αλήθεια είναι όμως ότι εξαιτίας αυτού, έχασε σαν κείμενο.<br />Παρόλα αυτά είχα και άλλα θέματα. Οι χαρακτήρες δεν με τράβηξαν, οι αγαπημένοι μου ήρωες λίγο πριν τα 40 έχουν μεταλλαχτεί σε κουρασμένους μεσοαστούς, με οικογενειακά θέματα κ.λ.π. Οκ, λέω, that’s reality, ούτως η άλλως οι πραγματικοί ήρωες το</span>  <span id="freeText12635028728994797277" style="display:none">Λοιπόν, ξεκίνησα να διαβάζω το Harry Potter and the Cursed Child με φόβο και πάθος. Είχα προετοιμαστεί ότι αυτό που θα διάβαζα είναι ένα θεατρικό σενάριο. Και δεν με πείραζε. Ακόμα δεν με πειράζει. Η αλήθεια είναι όμως ότι εξαιτίας αυτού, έχασε σαν κείμενο.<br />Παρόλα αυτά είχα και άλλα θέματα. Οι χαρακτήρες δεν με τράβηξαν, οι αγαπημένοι μου ήρωες λίγο πριν τα 40 έχουν μεταλλαχτεί σε κουρασμένους μεσοαστούς, με οικογενειακά θέματα κ.λ.π. Οκ, λέω, that’s reality, ούτως η άλλως οι πραγματικοί ήρωες του έργου είναι ο Albus Potter και o Scorpious Malfoy. Λοιπόν όσο λάτρεψα τον Scorpious, άλλο τόσο ήθελα να ρίξω ένα καλό χέρι ξύλο στον μικρό Potter … <br />Η πλοκή έτσι και έτσι. Η υπόθεση κακέκτυπο της γνωστής μας αγαπημένης ιστορίας.<br />Και κάπως έτσι η ανάγνωση έγινε ένα βαρετό μαρτύριο, κ εγώ μέσα σε όλα, να λέω δεν υπάρχει περίπτωση να ρίξω λιγότερα από 4 αστεράκια σε ένα βιβλίο με τους Potter … <br />Ο.κ, αυτό είναι νομίζω άδικο για την αγαπημένη μου σειρά . Όταν παραδέχομαι στον εαυτό μου ότι ο Χαρρυ Ποττερ έχει σημαδέψει την αναγνωστική μου πορεία στην παιδική μου ηλικία και αυτό το παραδέχομαι χωρίς ντροπή στα 30 μου, με ποια λογική θα βάλω 4 αστεράκια, σε ένα βιβλίο που σε οποιαδήποτε άλλη περίπτωση, θα είχα παρατήσει πριν καν φτάσω στην μέση; No way… για κάποιο λόγο όμως δεν ήθελα να το αφήσω και έτσι συνέχισα να διαβάζω… Και ευτυχώς έγινε καλύτερο. Για να γίνω πιο συγκεκριμένη, εμφανίστηκε ο ένας και μοναδικός, ο λατρεμένος μου, ο αιωνίως μουτρωμένος μα πάνω από όλα ο απόλυτα ηρωικός Severus Snape…. Και με συγκίνησε… και συνέχισα να διαβάζω. Δεν έκανε το κείμενο τέλειο, αλλά έσωσε την κατάσταση.<br />Εν κατακλείδι, μου άρεσε; Κάπως! Με συγκίνησε; Αρκετά. Συγκρίνεται με την σειρά; Σε καμία περίπτωση.<br />3,5/ 5 αστεράκια (για τον Severus ρε γαμώτο!).<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="12635028728994797277" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1543984828">  <td href="/user/show/12342179-kamrun"><img alt="KamRun" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478721084p2/12342179.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1740257900?book_show_action=false">Aug 27, 2016</a>      <a title="KamRun" class="user" name="KamRun" href="/user/show/12342179-kamrun">KamRun</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9786001822179" href="/book/show/31574430">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1740257900" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16664680299948281673">از دورانی که طرفدار پر و پار قرص هری پاتر بودم سال ها می گذره، بخاطر همین می تونم بدون تعصب نظرم رو درباره کتاب بگم. از کتاب ناراضی بودم و بخشی از این نارضایتی مربوط به این موضوعه که بخاطر عادت هری پاترخوانی، از نمایش‌نامه همون توقعی رو داشتم که از داستان. اما کتاب بعنوان نمایشنامه هم در سطح قابل قبولی نیست و نقطه ضعف زیاد داره. تکیه بیش از حد نمایشنامه به حوادث، که زیاد هم مهیج و دور از انتظار نیست، تحول ناگهانی کارکترها، تغییرات خلقی عجیب و غریب شخصیت ها (نسبت به داستان اصلی خانم رولینگ) ،</span>  <span id="freeText16664680299948281673" style="display:none">از دورانی که طرفدار پر و پار قرص هری پاتر بودم سال ها می گذره، بخاطر همین می تونم بدون تعصب نظرم رو درباره کتاب بگم. از کتاب ناراضی بودم و بخشی از این نارضایتی مربوط به این موضوعه که بخاطر عادت هری پاترخوانی، از نمایش‌نامه همون توقعی رو داشتم که از داستان. اما کتاب بعنوان نمایشنامه هم در سطح قابل قبولی نیست و نقطه ضعف زیاد داره. تکیه بیش از حد نمایشنامه به حوادث، که زیاد هم مهیج و دور از انتظار نیست، تحول ناگهانی کارکترها، تغییرات خلقی عجیب و غریب شخصیت ها (نسبت به داستان اصلی خانم رولینگ) ، شخصیت پردازی بسیار ضعیف دلفی و یکی دو تا باگ در داستان مواردی هست که به ذهنم می رسه. در نمایش چندبار این دیالوگ تکرار می شه که "<b>اجازه نده عشق به چیزی تورو نسبت به اون کور کنه</b>" و فکر می کنم این می تونه در مورد طرفداران هری پاتر و این کتاب هم صدق کنه</span>  <a data-text-id="16664680299948281673" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext Scorpius (and his friendship with A</span></span>  <span id="freeText2280512634409990242" style="display:none">WHAT A FUCKING MESS. I honestly don't even understand why this exists (or.. well... $$$). itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544513229" />    <a title="Theresa" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7822909-theresa"><img alt="Theresa" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467122564p2/7822909.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544513229?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Theresa" class="user" name="Theresa" href="/user/show/7822909-theresa">Theresa</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544513229" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14206066690648893426">There are no words. Seriously no words. I loved this play in its entirety. Everything about it was so magical and wonderful. I really don't want to give any spoilers, but if you are hesitating for any reason about picking this up, don't be! Go read it right now, because it is pure magic! The whole time I was reading I just kept thinking how on EARTH they could do this on a stage. There is so much magic that I can't begin to imagine how they possibly pulled this off live. I wanted to see this</span>  <span id="freeText14206066690648893426" style="display:none">There are no words. Seriously no words. I loved this play in its entirety. Everything about it was so magical and wonderful. I really don't want to give any spoilers, but if you are hesitating for any reason about picking this up, don't be! Go read it right now, because it is pure magic! The whole time I was reading I just kept thinking how on EARTH they could do this on a stage. There is so much magic that I can't begin to imagine how they possibly pulled this off live. I wanted to see this show before, but now I REALLY want to see this performed. It is so amazing! I cannot wait until it eventually comes to Broadway so I can see it!!</span>  <a data-text-id="14206066690648893426" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543878622" />    <a title="Alicia Ou0026#39;Carrick" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27782607-alicia-o-carrick"><img alt="Alicia Ou0026#39;Carrick" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478174844p2/27782607.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543878622?book_show_action=false">Nov 11, 2016</a>      <a title="Alicia Ou0026#39;Carrick" class="user" name="Alicia Ou0026#39;Carrick" href="/user/show/27782607-alicia-o-carrick">Alicia Ou0026#39;Carrick</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27782607-alicia-o-carrick?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27782607-alicia-o-carrick?shelf=plays">plays</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543878622" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer31615670158573256"> <br />My feelings...they are so confused.<br /><br />I want to say that I loved this, but the truth is, I didn't. It was marginally enjoyable, but it was nothing like the novels. I still think that there didn't need to be another book.<br /><br /><b>Pre-reading:</b><br /><br />I don't want to sound like a stick in the mud, but....did there need to be another book? I was completely happy with the way the seventh one ended.<br /><br />Yet at the same time, my inner Potterhead is screaming with joy, so...who knows.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1543878622">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1543878622" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1543878622u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1543878622'><a id="like_count_review_1543878622" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1543878622?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">38 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1543878622" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1543878622" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=38u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=6u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1543878622u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1543878622" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1543878622, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); I'll have them a bit sorted in time for my July Wrap-Up video. What I can say, however, is that for me, the seven books alone remain canon, and I see this as a Possible-alternate Bonus. In my mind, the epilogue in Deathly Hallows (which I loved because it gave a beautiful resolution to the Harry-Severus thread as well as Severus' life and part in the story) ended the series brilliantly.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1717790041">  <td p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " id="reviewTextContainer1714214442" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5176054106660177349">AAAAAAAMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1714214442">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1714214442" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1714214442u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1714214442'><a id="like_count_review_1714214442" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1714214442?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">38 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1714214442" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1714214442" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=38u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=6u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1714214442u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span
