class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16074767018597218004">GOD HELP US ALL. <br /><br />an update: I PRE ORDERED IT !!!!<br /><br />an update: My copy will arrive in 2 weeks and i'm so so so stressed out.<br /><br />***<br /><br />I did my waiting for my copy of tcc to arrived. 2 months of it. IN AZKABAN!<br />And it only took me 3 hours to finish reading this. <br /><br />So here's what's up.<br /><br /><b> <i> Warning!!! Everything written below contain spoilers. You have been warned... </i> </b><br /><br />As always I have a hard time making proper sentences when I'm reviewing a book I like so I'm just going to make some important bullet points here:<br /><br />•</span>  <span id="freeText16074767018597218004" style="display:none">GOD HELP US ALL. <br /><br />an update: I PRE ORDERED IT !!!!<br /><br />an update: My copy will arrive in 2 weeks and i'm so so so stressed out.<br /><br />***<br /><br />I did my waiting for my copy of tcc to arrived. 2 months of it. IN AZKABAN!<br />And it only took me 3 hours to finish reading this. <br /><br />So here's what's up.<br /><br /><b>  <i> Warning!!! Everything written below contain spoilers. You have been warned... </i></b><br /><br />As always I have a hard time making proper sentences when I'm reviewing a book I like so I'm just going to make some important bullet points here:<br /><br />• Rose is a bit judgmental isn't she? She wanted to choose 'the right friends' at her first day of school and quickly judged scorpius because of who his father was. EVEN though, he was being completely nice and polite!<br />• These kids are so mature compared to first years Harry, Ron, and Hermione. Seriously, the trio <i> bickered </i> so much.<br />• I love Scorpius. He's an enormous, uber geek. Confirmed.<br />• Scorpius heart is made of gold. This, I can also confirm.<br />• "Do you fancy a toffee? Don't tell Ron." "Can't. We're off sugar at the moment." THEY'RE. SO. OLD. I can't deal with this. My childhood heroes, people.<br />• Still can't believe Hermione works in MOM. As minister, no less.<br />• The thing Harry said in page 44! *gasps*<br />• Honestly Albus isn't as smart as kid Harry and kid Harry was a bit daft, this baffles me. The decision he made! Good God!<br />• When they got back in time and met Snape I had a single man tear moment. "Tell Albus- tell Albus Severus - I'm proud he carries my name." <br />• Albus. Kissing. Hermione. About. 500. Times. I'm. Done. With. This. World<br />• SCORPIUS TELLING ALBUS HE'S BETTER THAN HIS DAD AND HE'S HIS BFF FOREVER OK.<br />• Scorpius freaking out about Bathilda Bagshot. He.<br />• Scorpius talking about marriage with Rose. He's too much sometimes. What a baby boy.<br />• HONESTLY SCORPIUS I LOVE HIM.<br />• I'm giving this book 3 / 5 stars just for him.<br />• Where the heck is neville, hagrid, luna, teddy. WHERE. We don't even get a lot of James and Lily this is effed up to the roof.<br />• Not a lot of character development so I'm not a happy girl.<br />• Honestly this book sometimes feels too trivial. I mean Albus and Scorpius went missing for 3248347 times, the parents freaked out, the boys went missing some more, the parents freaked out and held conferences and had a fight and got all emo about the past and the boys went missing again. WELL!<br />• When will these idiots learn. DO NOT MEDDLE WITH TIME. <br />• Voldy is back! A little. <br />• Also Umbridge! Disgusting! How could she be in this book! Why didn't they go to the past and accidentally meet pleasant people like Sirius or Lupin or something. I MEAN yeah okay the timeline doesn't intersect and shit but SHIT. Honestly. Umbridge! How offensive.<br />• Voldy and Bellatrix has a daughter!!! SHOCK. Get this idea out of my mind immediately it's too disgusting and dirty.<br />• SCORPIUS AND ALBUS HUGGING. I. SHIP. PLEASE. SAIL.<br />• Surprisingly mundane for a Harry Potter book.<br />• Even though i hate 50% of this but I'd still spend money to watch the play. Just for Scorpius, my son.<br /><br />THAT is all. <br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="16074767018597218004" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1706872920" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1706872920" />    <a title="Keelin" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/44625971-keelin"><img alt="Keelin" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473044554p2/44625971.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1706872920?book_show_action=false">Aug 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Keelin" class="user" name="Keelin" href="/user/show/44625971-keelin">Keelin</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44625971-keelin?shelf=aty2016">aty2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer1706872920u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1706872920" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6626402180725788624">Ok. So here's the thing. This reads like a bad, baaaaad, fanfiction. <br /><br />Spoilers<br /><br />It includes throw ins of Dramione and Snape/Hermione. It has cheesy lines, melodramatic Harry-Dumbledore moments, and a Ron that is so OOC and ridiculous that you initially make a reason for it only to then go "I should not have to make up a reason for this." Harry is a bad dad with "no father figure to go with or against" except that he did have Vernon Dursley to hella go against. He also seems to be a great parent to</span>  <span id="freeText6626402180725788624" style="display:none">Ok. So here's the thing. This reads like a bad, baaaaad, fanfiction. <br /><br />Spoilers<br /><br />It includes throw ins of Dramione and Snape/Hermione. It has cheesy lines, melodramatic Harry-Dumbledore moments, and a Ron that is so OOC and ridiculous that you initially make a reason for it only to then go "I should not have to make up a reason for this." Harry is a bad dad with "no father figure to go with or against" except that he did have Vernon Dursley to hella go against. He also seems to be a great parent to his two other children and when it is brought up he says "everything comes easy to James." Like bro... That is such a cop out. Delphi's entire existence is just ludicrous! The fact that she is a character, the fact that this entire story is real is what really fucks me up. THE TROLLY WITCH ON THE TRAIN! So DUMB! <br /><br />Nostalgia is going to make people love this. And I can totally, 100%, absolutely see how seeing this in theatres would be epic and wonderful and exciting. Action, drama, all of your fave characters coming back to life. James and Lily being parents irl!!! But that doesn't cover up the fact that this play, this story, is garbage. In short all of the characters felt false, the plot itself was illogical and just horrifying from a storytelling standpoint, and it threw in too many things to make it seem genuine. It seemed more like a fanservice that got way out of hand and that it was just these two guys wanting to make their BAD fanfiction come to life and somehow got JKR to approve it.<br /><br />*EDIT* I just really needed to include this, it has been bothering me for two days now. The relationship between Scorpius and Albus is wonderful and horrible. They are great friends andI love that there is such a positive friendship HOWEVER this friendship is laced, doused, covered, drenched, dipped, and saturated with queer baiting. Scorpius has a crush on Rose from the beginning but really anyone who reads this will instantly think that there is romantic chemistry between Scorpius and Albus and, in fact, be so sure of it that they would expect that to be the end result. But it's not. And really, coming from someone who ships Rosius, that pissed me off more than anything else. Those two boys clearly loved each other beyond friends and this fucking play used and abused the need for canon queer characters (THAT ACTUALLY ADMIT TO BEING QUEER IN THE BOOKS) and that makes me irate. It is queer baiting 1000% and it's disgusting.<br /><br />To quote someone else "the real cursed child is me for having read that plot." And to make an amendment to that: the real cursed child is me for having prayed for an eighth book all while knowing that you should be careful what you wish for.</span>  <a data-text-id="6626402180725788624" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1662950462" />    <a title="Lauren" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4617391-lauren"><img alt="Lauren" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479593418p2/4617391.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1662950462?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Lauren" class="user" name="Lauren" href="/user/show/4617391-lauren">Lauren</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=gorgeous-covers">gorgeous-covers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=i-cried">i-cried</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1662950462" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12305198128215837623">It’s honestly crazy to be sitting here, reviewing another book from the Harry Potter universe, it’s almost so surreal it doesn’t feel possible. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463329103ra/19106851.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I don't want to say too much, reveal too much, or really divulge into too much story line. But I will say one thing, despite missing JK Rowling's incredible writing and this being in play format, I absolutely LOVED being back in this world.<br><br>The world in Harry Potter was one I feel like I grew up in (that and Middle Earth), so just about anything involving</span>  <span id="freeText12305198128215837623" style="display:none">It’s honestly crazy to be sitting here, reviewing another book from the Harry Potter universe, it’s almost so surreal it doesn’t feel possible. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463329103ra/19106851.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I don't want to say too much, reveal too much, or really divulge into too much story line. But I will say one thing, despite missing JK Rowling's incredible writing and this being in play format, I absolutely LOVED being back in this world.<br><br>The world in Harry Potter was one I feel like I grew up in (that and Middle Earth), so just about anything involving the world sucks me in like no other. <br><br>It took some getting used to having this story in play format, but once I got used to it, it was like nothing changed and I was right there back with the amazing characters, getting a glimpse of our favorite characters all grown up, being parents, and kicking some more ass. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470110179ra/19888478.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I LOVED Albus and, to be honest, I loved Scorpius even more. That really didn't come as much of a surprise to me, being an avid Scorose shipped and man was I happy with really getting to see Scorpius as a character. <b> AND HE LOVES BOOKS! </b><br><br>Scorpius is a nerd in every way Hermione was and I must say, I adore him that much more for it. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470110350ra/19888511.gif" width="300" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><s> Also, Draco is one of the best father characters ever and I adore him so much in this book as well. Seriously.... all the love for the Malfoy boys. </s><br><br>I'm so glad that I read this book and despite trying my best not to finish it quickly, I failed miserably. <br><br></span>  <a data-text-id="12305198128215837623" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543917184" />    <a title="Devonne" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/20989169-devonne"><img alt="Devonne" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470009438p2/20989169.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543917184?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Devonne" class="user" name="Devonne" href="/user/show/20989169-devonne">Devonne</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781338099133" href="/book/show/29069989-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-parts-1-2">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20989169-devonne?shelf=owned-books">owned-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20989169-devonne?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20989169-devonne?shelf=most-anticipated-2016">most-anticipated-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543917184" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer410413106055708615">This is not like the 7 orginal Harry Potter novels. If you go into it thinking it'll be exactly like what Jo originally created you will be extremely disappointed. Before reading I seperated the 2 in my mind and ended up really enjoying this. I can only imagine how much better the play is. Personally, I don't think Jo is is a sellout and just milking the franchise for more money. The play started developing in 2012, and I have a feeling Jo has had bits of this story in her head for years. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view</a></span>  <span id="freeText410413106055708615" style="display:none">This is not like the 7 orginal Harry Potter novels. If you go into it thinking it'll be exactly like what Jo originally created you will be extremely disappointed. Before reading I seperated the 2 in my mind and ended up really enjoying this. I can only imagine how much better the play is. Personally, I don't think Jo is is a sellout and just milking the franchise for more money. The play started developing in 2012, and I have a feeling Jo has had bits of this story in her head for years. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Who didn't think Bellatrix and Voldemort hooked up at some point?? lol. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> So yes, I really did love this, despite the differences from the original series. * SPOILERS AHEAD<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Things I liked/made me emotional (in point form):<br />- SO MUCH NOSTALGIA<br />- Scorpius Malfoy is such a kind-hearted, quirky indivudual. Slytherins CAN be good people<br />- Everytime Draco spoke about his wife, Astoria. He and Scorpius have each other but still live such lonely lives :(<br />- ABLUS AND SCORPIUS' FRIENDSHIP WAS SUCH A WONDERFUL THING AND I 700% SHIP THEM<br />- lmao they got INTO SO MUCH SHIT TOGETHER it was hilarious <br />- RON AND HERMIONE'S RELATIONSHIP IS EVERYTHING!!!!! HE RUNS FRED AND GEORGES SHOP! SHE'S MINISTER FOR MAGIC. WHAT A TIME TO BE ALIVE<br />- we got to see Snape and it was magical and so bittersweet to know he continued to be a part of Dumbledore's army <br />-Rose is so much like her mother and father i love it<br />- GINNY IS SO DAMN WISE<br />- Harry watching his parents die was just........ heartbreaking. But hey, at least he was with his family and best friends<br />- PAGES 222-223 <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="410413106055708615" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544200032" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544200032" />    <a title="Amanda" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10673439-amanda"><img alt="Amanda" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1405037359p2/10673439.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544200032?book_show_action=false">Aug 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Amanda" class="user" name="Amanda" href="/user/show/10673439-amanda">Amanda</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10673439-amanda?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10673439-amanda?shelf=2016-novels">2016-novels</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544200032" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4778641184825339191">I can't really put into words yet how I feel about this. I can't rate this.<br /><br />Basically to sum it up quickly without repeating what many other have said: <br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ This feels like a TV show episode from the 90's that is a complete standalone episode that doesn't effect the rest of the arc in any way. "Uh oh! We time traveled and messed everything up! We gotta time travel again to fix it!" OOOHHHH NOOOOO! Hi-jinks ensue. <br /><br />My FAVORITE version of any time travel story is the kind shown in the 3rd</span></span>  <span id="freeText4778641184825339191" style="display:none">I can't really put into words yet how I feel about this. I can't rate this.<br /><br />Basically to sum it up quickly without repeating what many other have said: <br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ This feels like a TV show episode from the 90's that is a complete standalone episode that doesn't effect the rest of the arc in any way. "Uh oh! We time traveled and messed everything up! We gotta time travel again to fix it!" OOOHHHH NOOOOO! Hi-jinks ensue. <br /><br />My FAVORITE version of any time travel story is the kind shown in the 3rd book. Where things have happened because they already happened and you can't actually change the future because when you went back you already did the thing that made the present the way it is, kind of time travel. And this broke ALL of those rules. It was heart breaking. <br /><br />I hate time travel stories that change the future because unless you want to really fuck up your story, which they didn't, they're going to need to change everything in a really convenient way. "Good thing I also have ANOTHER TIME TURNER". To make the present back to normal. So what was the point? <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />I'm sure the actual play is great, where you actually have actors conveying and emoting the words on the page and aren't just single word sentences and no description. I've read plays before and the words do come off emotionless sometimes because you are giving the actor plenty to work with.<br /><br />All in all, this didn't feel like a Harry Potter story.</span>  <a data-text-id="4778641184825339191" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544200032">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544200032" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544200032u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544200032'><a id="like_count_review_1544200032" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544200032?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">31 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544200032" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544200032" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=31u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=7u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1544200032u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1544200032" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1544200032, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1528812137" />    <a title="Caidyn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13614926-caidyn"><img alt="Caidyn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477630172p2/13614926.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1528812137?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Caidyn" class="user" name="Caidyn" href="/user/show/13614926-caidyn">Caidyn</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/29058155-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=juvenile-fiction">juvenile-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=fantasy-scifi">fantasy-scifi</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=play">play</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=harry-potter-5ever">harry-potter-5ever</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1528812137" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11392225559315869805"><b>Updated review:</b><br /><br />While I did say that, at most, this book got up to 3.5 stars, the most of it was more like 2.5 stars. And, it's not a round up sort of deal for me. I'm, sadly, going to have to round down to two stars because it fits the overwhelming sense of disappointment I have lingering.<br /><br /><b>Original review:</b><br /><br />I already know how I'm going to split up this review. There's going to be a short section that gives my feelings without going into specifics. I don't want to spoil this for anyone at all, so I'</span>  <span id="freeText11392225559315869805" style="display:none"><b>Updated review:</b><br /><br />While I did say that, at most, this book got up to 3.5 stars, the most of it was more like 2.5 stars. And, it's not a round up sort of deal for me. I'm, sadly, going to have to round down to two stars because it fits the overwhelming sense of disappointment I have lingering.<br /><br /><b>Original review:</b><br /><br />I already know how I'm going to split up this review. There's going to be a short section that gives my feelings without going into specifics. I don't want to spoil this for anyone at all, so I'll be brief and frank. After that, completely marked under spoilers, is going to be a section where I get into things like I usually do. Specific plot points, characterization, writing, etc. Full of spoilers.<br /><br />The first thing I want to say is that this is basically fanfiction. A major plot in the book is taken from things that have been written a million times. Of course, it was written decently and it's (partially) by JK Rowling, but fanfiction is fanfiction for me. Especially fanfiction that copies things I've read a million times. I feel people should go into this knowing that. I went into it -- not having read any early reviews or spoilers for the show -- expecting that's what it would be like. Again, it's well-written and legitimate, unlike most fanfiction, but it's still fanfiction. Expect that it's not going to be perfect, nor will it really have the same feel the Harry Potter books did for me.<br /><br />For me, the first 20% was more like two stars. From 30% on, it got better, up to three stars. Despite my issues with the major plot and a few other things, it got up to 3.5 stars. I'm still trying to decide where I want to rate it exactly (because GR doesn't do half stars, when it should), but for now, I'm going to round down to three stars.<br /><br />I touched on this in my review of Deathly Hallows, but, for me, "Nineteen Years Later" is the end of the series for me. Just like how I feel about the show Supernatural; season five is the end, everything else is just supplemental. This is just supplemental information. I'm disregarding certain things from the play, but I am going to keep some. The series ends, in my heart, with Deathly Hallows.<br /><br />From here on out, the rest of my review is going to be marked for spoilers. Please don't look below if you haven't read it! I already gave my opinion -- and I hope that I don't sully anyone's reading experience because of my slightly more negative review -- but further down I'm going to hash out the plot, characters, and writing.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[When I first started this, I could tell that it wasn't written by JK. I felt it in my heart and in my gut completely. Part of the issues I have, which I'll get into later, is due to the writing. Some of the things I felt were genuine JK -- like Dumbledore's role and speaking parts or Harry's emotions -- but others just didn't feel like her. I've read all of her work. I know her style. This wasn't it. Yes, I understand plays are different than books, but still.<br /><br />Since I started with my problems with the writing, I'm going to start with something that annoyed me from beginning to end. A minor quibble, yes. Those stage directions. I don't like it when it's telling not showing. You can do it in a play. And, those stage directions <i>told</i> me how characters felt. I could have gathered it from the writing well enough. I about got to the point where I stopped reading the stage directions, but then I realized that if I got lost by not reading stage directions during Shakespeare and many other plays, then I ought to just grit my teeth and bear it.<br /><br />The thing that bothered me next was characterization. I actually didn't have a problem with Draco, Harry, Hermione, Ron, or Ginny. Those main five were well done and they felt authentic. Part of me thinks that JK more had a say in them than anyone else. Harry's mess, Ginny's mothering, Ron's humor, Hermione's split attention on family and running the Ministry, Draco's sheltering. It felt authentic and understandable. What did bother me was the kids and the minor characters.<br /><br />At the beginning Albus, Scorpius, and Rose are eleven. However, they don't read like eleven year olds. I read them as older than eleven. However, when they get older to the point in the majority of the play, they either sounded younger than or a touch older than fourteen. For me, that distracted from the play at times. Again, not a huge problem, but it detracted from my enjoyment.<br /><br />I did love Albus and Scorpius. Is it so bad that I really wanted them to be a gay couple? HP needs more LGBT+ characters. Their friendship was done well, and if she ever wrote more, I want to hope that they became a couple. I was never a fan of Rose/Scorpius, but I was always a fan of Albus/Scorpius. Especially since they're both Slytherins. (I actually fist pumped the air when Albus got sorted.)<br /><br />What was inauthentic was the minor characters. I'm going to more point out Amos Diggory, Umbridge, and Moaning Myrtle. Amos was... not how he was in the books. In the books, he was grieving, yes, but he wasn't upset. He never was upset or angry. I know, years can rankle and all that, but... that much? I understand he was Confunded, yet it still didn't feel right. I wasn't a fan of his characterization. Umbridge... no. The writers didn't capture her at all, another thing that made me shake my head. Same with Myrtle. I was just surprised that the Dursleys, Snape, and Hagrid weren't ruined as well. And, that scene with Hagrid and baby Harry. My little heart simultaneously broke and grew three sizes that day.<br /><br />Here comes major spoilers, though. The plot. In my opinion, there were two plots. First, the actual story that was being told with Voldemort's daughter and changing history. Second, the more emotional plot of father/son relationships.<br /><br />As for the Voldemort daughter plot.... fanfiction. Pure fanfiction shit right there. Do you know how many times I've read that plot? Too many times. Sometimes it's well done, most of the time it's not. This is one of those cases where I didn't like it. Quite honestly, I didn't. Like most fanfiction, there was a huge plot hole. If Bellatrix had Delphie (which she now did in the HP universe because this is the canonically eighth book) someone would have noticed. I'm not very good at math, so someone correct me while I go more into this. <br /><br />According to an article I read, Delphi is 23. Albus and Scorpius are in their fourth year, which means it's about 2019. That makes Delphi born around 1996. Plot wise, that works. Bellatrix could have given birth to her since she wasn't there, for some odd reason, when Snape killed Dumbledore. However, she would have been 45 giving birth. I don't know about magical reproduction, but even by today's standards that's pretty old to have a child. And, I know that all what she dealt with in Azkaban it probably would have severely restricted her fertile years. So... I have a hard time wrapping around it.<br /><br />Not only that, but the plot felt lame. Wow. Voldemort's daughter. Who would have guessed??? They should have left Voldemort out, same with all the time changing. It just didn't work, quite honestly. Feel free to disagree, but I felt like I was reading middle school fanfiction all over again.<br /><br />The plot that worked, though, was the second one. They should have cut out the Voldy daughter stuff and focused on the relationships between parent and child. I know, Voldy's daughter had that, too, but as a whole it failed for me. They should have focused on relationships. Harry and Albus. Draco and Scorpius. Harry and Draco, even. (No, not slash fiction, but given Draco even more redemption than he got in this book by the two of them becoming friends.)<br /><br />The heart of the play was with that feeling. A father trying to understand their son. Trying to work with the past as it becomes a reality. A child trying to cope with their father's legacy. That is some deep shit, and that's the reason why it got bumped up as they focused more on that while doing their fanfiction plot. I thought that was absolutely beautiful and the only reason I would ever reread this play is for that aspect, to get more depth from it. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />After writing my spoiler review, I literally feel like a parent. "I'm not upset. I'm just disappointed."</span>  <a data-text-id="11392225559315869805" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543847425" />    <a title="Figgy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5056662-figgy"><img alt="Figgy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1298984393p2/5056662.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543847425?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Figgy" class="user" name="Figgy" href="/user/show/5056662-figgy">Figgy</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5056662-figgy?shelf=arc-or-netgalley">arc-or-netgalley</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5056662-figgy?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5056662-figgy?shelf=one-hundred-percent-rock-reviews">one-hundred-percent-rock-reviews</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5056662-figgy?shelf=review-copy">review-copy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5056662-figgy?shelf=favourites-2016">favourites-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5056662-figgy?shelf=publisher-hachette">publisher-hachette</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543847425" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2401984334366080930">BOOK REVIEW: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child by J.K. Rowling, John Tiffany, Jack Thorne There have been a lot of feelings flying around since the announcement of the “8th Harry Potter book”, especially once it sunk in that this was going to be the script of the West End play, rather than the format so many Harry Potter fans have grown up expecting.There was excitement, of course, followed closely by the concern that a script would be hard to get lost in, and that maybe our dear J.K. was</span>  <span id="freeText2401984334366080930" style="display:none">BOOK REVIEW: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child by J.K. Rowling, John Tiffany, Jack Thorne There have been a lot of feelings flying around since the announcement of the “8th Harry Potter book”, especially once it sunk in that this was going to be the script of the West End play, rather than the format so many Harry Potter fans have grown up expecting.There was excitement, of course, followed closely by the concern that a script would be hard to get lost in, and that maybe our dear J.K. was perhaps jumping the shark. There was talk about the possibility that this would be about Albus, Scorpius, and Rose, as mentioned in the epilogue of the seventh book, attending Hogwarts and becoming the new “power trio”.But there is so much more to this story, and it went off in a direction that many of us won’t have expected.Those who live in London will be able to appreciate this story in all of its glory, but that doesn’t mean those of us in other parts of the world can’t find a certain amount of joy in the pages of this book.All things considered, it is a return to the world of Hogwarts for those of us who have so missed it. It’s difficult to write a review for this book without giving things away, as everything has been kept so secret, but I’ll do my very best!If you don’t want to know anything about the actual plot before going in, I can tell you this:- There’s laughter, and touching moments, and heartache, friendship, and drama, and adventure.- We revisit some of the characters and places we’ve grown so familiar with over the last seven books.- It’s a little light on the character development, but that’s understandable because it’s a script.- Though it is a script, it’s easy to read.- You cannot read this without having read the other seven or seen the movies. There are spoilers, and there are things that won’t make as much sense without that foundation. This is not a jumping-in point for people who haven’t read or watched any of the previous adventures, though it stands well enough in its own right that you can still enjoy it, even if you last read the books or saw the movies many many years ago.- If you’ve seen the movies enough, you will no doubt hear your beloved returning characters speaking, as they perform the play in your head.- You should read it.- Great fun can be had if you get a group of friends together, pick your characters, and do a table read, as this reviewer did.The rest of this review can be found HERE!</span>  <a data-text-id="2401984334366080930" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544739716" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544739716" />    <a title="Avis" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/17586406-avis"><img alt="Avis" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544739716?book_show_action=false">Nov 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Avis" class="user" name="Avis" href="/user/show/17586406-avis">Avis</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite"              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17586406-avis?shelf=face-fucking-palm">face-fucking-palm</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17586406-avis?shelf=i-hate-my-life">i-hate-my-life</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17586406-avis?shelf=its-been-enough">its-been-enough</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17586406-avis?shelf=fate-in-humanity-lost">fate-in-humanity-lost</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer1544739716u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544739716" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5830583469161387608"><b>Things that suck in this book:</b><br /><br /><b>1.</b> Ron has approximately 3 lines in the entire script.<br /><br /><b>2.</b> This line: His hand is empty. It's a lame trick. Everyone enjoys its lameness.<br /><br /><b>3.</b> Draco Malfoy wouldn't just run up to Harry Potter and ask for a favor. No. Just no.<br /><br /><b>4.</b> Harry Potter, Head of Magical Law Enforcement, acts like a fucking four year old and refuses to read files.<br /><br /><b>5.</b> Amos Diggory comes to attack Harry for Cedric's death 23 years after it happened.<br /><br /><b>6.</b> Harry Potter would never to say to Albus that he wis</span>  <span id="freeText5830583469161387608" style="display:none"><b>Things that suck in this book:</b><br /><br /><b>1.</b> Ron has approximately 3 lines in the entire script.<br /><br /><b>2.</b> This line: His hand is empty. It's a lame trick. Everyone enjoys its lameness.<br /><br /><b>3.</b> Draco Malfoy wouldn't just run up to Harry Potter and ask for a favor. No. Just no.<br /><br /><b>4.</b> Harry Potter, Head of Magical Law Enforcement, acts like a fucking four year old and refuses to read files.<br /><br /><b>5.</b> Amos Diggory comes to attack Harry for Cedric's death 23 years after it happened.<br /><br /><b>6.</b> Harry Potter would never to say to Albus that he wished he wasn't his son. After all the shit Dursleys put him through, he would never be a shithead to his kid. After growing up unloved and practically abused, he would never, ever do that. Harry Potter, whose greatest joy was when Molly hugged him and (finally) showed him love, he would never look at Albus, small, confused, lost little boy and wish he could change him. Wish he was more like his brother and sister, when Albus is the one who is similar to Harry the most.<br /><br /><b>7.</b> Dark Magic moves around you while you have a nightmare? What the fuck??<br /><br /><b>8.</b> Albus Potter makes out with Hermione. Yes, he was polyjuiced as Ron at the time but still. Ew. She is his fricking aunt.<br /><br /><b>9.</b> Ron is a babbling idiot who does nothing but stuff his face.<br /><br /><b>10.</b> Queer baiting. Let's be real, if Albus was a boy and Scorpious a girl, they would be married with 5 kids by now. But since they're both men, they can't possibly be more than friends.<br /><br /><b>11.</b> Instead of talking to his son, Harry fucks up like 7 times in 7 identical situations.<br /><br /><b>12.</b> Voldemort day? Really?<br /><br /><b>13.</b> The plot is stupid. Albus Potter feels like an outcast and like his father hates him (which is... Not far from truth. At least according to Harry's behaviour). He makes friends with Scorpious Malfoy, who is also an outcast not only because his father is a former Death Eater, but because the public believes he's Voldemort's son (??????). One night they overhear Amos Diggory talking to Harry Potter (23 years later...?). Amos wants Harry to travel back in time to stop Voldemort from killing Cedric. (How would that even work? Wouldn't Harry then have to live for 23 years in the past before reaching a point in the present when he went back in the past?) <br /><br /><br />So, boys decide to be heroes and help Amos and his niece Delphi go back in time and save Cedric. They steal Time-Turner- a pretty shitty one, you can only stay in past for 5 minutes. They see all kind of realities- the one where Voldemort lives, where he dies but everything is different, etc. Oh and Voldemort apparently wins if Cedric lives because... Cedric turns evil, joins Death Eaters and kills Neville. You know why? Because HE WAS APPARENTLY EMBARRASSED. What the hell is this bullshit? Cedric, who fucking shared trophy with Harry, who loved fair play, who was ambitious and kind, joined Lord Voldemort because people laughed at him? Jesus.<br /><br />Oh, but that's not all. We haven't reached the plot twist yet.<br /><br /><b>14.</b> The plot twist is so fucking dumb. It turns out Delphi is not Amos' niece. She is daughter of Voldemort and Bellatrix. She turns on Albus and Scorpiuos and goes to the night when Harry's parents died to kill Harry. Of course, she fails miserably. Do I even need to explain how stupid this is? Voldemort having sex? Bellatrix carrying a baby without anyone noticing? Delphi growing up without anyone knowing anything about her? VOLDEMORT HAVING SEX??<br /><br /><b>15.</b> Harry blames everyone but himself for his faults as a parent.<br /><br /><b>16.</b> Where is Ginny? You know, mother of Albus and wife of Harry? She, like Ron, has about, what, 2 lines?<br /><br /><b>17.</b> Malfoy waits until his son goes missing for the 3049th time to reveal that he has another Time-Turner.<br /><br /><b>18.</b> Apparently the only way for deathly ill woman to have a kid is to give birth to it. Adoption? Nah, what is that.<br /><br /><b>19.</b> The writing is horrible. I cringed at most of the lines. <br /><br /><b>20.</b> Harry Potter would never fucking say to Minerva that she is bitter because she can't have kids. The script tries to convince me that Harry would say that to his former professor? To the woman he, if nothing else, respected a lot? The only time he managed to cast a Cruciatius curse was when a Death Eater spat on Minerva in front of Harry. Not when his godfather died, not when Hermione was tortured, not when plenty of other shitty things happened in his shitty life. The only time he could cast it when someone disrespected Minerva. And you're telling me that he would say all those things to her?! You're fucking kidding me.<br /><br /><b>21.</b> The ending is basically 'and they lived happy ever after'. Harry resolving his issues with his son? Draco with his? Ginny/Ron/Lily actually being in this book? Nah bruh.<br /><br /><b>22.</b> Everything.<br /><br /><i>This abomination just took a huge dump on my entire childhood.</i> Bye.<br /><br /><b>+one decent thing:</b> Scorpious was really cute.</span>  <a data-text-id="5830583469161387608" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544739716">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544739716" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544739716u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544739716'><a id="like_count_review_1544739716" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544739716?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">42 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544739716" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544739716" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=42u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1544739716u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1544739716" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1544739716, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545268938" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7918425666449217483">Finally after starting his book 2 months ago, I finished. It picked up a bit at the end which I was very thankful for. I didn't love this play format for the HP world - it just didn't blend and make sense for me. A full length novel, maybe: but def. not a play. I love my original trio of characters and despite enjoying most of these newbies, it'll never be the same. I'm keeping the original series in tact in my head just<br />Looking at TCC at a interpretation and idea, not actual canon. Your thoughts</span>  <span id="freeText7918425666449217483" style="display:none">Finally after starting his book 2 months ago, I finished. It picked up a bit at the end which I was very thankful for. I didn't love this play format for the HP world - it just didn't blend and make sense for me. A full length novel, maybe: but def. not a play. I love my original trio of characters and despite enjoying most of these newbies, it'll never be the same. I'm keeping the original series in tact in my head just<br />Looking at TCC at a interpretation and idea, not actual canon. </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1736425057" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1736425057" />    <a title="somuchreading" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1100172-somuchreading"><img alt="somuchreading" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475506809p2/1100172.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1736425057?book_show_action=false">Aug 29, 2016</a>      <a title="somuchreading" class="user" name="somuchreading" href="/user/show/1100172-somuchreading">somuchreading</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1100172-somuchreading?shelf=own-now">own-now</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1736425057" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16491545746155273061">Χμ, πως το κάνεις τώρα αυτό χωρίς να καταφύγεις σε σπόιλερς; Ας δούμε.<br /><br /><u>Εξαιρετικά χρήσιμες ερωτήσεις για το Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</u><br /><br /><i>- Είναι αυτό ένα θεατρικό σενάριο;</i><br />Ναι, χωρίς καμία αμφιβολία. Αυτό όμως δε σημαίνει απολύτως τίποτα. Σαφώς και δεν είναι ένα Χάρι Πότερ βιβλίο που διαβάζεται όπως τα υπόλοιπα Χάρι Πότερ βιβλία, αλλά αυτό δεν πάει να πει πως δεν αξίζει η έκδοση του. Είναι γρήγορο, άμεσο, όλα κινούνται με βάση τους διαλόγους των ηρώων και είναι ακριβώς όπως τα υπόλοιπα θεατρικ</span>  <span id="freeText16491545746155273061" style="display:none">Χμ, πως το κάνεις τώρα αυτό χωρίς να καταφύγεις σε σπόιλερς; Ας δούμε.<br /><br /><u>Εξαιρετικά χρήσιμες ερωτήσεις για το Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</u><br /><br /><i>- Είναι αυτό ένα θεατρικό σενάριο;</i><br />Ναι, χωρίς καμία αμφιβολία. Αυτό όμως δε σημαίνει απολύτως τίποτα. Σαφώς και δεν είναι ένα Χάρι Πότερ βιβλίο που διαβάζεται όπως τα υπόλοιπα Χάρι Πότερ βιβλία, αλλά αυτό δεν πάει να πει πως δεν αξίζει η έκδοση του. Είναι γρήγορο, άμεσο, όλα κινούνται με βάση τους διαλόγους των ηρώων και είναι ακριβώς όπως τα υπόλοιπα θεατρικά έργα έχετε διαβάσει στο χαρτί.<br /><br /><i>- Σου άρεσε;</i><br />Και ναι και όχι. Υπήρχαν εδώ κάποια πράγματα που δούλεψαν και περισσότερα πράγματα που δε λειτούργησαν όπως θα έπρεπε/έβρισκα εγώ σωστά. Θα πω "όχι τόσο", ελπίζω να σας καλύψει αυτό.<br /><br />- Τι δούλεψε καλά;<br />Η νέα γενιά χαρακτήρων, με καλύτερο από όλους τον Scorpius. Το τρικάκι με τα alt-universes. Η ανάπτυξη της σχέσης μερικών από τους ήρωες. Η διαχείριση από τη νέα γενιά της "κληρονομιάς" που άφησε η γενιά της Μάχης του Hogwarts. Η συναισθηματική κορύφωση του τέλους.<br /><br /><i>- Τι δε δούλεψε καλά;</i><br />Οι κανόνες της μαγίας που μάθαμε μέσα από 7 βιβλία καταστρατηγούνται. Πολλά στοιχεία των alt-universes φαίνονται απολύτως υπερβολικά. Η βολική εξαφάνιση κάποιων χαρακτήρων στην πορεία της ιστορίας και η λάθος μεταχείρηση άλλων [Ron, εσένα κοιτάω]. Το βασικό κόνσεπτ του έργου.<br /><br /><i>- Τι είχε το βασικό κόνσεπτ του έργου δηλαδή;</i><br />Είναι πάρα πολύ απλό: Η κεντρική αποκάλυψη του Harry Potter and the Cursed Child δε θα μπορούσε να συμβεί ποτέ. Είναι κάτι που, σωστά νομίζω, πολλοί χαρακτήρισαν σαν fanfiction. Οι χαρακτήρες όπως τους ξέραμε από την 7λογία δε θα συμπεριφερόταν ποτέ έτσι ώστε να καταλήξουμε σε αυτό που συμβαίνει στο βιβλίο. Κάθε έννοια continuity καταστρατηγείται.<br /><br /><i>- Αξίζει λοιπόν να το διαβάσω;</i><br />Πέρα από το ότι θεωρώ την ερώτηση χαζή, θέλω να ξεκαθαρίσω κάτι: Δεν είμαι από τους ανθρώπους που πιστεύουν πως κάτι κακό χαλάει την αίσθηση των προηγουμένων μη κακών. Δεν είμαι επίσης από τους ανθρώπους που πιστεύουν πως αυτό το βιβλίο ανήκει στη σειρά του Χάρι Πότερ.<br /><br />Τούτο εδώ είναι ένα sequel, γραμμένο από διαφορετικό συγγραφέα, που προσπάθησε να πει κάποια πράγματα λίγο διαφορετικά και στην πλειοψηφία του απέτυχε [στο χαρτί, το θεατρικό του Λονδίνου είναι μια άλλη εντελώς διαφορετική ιστορία]. Αυτό δε με ενοχλεί, χαίρομαι που υπάρχει και που το διάβασα, αλλά canon για μένα δεν είναι.<br /><br />Λέγοντας τα όλα αυτά, πιστεύω πως ναι, ξεκάθαρα, αξίζει κανείς να το διαβάσει.<br /><br /><i>- Θες να πεις κάτι άλλο;</i><br />Ναι, θέλω. Ο SNAPE ΔΕΝ ΕΙΝΑΙ ΗΡΩΑΣ. Δεν είναι, και το βιβλίο του κάνει τεράστιο disservice με το να τον απεικονίζει σαν τέτοιον. Ο Snape είναι ένας υπερβολικά περίπλοκος χαρακτήρας για να αντιμετωπίζεται έτσι. Φυσικά δεν τα λέω πρώτος εγώ αυτά τα πράγματα, έχουν ειπωθεί <a href="http://www.bustle.com/articles/67356-buzzfeed-asks-if-snape-is-a-hero-but-really-the-character-is-much-more-interesting-than" rel="nofollow">ξανά</a> και <a href="http://www.nerdsdoingstuff.com/severus-snape-is-a-complete-twat-and-all-this-tragic-hero-nonsense-needs-to-stop/" rel="nofollow">ξανά</a> και <a href="http://www.tor.com/2013/04/23/severus-snape-does-not-deserve-your-pity/" rel="nofollow">ξανά</a> όλα αυτά τα χρόνια.<br /><br /><i>- Βαθμολογία;</i><br />Harry Potter and the Cursed Child: ★★½</span>  <a data-text-id="16491545746155273061" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1736425057">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1736425057" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1736425057u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1736425057'><a id="like_count_review_1736425057" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1736425057?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">30 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1736425057" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1736425057" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=30u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1736425057u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1736425057" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1736425057, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714291915?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Kelly Roberson" class="user" name="Kelly Roberson" href="/user/show/29211563-kelly-roberson">Kelly Roberson</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714291915" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17430854046922290074">THIS BOOK WAS EVERYTHING I COULD HAVE HOPED FOR!!<br />I am so happy at how much I loved this! I thought it was going to be really hard to get into the swing of reading it in play form, but it took no time for it to feel like I was just reading another book! The only thing I hated was how quickly it flew by! I just need more!! *insert hysterically crying emoji here* I felt like Albus was the perfect son for Harry as he was just like Harry, but in a totally different and unexpected way. ALSO can we jus</span>  <span id="freeText17430854046922290074" style="display:none">THIS BOOK WAS EVERYTHING I COULD HAVE HOPED FOR!!<br />I am so happy at how much I loved this! I thought it was going to be really hard to get into the swing of reading it in play form, but it took no time for it to feel like I was just reading another book! The only thing I hated was how quickly it flew by! I just need more!! *insert hysterically crying emoji here* I felt like Albus was the perfect son for Harry as he was just like Harry, but in a totally different and unexpected way. ALSO can we just talk about how Scorpius is my favorite character of life! He is so funny, and in my opinion made this story so much better in so many ways! You honestly have a different view of Slytherin and the Malfoys all together after reading this! I loved all the moments we got of some of our favorite characters as well! Not to mention I LOVED the plot! It was so thrilling and legit terrifying at times! I am slightly disappointed that I didn't get to see one of two characters, but lets get real we can't have everything we want (which is an entirely new series with all old and new characters asap). I will definitely have a full spoilery discussion on my channel asap, so I can fully express all of my feels, but guys just guys! I loved it so much! I just need more. I am so thankful that on Harry's birthday I had the pleasure of reading a new book in Harry's world and life after 15 years of this being my life. I could not have asked for more from this book. JK ROWLING I NEED A SERIES ASAP. </span>  <a data-text-id="17430854046922290074" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1714160451" />    <a title="সালমান হক" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/24175715"><img alt="সালমান হক" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714160451?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="সালমান হক" class="user" name="সালমান হক" href="/user/show/24175715">সালমান হক</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24175715?shelf=ebook">ebook</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24175715?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24175715?shelf=2016-reads">2016-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24175715?shelf=on-my-kindle">on-my-kindle</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714160451" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15875280048465402445">অনেকেই হয়ত ভরু কুচকাবেন, কিনতু সতযি কথা বলতে কি, পরতিটা শবদ- পরতিটা মুহূরত এনজয় করেছি বললেও কম হয়ে যাবে। হযারি পটার আমার কাছে কি তা আসলে বলে বোঝানো যাবে না। যাইহোক, কিছু বযাপার পরিষকার করি- বইটা কিনতু সমপূরণ জে কে রাওলিং নিজে লিখেননি। আসলে এটা একটা নাটকের সকরিপট, যেটার মূল গলপটা তার লেখা। :)<br /><br /> কিছুদূর যাবার পরেই বুঝতে পারবেন যে চরিতরগুলো কেমন যেন অনযরকম লাগছে, মানে সেই হযারি, রন, হারমায়োনি সবাই আছে - তবুও অনযরকম। এর দুটা কারণ, পরথমত এটা বাইশ বছর পরের কাহিনী, দবিতীয়ত আমাদের পরিচিত চরিতরগুলোকে লিখেছ</span>  <span id="freeText15875280048465402445" style="display:none">অনেকেই হয়ত ভ্রু কুচকাবেন, কিন্তু সত্যি কথা বলতে কি, প্রতিটা শব্দ- প্রতিটা মুহূর্ত এনজয় করেছি বললেও কম হয়ে যাবে। হ্যারি পটার আমার কাছে কি তা আসলে বলে বোঝানো যাবে না। যাইহোক, কিছু ব্যাপার পরিষ্কার করি- বইটা কিন্তু সম্পূর্ণ জে কে রাওলিং নিজে লিখেননি। আসলে এটা একটা নাটকের স্ক্রিপ্ট, যেটার মূল গল্পটা তার লেখা। :)<br /><br /> কিছুদূর যাবার পরেই বুঝতে পারবেন যে চরিত্রগুলো কেমন যেন অন্যরকম লাগছে, মানে সেই হ্যারি, রন, হারমায়োনি সবাই আছে - তবুও অন্যরকম। এর দুটা কারণ, প্রথমত এটা বাইশ বছর পরের কাহিনী, দ্বিতীয়ত আমাদের পরিচিত চরিত্রগুলোকে লিখেছেন অন্য লেখক(মানে জে কে রাওলিং না)। এক অর্থে হ্যারিকে নিয়ে লেখা অসংখ্য ফ্যানফিকশনের মতই, যেখানে চরিত্রগুলোকে উপস্থাপন করা হয়েছে অন্য ভাবে। :)<br /><br /> তবুও পাচ স্টার দেয়ার কারণ হল দীর্ঘদিন অন্য কোন বই এভাবে উদগ্রীব হয়ে, এতটা আবেগ নিয়ে পড়িনি। আর আগে যেমনটা বললাম, প্রতিটা মুহূর্ত ভালো লেগেছে।<br /><br />কাহিনী কিছুই বলব না, কারণ আমি চাই না আগে থেকে কিছু জেনে কেউ বঞ্চিত হোক ঐ ভালো লাগা থেকে। শুধু বলব, হ্যারি পটার ফ্যান হলে দেরী না করে বসে পড়ুন।</span>  <a data-text-id="15875280048465402445" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1714160451">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545000231" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14646956664746709148"><b> <i>-11 Febrero 2016-</i> </b><br><br>¡¡OH DIOS MÍO!! ¡¿¿Esto es real o estoy soñando??! DIOS DIOS DIOS. <u>Estoy en shock</u>. Mi mente no puede pensar.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1450413719ra/17424838.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>¡¿A quién le importa que sea el <b>GUIÓN DE LA OBRA DE TEATRO?!</b> A nadie. LO QUE IMPORTA ES QUE <b><u>VAN A PUBLICAR OTRO LIBRO DE HARRY POTTER</u> Y TODO MATERIAL NUEVO ES BIENVENIDO.</b><br>Y encima en un día especial, el 31 de Julio, el cumpleaños de Harry. <br>Es que no puedo creerlo. ESTO ESTÁ SUCEDIENDO CHICOS.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1446496058ra/16817402.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Estoy tan nerviosa y tengo tanto miedo de que salga mal... Creo que ahora NECESIT</span>  <span id="freeText14646956664746709148" style="display:none"><b>  <i>-11 Febrero 2016-</i></b><br><br>¡¡OH DIOS MÍO!! ¡¿¿Esto es real o estoy soñando??! DIOS DIOS DIOS. <u>Estoy en shock</u>. Mi mente no puede pensar.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1450413719ra/17424838.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>¡¿A quién le importa que sea el <b>GUIÓN DE LA OBRA DE TEATRO?!</b> A nadie. LO QUE IMPORTA ES QUE <b><u>VAN A PUBLICAR OTRO LIBRO DE HARRY POTTER</u> Y TODO MATERIAL NUEVO ES BIENVENIDO.</b><br>Y encima en un día especial, el 31 de Julio, el cumpleaños de Harry. <br>Es que no puedo creerlo. elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1728326490" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1728326490" />    <a title="Lori" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3332895-lori"><img alt="Lori" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1418165902p2/3332895.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1728326490?book_show_action=false">Aug 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Lori" class="user" name="Lori" href="/user/show/3332895-lori">Lori</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1728326490" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17393157563975669165">Oh, Dumbledore, it was fun catching up with all my Hogwarts friends! I enjoyed how pieces of the different books were used throughout... wonderful getting to revisit the original series again. Important to remember that this is a play... not a novel. It was not nearly as good as the originals, but a fun glimpse into what our favorite bunch of wizards have been up to for the past 19 years. I would love to see this production, but to see it on film would be even better. Fingers crossed. This is an</span>  <span id="freeText17393157563975669165" style="display:none">Oh, Dumbledore, it was fun catching up with all my Hogwarts friends! I enjoyed how pieces of the different books were used throughout... wonderful getting to revisit the original series again. Important to remember that this is a play... not a novel. It was not nearly as good as the originals, but a fun glimpse into what our favorite bunch of wizards have been up to for the past 19 years. I would love to see this production, but to see it on film would be even better. Fingers crossed. This is an absolute must read for all Harry Potter fans. Fun, fun, fun. 4.5 stars</span>  <a data-text-id="17393157563975669165" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter class="section">      <div id="review_1544010829" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544010829" />    <a title="Sophie Petticrew" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/29371397-sophie-petticrew"><img alt="Sophie Petticrew" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479588223p2/29371397.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right"
