href="/user/show/29371397-sophie-petticrew">Sophie Petticrew</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29371397-sophie-petticrew?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29371397-sophie-petticrew?shelf=read-this-year">read-this-year</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29371397-sophie-petticrew?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29371397-sophie-petticrew?shelf=celebrate-1000">celebrate-1000</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544010829" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8975296376110293228">***THIS REVIEW WILL CONTAIN SPOILERS BUT THEY'VE BEEN BLANKED OUT BECAUSE I UNDERSTAND THE STRUGGLE MY FRIENDS***<br /><br /><b>UPDATE:</b> This was my initial reaction to the book. If this is all really illegible or just makes absolutely no sense, I apologise. I had been up for almost 24 hours, I got the book around half 12 and started it around 20 to 2 and read it all the way through the night with a few breaks so I was very, very tired. At the end, I added my thoughts and feelings that have developed throughout</span>  <span id="freeText8975296376110293228" style="display:none">***THIS REVIEW WILL CONTAIN SPOILERS BUT THEY'VE BEEN BLANKED OUT BECAUSE I UNDERSTAND THE STRUGGLE MY FRIENDS***<br /><br /><b>UPDATE:</b> This was my initial reaction to the book. If this is all really illegible or just makes absolutely no sense, I apologise. I had been up for almost 24 hours, I got the book around half 12 and started it around 20 to 2 and read it all the way through the night with a few breaks so I was very, very tired. At the end, I added my thoughts and feelings that have developed throughout the day. I'm sorry that this is the biggest mess of a review ever but honestly it's not as much of a mess as I am. ALSO SORRY THIS IS SO LONG I HAVE SO MANY FEELINGS OKAY SHOOT ME IT'S BEEN NINE YEARS<br /><br />I literally just finished the book and I'm still crying so I'm trying to put all my thoughts together. I'm completely in love with this. I'm more desperate than ever to see it on stage so I can truly experience this as it was meant to be experienced. I'm trying to write things but I keep thinking about what I've just read and started crying all over again ahhh<br />Okay, I'm going to try this.<br />I cannot describe to you how happy I am to see these characters that I have grown up with again in a brand new story. (Update: my cat just left me because I'm crying so much) I can't really explain my feelings towards Harry Potter, but it means so much to me, and I'm sure other people can relate. I was so excited to finally learn more about who they are now (well, who they'll be in the coming years ho ho). <br />I will say before I start this properly, I think, as somebody who has done a lot of stage acting, I found it a lot easier to kind of imagine the story and flow a lot better in my mind than some other people might. That being said there are parts of the play that I just really hope translate onto the stage better than they did on paper because dear god it did not read well (in my humble opinion don't eat me).<br />I was thinking for a while that I definitely favoured Part One of the play over Part Two. However, after finishing, I think maybe I prefer Part Two?? I don't know Part Two made me cry more. But I'll start with Part One because... it's the first part?? Makes sense. Yay Sophie!!<br />I loved everything about Part One. There was a lot of nostalgia and excitement over these "new" characters. It just... I can't describe it it was just such a brilliant beginning for me. There are so many emotions thrown around in just the first act that you're left almost exhausted by the end. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ A list of things that made me cry in just the first 75 pages of this book: Astoria's death, Amos talking about Cedric, Harry remembering Cedric, HARRY JAMES POTTER GIVING ALBUS SEVERUS POTTER THE BLANKETHE WAS WRAPPED IN WHEN HE WAS LEFT ON THE DURSLEY'S DOORSTEP BECAUSE IT IS THE ONLY THING HE HAS OF HIS MOTHER'S!!!!!!! <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Needless to say, I cried a lot. Now there is only one problem I had with this Part, and it at the very end of Act Two. I'm sure it will translate better onto the stage but just having it written in front of you, it's really funny. I laughed way more than I was probably supposed to, it just looked a little ridiculous?? <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ "YOU'RE RUINING VOLDEMORT DAY" BYE I SCREAMED FRICKIN VOLDEMORT DAY DEAD DONE RIP ME <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> I don't know, other people might think differently but I just thought it was.. I don't know I think it probably doesn't translate that well on paper.<br />Now Part Two, I'm not going to lie, I wasn't super into Act Three. Towards the end, I really enjoyed it but the beginning was very "Ebony Dark'ness Dementia Raven Way" if yah know what I'm saying. Again other people may feel differently, but I really hope that it translates better onto the stage because to me it just read weird. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ The re-introduction of Snape was just completely bizarre to me and I felt he was very out of character. Like, I get where it's coming from, I understand the time change thingy (wow, Sophie) but, I just can't see Hermione and Ron getting alone with Snape like that and just.. him in general... it felt wrong.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Act Three actually kind of reminded me of a mixture of A Very Potter Sequel and My Immortal, so I'm kinding of really hoping it is as horrifying as the stage directions and such are suggesting and not just a giant meme.<br />Act Four, however was just, incredible to me. Again, I'm really struggling to put my feelings into words because I'm just so blown away by this play. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Not gonna lie tho, I'm not really into Delphi as a villain, and the idea that she's Voldemort's daughter I just... nah... however I CALLED IT I KNEW VOLDEMORT AND BELLATRIX BANGED AT SOME POINT <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> I loved everything about this Act, it was just... so perfect I can't describe it. I honest to god cried from midway scene eleven through the rest of the play. I am nursing the <i>worst</i> crying headache ever right now. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Having to see Harry watch his parents die honestly killed me. Hagrid greeting little baby Harry killed me. Harry and Albus' walk and talking about Cedric and just everything about Scene Fifteen done killed me. Basically Scenes Twelve through Fifteen had me dead. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />I can't really give my full feelings for this play without spoiling it, I'm that person that needs to go into full detail yah know? Also without having actually seen the play performed as it is intended, it is a little bit more difficult to judge than your regular novel. <br />I just want to say that I am so, so glad that Harry Potter is back in our lives. I don't think I've cried so much a book since The Deathly Hallows came out. But please, if you are considering not reading this book because you have heard some spoilers, or rumours that it isn't very good, read it. You will regret it so much. I was so afraid to read it because I thought it wouldn't live up to my expectations, and it did all that and so much more.<br /><br />THANK YOU J.K. ROWLING FOR GRACING US WITH THIS PLAY. HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO YOU AND TO HARRY u0026lt;3<br /><br /><b>ANOTHER UPDATE:</b> <br />I've been thinking about this book all day, and I've kind of got a bit more of a handle on my opinions now I think (I've also been on the verge of tears all day and I just had a nice little cry a few minutes ago). Now, I absolutely love this play, but I did feel a little conflicted about certain aspects and I've been mulling things over and checking out what some other people had to say and I reached some conclusions. I realised that my favourite parts of the play were the parts where you see the parts where it truly feels like you're seeing how the events of the novels affected the characters twenty-odd years later, or the parts where you just see the characters we've grown up with interacting with eachother and with the newer characters. <br />One thing I particularly liked was the portrayal of Harry dealing with the feeling of guilt over all the lives that were lost for him. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ "I shouldn’t have survived - it was my destiny to die — even Dumbledore thought so — and yet I lived. I beat Voldemort. All these people — all these people — my parents, Fred, the Fallen Fifty — and it’s me that gets to live? How is that? All this damage — and it’s my fault." <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> I've always wondered if he felt guilt over the events of the past, especially after the Nineteen Years Later epilogue which made everything seem fine and dandy. And even though I had always believed that the way Harry is confirmed to feel in the play would be the way he would feel, I was still completely heartbroken. Even now, I'm crying again just thinking about it (god this play kill me please). I'm so glad that this was something the play dealt with.<br />Again, Harry calling Dumbledore out on how he treated him when he was in school and how that affected him later in life was just so satisfying. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ I'm not going to get into the whole Snape thing honestly I'm still confused by it. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> This play had a lot of closure for things I've been questioning for the last nine years. <br />Finally, those last few scenes just completely destroyed me. I'm going to block all this for spoilers because I can't really see a way I can talk about this without spoiling anything. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Godric's Hollow. Just... oh my god. I don't think I've ever experienced a scene more intense than the scene where they watch Lily and James die. It was just so traumatic. I mean, it impacted me so much just reading it, I can hardly imagine what it would be like to be sitting in that theatre and having it happen in front of you. I can't really put into words how much this scene impacted me. I'm just so heartbroken and I think it will definitely haunt me for a long time. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />Now things I had problems with. I think I mentioned it in my initial reaction that there are so many characters that I wanted to know how they were doing now, how they were coping or whatever and there wasn't even a mention of them. I wasn't expecting every single character to be in the play but they couldn't even bring them up in coversation? <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ They can bring Snape back but can't even mention how Ginny's best friend Luna is doing?? <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> There are one or two things that I wasn't super into either. Act Three was just a mess. It got good toward the end of the act but I just wasn't loving it. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ I liked the time travelling and the alternate universes or whatever but I'm still not over that world where Voldemort wins. I know on stage it would be incredible and would translate better but.. I don't know it was just weird to me.. ALSO SNAPE MADE NO SENSE DID NOT ENJOY WHY WAS HE THAT WAY???? <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Also, I really wish Scorpius was in Ravenclaw?? Does anybody see this or is it just me?? u0026gt;.u0026gt; I wish Jo would give the other two houses a little more attention than she does idk <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ ALSO OKAY WHILE I'VE ALWAYS THOUGHT VOLDIE AND BELLATRIX BANGED IT WAS 100% BECAUSE OF AVPM AND NOTHING ELSE SO THIS WEIRD DELPHI THING IS JUST NOPE HATE IT YUCKO <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />Anyway, I can't really think of anything else to say right now. I'm getting too upset (like really if other people haven't reacted the same way i have then i don't know who you people are anymore). I'll be rereading the play once I finish the last three book in the series so I can form more opinions maybe??<br />Either way, I think the play is perfect. Yes, I wish some things were done differently but it is more than I could have ever asked for. I'm going to go and cry a little more over this perfect addition to my absolute favourite series of all time.<br />(Sorry this is so long oh my god I just feel very ranty about this book and nobody I know has READ IT YET KILL MEEEEE)<br /><br /><b>UPDATE:</b> So I just found out that J.K. Rowling didn't actually write this play and I'm unbelievably disappointed and not even a little bit surprised anymore that parts of it read like fanfiction. I FEEL SO BETRAYED WHAT THE HELL<br />also for those of you that don't know, my tweet about me crying so much i almost threw up was put on pottermore so soz guys i'm famous now xo</span>  <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1553141970" />    <a title="Jenny" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/29176007-jenny"><img alt="Jenny" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1393660356p2/29176007.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1553141970?book_show_action=false">Aug 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Jenny" class="user" name="Jenny" href="/user/show/29176007-jenny">Jenny</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1553141970" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13902016470017772288"> Τώρα που ηρέμησα και μπορώ να εκφραστώ με νηφαλιότητα,δηλώνω το εξής: το "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" δεν είναι η συνέχεια που περίμενα/για την οποία ήλπιζα,αλλά χαίρομαι που το διάβασα.Έχω πολλά πράγματα να πω για το έργο κι η ανάρτηση θα είναι γιγαντιαία,σχωράτε με,αν δεν τα πω σε σας,τότε σε ποιον;;<br /><br /><b> Για όσους δεν έχουν διαβάσει το βιβλίο: </b><br /> Αξίζει να το διαβάσετε;Ναι.Ακόμη κι αν απογοητευτείτε με ορισμένα πράγματα όπως εγώ,δεν θα σας μαγαρίσει το χαριποτερικό σύμπαν.Τίποτα δεν μπορεί ν</span>  <span id="freeText13902016470017772288" style="display:none"> Τώρα που ηρέμησα και μπορώ να εκφραστώ με νηφαλιότητα,δηλώνω το εξής: το "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" δεν είναι η συνέχεια που περίμενα/για την οποία ήλπιζα,αλλά χαίρομαι που το διάβασα.Έχω πολλά πράγματα να πω για το έργο κι η ανάρτηση θα είναι γιγαντιαία,σχωράτε με,αν δεν τα πω σε σας,τότε σε ποιον;;<br /><br /><b> Για όσους δεν έχουν διαβάσει το βιβλίο: </b><br /> Αξίζει να το διαβάσετε;Ναι.Ακόμη κι αν απογοητευτείτε με ορισμένα πράγματα όπως εγώ,δεν θα σας μαγαρίσει το χαριποτερικό σύμπαν.Τίποτα δεν μπορεί να μαγαρίσει το χαριποτερικό σύμπαν και την αγάπη μας γι'αυτό!Θα μάθετε τις εξελίξεις στη ζωή των αγαπημένων μας χαρακτήρων,θα γνωρίσετε καινούργιους χαρακτήρες που θα αγαπήσετε και θα διαβάσετε μια ευχάριστη ιστορία με μπόλικη περιπέτεια,που αποτελεί έναν ύμνο στη φιλία και την αγάπη.<br /><br /> Είναι κάτι παραπάνω από φανερό ότι πρόκειται για έργο που δεν έχει γράψει μόνη της η Rowling και ότι δεν ασχολήθηκε όσο θα έπρεπε.Η πλοκή είναι γεμάτη με τρύπες,ευκολίες,κλισέ,λάθη σχετικά με το σύμπαν των μάγων και ακατανόητες ενέργειες ηρώων που θα φανούν τελείως εκτός χαρακτήρα(χωρίς να μαρτυρήσω,αναφέρω απλώς ότι ο Χάρι λέει πράγματα που ΠΟΤΕ δεν θα έλεγε,π-ο-τ-έ).Μπορώ να δικαιολογήσω <u> μέρος </u> όλων αυτών,επειδή πρόκειται για θεατρική παράσταση με συγκεκριμένη διάρκεια.Και σαν να μην έφταναν όλα αυτά,έρχεται μια αποκάλυψη η οποία είναι σοκαριστικά γελοία και αν τη δεχτούμε ως κανόνα αναιρεί όλα όσα ξέρουμε για έναν από τους κυριότερους χαρακτήρες των βιβλίων.<br /><br /> Η παράσταση θα είναι σίγουρα εντυπωσιακή και θα ήθελα πολύ να τη δω-αναρωτήθηκα για ένα σωρό πράγματα "Μα πώς στο καλό το κατάφεραν αυτό;".Νομίζω ότι ένας από τους βασικούς λόγους που όσοι είδαν την παράσταση είχαν μόνο καλά λόγια να πούνε,ήταν το ότι η σκηνοθεσία κι οι ερμηνείες ήταν εξαιρετικά και κάλυψαν τα αρνητικά στοιχεία του κειμένου.<br /><br /> Τέλος,όλοι όσοι ανέφεραν ότι το έργο θυμίζει fanfiction με βρίσκουν 100% σύμφωνη.Διαβάζω πολλά hp fanfiction και πραγματικά αναγνώρισα ένα σωρό πασίγνωστες και δημοφιλείς μανιέρες.Στοιχηματίζω το ραβδί μου ότι ο κύριος Jack Thorne έχει περάσει αμέτρητες ώρες διαβάζοντας AO3 και fanfiction.net.<br /><br /><br /><b> <u> ΤΕΛΟΣ SPOILER FREE ΜΕΡΟΥΣ!!Αν δεν επιθυμείτε να μάθετε για την υπόθεση του έργου,τα σημεία που αγάπησα και τα σημεία που θα έκαιγα ευχαρίστως,σταματήστε την ανάγνωση εδώ! :D </u></b> <br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><b> Για όσους έχουν διαβάσει το βιβλίο: </b><br /> Καλά,πείτε μου σας παρακαλώ πολύ,γιατί θα τρελαθώ.Υπάρχει άνθρωπος εκεί έξω που δέχεται ότι κατά τη διάρκεια των γεγονότων του "Ημίαιμου Πρίγκιπα" ο Βόλντεμορτ κι η Μπέλα έκαναν σεξ,η Μπέλα έμεινε έγκυος και γέννησε στο Malfoy Manor λίγο πριν τη μάχη του Χόγκουαρτς ένα υγιέστατο κοριτσάκι το οποίο ονόμασαν Delphini,Delphi για τους φίλους;Πού στο καλό ήταν η κοιλιά της όλους αυτούς τους μήνες;Αν δεχτούμε το timeline,ΑΝ,θα έπρεπε να είναι έγκυος με την κοιλιά τούρλα όσο βασάνιζε την Ερμιόνη.<br /><br /> Άντε,ας δεχτώ ότι έκρυβε την εγκυμοσύνη της με μαγικά μέσα.Το ότι ο Βόλντεμορτ έκανε σεξ πώς να το δεχτώ;;Ήταν με το ζόρι άνθρωπος!Δεν είχε μύτη!Σχεδόν δεν είχε ψυχή!Η στυτική δυσλειτουργία είναι αναμενόμενη στην κατάστασή του!! <i> Με το ζόρι απέκτησε σώμα και ποτέ δεν τον βλέπουμε να έχει ανθρώπινες ανάγκες,πώς γίνεται να δεχτούμε ότι εν μέσω πολέμου και φόβου για την προφητεία είχε όρεξη να χορέψει τον οριζόντιο χορό με την Μπέλατριξ; </i> Και φυσικά,μπορούμε να αποκλείσουμε την επιθυμία για διάδοχο.Ο άνθρωπος δεν σκόπευε να πεθάνει ποτέ,για να μην αναφέρω τις λίγο παραπάνω από προβληματικές σχέσεις με την οικογένειά του.<br /><br /> Περνώντας σε άλλα ζητήματα.Σε ποιο σύμπαν ακριβώς θα μιλούσε με τέτοιο τρόπο ο Χάρι στην ΜακΓκόναγκαλ(η οποία επίσης είχε πολλές στιγμές εκτός χαρακτήρα-για την ακρίβεια,είχε μετρημένες στιγμές με συπεριφορά όπως την μάθαμε και την αγαπήσαμε);Στον Άλμπους;Στο σύμπαν του Jack-εγώ από Χάρι Πότερ μόνο ό,τι έχει βγει σε fanfiction παιδιά-Thorne.Ο Ρον παρουσιάζεται ως ο κλόουν της υπόθεσης,η Rose και ο James ίσα που υπάρχουν.Πού στο καλό είναι ο Hugo;O Teddy;;Ο Neville;;<br /><br />*εισπνοή,εκπνοή*<br /><br /> Να θυμίσουμε επίσης ότι το πολυχημικό φίλτρο έχει διάρκεια παρασκευής ΕΝΑ ΜΗΝΑ κι όχι λίγη ώρα.Το ραβδί του Άλμπους είχε σπάσει,αλλά έκανε μια γκεστ εμφάνιση στη μάχη με την Delphi,γιατί ΕΤΣΙ,ολόκληρη η σκηνή μετά το φόνο των γονιών του Χάρι ήταν λάθος κι ενάντια στον κανόνα,και,α ναι,το όλο θέμα με τις χρονομηχανές παντελώς αδύνατον,όπως ξέρουμε όλοι όσοι διαβάσαμε το τρίτο βιβλίο.Έχω κι άλλα πολλά να πω,αλλά νομίζω θα γίνω ακόμη περισσότερο κουραστική,λεπτομέρειες μικρές δεν αξίζουν να χαλάμε τις καρδιές μας.<br /><br />ΓΙΑ ΝΑ ΜΗΝ ΓΙΝΩ ΑΔΙΚΗ,υπήρχαν και πολλά θετικά!<br /><br /> Οι καινούργιοι χαρακτήρες,η επόμενη γενιά ουσιαστικά,έχει μεγάλο ενδιαφέρον και θέλω πολύ να παρακολουθήσω την εξελιξή της!!Με μεγάλο αγαπημένο τόσο δικό μου,όσο και του κόσμου όλου,τον Scorpius.Έγινε η αδυναμία μου,δεν περίμενα ποτέ ότι θα αγαπούσα έναν νέο χαρακτήρα όσο τους παλιούς.Γλυκός,ευγενικός,έξυπνος,αστείος,πιστός,κάθε σκηνή που τον περιελάμβανε ήταν μια σκηνή που θα μου έφερνε χαμόγελο.<br /><br /> Η εξέλιξη του Draco και της σχέσης του με την τριάδα με συγκίνησε και ήταν από τα αγαπημένα μου κομμάτια του έργου.Η σκηνή που μαλώνει με τον Harry με έκανε να γελάσω πολύ ("Keep up,old man. " "We're the same age,Drako." "I wear it better.") και θα ήθελα πολύ να γνωρίσω την Astoria.<br /><br /> Γενικά είχε χιούμορ το έργο,πολλές ατάκες μου έφτιαξαν το κέφι.Ο Ρον έδωσε ρέστα (αν και με ενόχλησε το ότι η μόνη του χρησιμότητα ήταν αυτή),μαζί με τον Scorpius που σαν γνήσιος γιος του πατέρα του ήταν με την έξυπνη ατάκα στα χείλη.<br /><br /> Το μεγαλύτερο θετικό του έργου,ήταν ότι με ξαναγύρισε στον αγαπημένο μου κόσμο και έδωσε συνέχεια.Μπορεί να μην έμεινα ευχαριστημένη με πολλά πράγματα,όμως δεν μπορώ παρά να παραδεχτώ ότι ποτέ δεν θα είμαι αντικειμενική σε ό,τι αφορά τον Χάρι κι είναι λόγω της μεγάλης μου αγάπης για τον χαρακτήρα και το σύμπαν του που είμαι και τόσο αυστηρή και απαιτητική.Ποτέ δεν θα σταματήσω να στηρίζω κάθε καινούργια προσπάθεια για επιστροφή στον κόσμο των μάγων και ανεβάζω κατά 1 αστεράκι την αρχική μου βαθμολογία λόγω καθαρά συναισθηματικών λόγων.<br /><br /> Ελπίζω να αντέξατε να διαβάσετε όλο αυτό το κατεβατό ή μέρος του,για πείτε,συμφωνείτε,διαφωνείτε;</span>  <a data-text-id="13902016470017772288" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1553141970">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1553141970" id="reviewTextContainer1546707679" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12208949406531180420">• 4.8 stars •<br /><br />"The truth is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution."<br /><br />"Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, share your pain. Tool suffer is as human as to breathe."<br /><br />I adored reading more of Draco Malfoy. It's been too long. And to see his character change so much over the years makes my heart</span>  <span id="freeText12208949406531180420" style="display:none">• 4.8 stars •<br />⠀<br />"The truth is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution."<br />⠀<br />"Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, share your pain. Tool suffer is as human as to breathe."<br />⠀<br />I adored reading more of Draco Malfoy. It's been too long. And to see his character change so much over the years makes my heart really ache! And his son and Harry's son! The most surprising relationship of them all!<br />⠀<br />- "Friends?"<br />⠀⠀"Always."<br />⠀<br />The feels decided to hit and punch me in the gut. The beginning was a bit slow. 4.8 stars because of that.</span>  <a data-text-id="12208949406531180420" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1754026086" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1754026086" />    <a title="Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh"><img alt="Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479803568p2/8832758.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1754026086?book_show_action=false">Nov 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)" class="user" name="Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)" href="/user/show/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh">Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781338099133" href="/book/show/29069989-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-parts-1-2">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh?shelf=what-the-heck">what-the-heck</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1754026086" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7758804182626178199"><i>Are you aware how stupid you've been? Bravery doesn't forgive stupidity</i>. —Professor McGonagall<br /><br />Haters gonna hate! I did not expect that I would dislike this play so much. I refuse to place it in league with the actual seven books. I nearly marked this as DNF, were it not for the fact that my boss at work had graciously lent it to me. <br /><br />I believe that I'm not being objective right now because irritation is clouding my judgement. All I know is that Albus Severus Potter never failed to fill my heart w</span>  <span id="freeText7758804182626178199" style="display:none"><i>Are you aware how stupid you've been? Bravery doesn't forgive stupidity</i>. —Professor McGonagall<br /><br />Haters gonna hate! I did not expect that I would dislike this play so much. I refuse to place it in league with the actual seven books. I nearly marked this as DNF, were it not for the fact that my boss at work had graciously lent it to me. <br /><br />I believe that I'm not being objective right now because irritation is clouding my judgement. All I know is that Albus Severus Potter never failed to fill my heart with scorn and contempt. His decision making process was remarkably pathetic at best and downright infuriating at worst. There were so many times that I wanted—yearned—to throw this ridiculously expensive text across the room, through the window, and onto the gritty pavement outside.<br /><br />Please believe me that I did my best to enjoy the story. Unfortunately, I was overwhelmed by this feeling of detachment towards the characters. It was hard for me to reconcile their dialogues to the people they were 19 years ago. Harry, Ron, and Hermione were just...<i>there</i>, and I really wasn't invested in their story anymore. I now realize that other readers were right to describe this play as fan-fiction; there were indeed so many conveniently executed plot holes involving Cedric Diggory, Voldemort, and those blasted Time-Turners. <br /><br />As my rant comes to a close, I hope that I can redeem myself by saying—with a small smile—that I liked Scorpius. Honestly, he was my only ray of sunshine, my rare source of comfort and fanboy feels. His pedantic demeanor and love for books inevitably reminded me of my adoration for Hermione, and I particularly admired his willingness to express his affection for Albus. Scorpius basically changed my opinion of the Malfoy name for the better, and for that I am grateful.<br /><br />All things considered, I am not satisfied nor happy with how the story turned out. It would probably be better if I didn't read it at all. Nevertheless, I assure you that my love for Lady Rowling and her wizarding world remain unscathed. In fact, I shall begin reading <i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> to purge myself of remaining toxic emotions. </span>  <a data-text-id="7758804182626178199" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1754026086">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1754026086" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1754026086u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1754026086'><a id="like_count_review_1754026086" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1754026086?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">50 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1754026086" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1754026086" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=50u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1754026086u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1754026086" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1754026086, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">21 comments</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1754026086?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=8">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1754026086' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1754026086/comments?reverse=true">View all 21 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_159029717" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)" href="/user/show/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479775005p1/8832758.jpg" alt="8832758" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh">Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer18319658204039558835"><i>Alissa in Wonderland wrote: "I agree with this review 100%! I honestly wish I hadn't read it... it kind of tainted my views regarding some of the char</i></span>  <span id="freeText18319658204039558835" style="display:none"><i>Alissa in Wonderland✨ wrote: "I agree with this review 100%! Hihi. :D</span>  <a data-text-id="18319658204039558835" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Nov 11, 2016 class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543968863" />    <a title="Halley Hopson" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30553051-halley-hopson"><img alt="Halley Hopson" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450287697p2/30553051.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543968863?book_show_action=false">Aug 30, 2016</a>      <a title="Halley Hopson" class="user" name="Halley Hopson" href="/user/show/30553051-halley-hopson">Halley Hopson</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30553051-halley-hopson?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30553051-halley-hopson?shelf=2016-rereads">2016-rereads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543968863" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3691176281948950961">(First Read - July 31st 2016 from 1am to 4am)<br /><br />Mischief Managed.<br /><br />Read and finished this in two or three hours. <br /><br />To anyone who has seen the Very Potter musicals; did you giggle at how the plot this seemed slightly familiar in a certain way? ;)<br /><br />I loved it. It was everything I wanted and more. There were several things I was not expecting, in typical JK Rowling fashion; I wouldn't expect any less. <br /><br />So many of the stage directions made me so excited to someday seen this play performed live.<br /><br /><br />~Update after s</span>  <span id="freeText3691176281948950961" style="display:none">(First Read - July 31st 2016 from 1am to 4am)<br /><br />Mischief Managed.<br /><br />Read and finished this in two or three hours. <br /><br />To anyone who has seen the Very Potter musicals; did you giggle at how the plot this seemed slightly familiar in a certain way? ;)<br /><br />I loved it. It was everything I wanted and more. There were several things I was not expecting, in typical JK Rowling fashion; I wouldn't expect any less. <br /><br />So many of the stage directions made me so excited to someday seen this play performed live.<br /><br /><br />~Update after seeing so many negative reviews ~<br /><br /><br />I feel like so many people are trying to make this book into something it's just not; comparing it to 'bad fanfiction' and being annoyed that this "8th" book is even a thing. <br /><br />I hate that this is marketed as an eight book because that's really not at all what it is. It's not a continuation of Harry's story, which we followed through the original seven books, it's not even a book technically. It is first and foremost a staged script, full of stage directions in which J.K. Rowling's voice and humor from the original characters can clearly be heard even in this format through dialogue.<br /><br />People that go into this with the mindset that they are reading "another Harry Potter book" just like all of the other books that we know and love are clearly going to be disappointed with what they find. I think the review I've seen the most that annoys me to no end is the people saying that 'it reads like bad fanfiction'. First of all, this is the official rehearsal script of a, so far, successful sold out play that is currently running on London's West End. If it wasn't good or didn't stay true to the heart of the Harry Potter world and to the characters we know and love, including all of the new characters we only got to see a single chapter of in the epilogue that are being reintroduced to us, there is no way that J.K. Rowling would have allowed this to be professionally produced. <br /><br />As a theatre lover myself, I can guarantee you that a stage script of a show is NOTHING compared to actually seeing the show performed live no matter how many times you read it and think you know what to expect. For those of us who haven't seen the play (which is most of us, let's be honest) we cannot judge and criticize this show based simply on a single rehearsal script, which might not even be the final product when the show reaches the point of being completely finished and ready for the world to experience. <br /><br />So many things change throughout the rehearsal process; the producers, directors, lighting designers, costume designers, casting directors, etc and obviously Rowling herself are going to work hard at this show until it is the best that it can be. They will make sure that it grows into something that will one day be able to open in other parts of the world to make it more accessible for fans of the Wizarding world that Rowling has created to be able to see it worldwide. <br /><br />It's run in London is only the first step in a very long process that will help bring the stage magic up to par in order for it to make its way out into the world. We just have to be patient and be happy that they released a script at all, to give us a small idea of what to expect of the basic storyline that this play will unfold to us whenever we do get the chance to see it performed. <br /><br />Honestly you just have to accept this script for what it is; a little dip back into the Wizarding World that all of us know and love. And I am perfectly content with just that.<br /><br />~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br /><br />- Reread August 2016 -<br /><br />I still stand by my five star rating for this and have even more appreciation after rereading it and tabbing the crap out of it; spending some more time analyzing it this time. I still say that it is NOT an eighth Harry Potter book; it is a play SCRIPT set years and years later and has to abide by the rules of theatre and therefore real life. <br /><br />I'll save the rest of my ranty review defending it for my spoilery review video ;)</span>  <a data-text-id="3691176281948950961" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>      <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1771527403?book_show_action=false">Sep 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Carlos" class="user" name="Carlos" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788498387568" href="/book/show/30243012-harry-potter-y-el-legado-maldito">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1771527403" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8171180682471175336">Iba con las expectativas bajas para no darme un trompazo, pero esto ha sido mucho peor de lo que esperaba. Un argumento absurdo, unos giros ridículos y unos personajes que apenas he podido reconocer con respecto a la saga (o sea, J. K. Rowling, ¿qué has hecho con Ron?). Sí, hay escenas bonitas e interesantes, hay personajes que me han encantado (Scorpius) y hay guiños que te sacan una media sonrisa, pero esto parece más un fanfic escrito por alguien que solo ha visto las películas y ni siquiera</span>  <span id="freeText8171180682471175336" style="display:none">Iba con las expectativas bajas para no darme un trompazo, pero esto ha sido mucho peor de lo que esperaba. Un argumento absurdo, unos giros ridículos y unos personajes que apenas he podido reconocer con respecto a la saga (o sea, J. K. Rowling, ¿qué has hecho con Ron?). Sí, hay escenas bonitas e interesantes, hay personajes que me han encantado (Scorpius) y hay guiños que te sacan una media sonrisa, pero esto parece más un fanfic escrito por alguien que solo ha visto las películas y ni siquiera ha leído los libros. No voy a decir que me ha destrozado la saga, porque no me he tomado esto en serio en ningún momento. Y sí, me quedo con la curiosidad de como será la representación teatral.<br /><br />En definitiva, más que "Harry Potter y el legado maldito" debería ser "Harry Potter y el WTF continuo".</span>  <a data-text-id="8171180682471175336" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714344926" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1064140736022929550">Ich fand es wirklich gut, kann die ganzen schlechten Rezensionen echt nicht verstehen. Ich find ja die Freundschaft zwischen Albus und Scorpius zuckersüß. Und auch den Handlungsverlauf fand ich wirklich spannend. Alles in allem hat es von mir 4,5 Sterne verdient. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1718601017" />    <a title="Nissa | Of Pens and Pages Book Blog" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/41356020-nissa-of-pens-and-pages-book-blog"><img alt="Nissa | Of Pens and Pages Book Blog" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1465210954p2/41356020.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1718601017?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Nissa | Of Pens and Pages Book Blog" class="user" name="Nissa | Of Pens and Pages Book Blog" href="/user/show/41356020-nissa-of-pens-and-pages-book-blog">Nissa | Of Pens and Pages Book Blog</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41356020-nissa-of-pens-and-pages-book-blog?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41356020-nissa-of-pens-and-pages-book-blog?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41356020-nissa-of-pens-and-pages-book-blog?shelf=childhood">childhood</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1718601017" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11296223283885679721">3.5 stars!<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470313371i/19913207.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>To be honest, I had no plans of reading Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. I told my sister and my friend that for me, Harry Potter's story ended in Deathly Hallows. I had no idea what the story or the play was about, and I wasn't that interested, to be honest.<br><br>However, when I saw an article saying that Draco and Scorpius Malfoy had a significant part in the story, I couldn't resist. As some of you might know, I'm a bit of a Darcy Malfoy fan. Not just because of Tom Felton, but because</span>  <span id="freeText11296223283885679721" style="display:none">3.5 stars!<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470313371i/19913207.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>To be honest, I had no plans of reading Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. I told my sister and my friend that for me, Harry Potter's story ended in Deathly Hallows. I had no idea what the story or the play was about, and I wasn't that interested, to be honest.<br><br>However, when I saw an article saying that Draco and Scorpius Malfoy had a significant part in the story, I couldn't resist. As some of you might know, I'm a bit of a Darcy Malfoy fan. Not just because of Tom Felton, but because of the character itself.<br><br>Anyway, I read the book as soon I was able to get my hands on it. Reading this book felt like seeing and catching up with friends you haven't seen in a long time. Harry Potter has been a huge part of my childhood, and to see them all grown up—married and with kids, too—made me ecstatic. The magic is still there in my heart.<br><br>We see a lot of familiar faces—Harry, Hermione, Ron, Draco, Professor McGonagall, to name a few—and new ones—Albus Potter, Scorpius Malfoy, the Granger-Weasley kids, the next generation students. <br><br>This was enjoyable as a standalone, and the script made me want to watch the play, but it was hard to accept as canon. There were a lot of plot holes and some of the characters seemed OOC (out of character). There were times when I felt I was reading a fan fic. Some of it felt like it was written purely for fan service (Am I right, Dramione fans?). <br><br>The thing that bothered me the most was Draco Malfoy. I've always believed he could have been different if he was given the chance to be Harry and co.'s friend. In this play/script, we were able to see and understand Draco, and I felt bad for him because he wasn't truly evil; just misguided. If he had the right friends, things would have been different. But I shouldn't be lamenting over the past, so I'm going to let it go. It just sucked to be proven right, I guess. <br><br>There was some consolation though. There was a bit of a redemption for Draco, and Scorpius was a darling. He was a mix of Ron and Hermione, having Ron's sense of humor and Hermione's wit. I think that's what it made him perfect as Albus' best friend. There was also a scene with a beloved character (After all this time?) that warmed my heart. <br><br>All in all, I was happy I read this, but it wouldn't have been a loss if I didn't. I still hope The Cursed Child would tour someday because I would still like to see it. <br><br><a href="http://www.ofpensandpages.com/2016/08/review-harry-potter-and-cursed-child-by.html" rel="nofollow">  <img src="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a></span>  <a data-text-id="11296223283885679721" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1718601017" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1718601017" ref="like" class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1718601017/comments?reverse=true">View 1 comment</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1718601017' style='display: none'><textarea </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1730068092" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1730068092" />    <a title="Althea Ann" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3846743-althea-ann"><img alt="Althea Ann" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1411566466p2/3846743.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1730068092?book_show_action=false">Sep 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Althea Ann" class="user" name="Althea Ann" href="/user/show/3846743-althea-ann">Althea Ann</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1730068092" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9899396566296442249">This is not a Harry Potter sequel.<br /><br />It is a commentary on Harry Potter. It's an exploration of the idea that, "Hey? You know what wouldn't be easy? Being the son of a famous father, and trying to live up to people's expectations of you, based on your parentage." Not a terribly new idea, really. Here we learn specifically that being either Harry Potter's son or Draco Malfoy's son is kinda lousy, and that trying to "prove" yourself is bound to backfire. We also get it pointed out to us that being go</span>  <span id="freeText9899396566296442249" style="display:none">This is not a Harry Potter sequel.<br /><br />It is a commentary on Harry Potter. It's an exploration of the idea that, "Hey? You know what wouldn't be easy? Being the son of a famous father, and trying to live up to people's expectations of you, based on your parentage." Not a terribly new idea, really. Here we learn specifically that being either Harry Potter's son or Draco Malfoy's son is kinda lousy, and that trying to "prove" yourself is bound to backfire. We also get it pointed out to us that being good at (even famed for) your skill in one area of expertise is not necessarily going to translate into being a good parent.<br /><br />Throughout the story, the 'message' feels heavy-handed, and totally overwhelms any sense of adventure or fun. The plot itself is a poorly-conceived and sometimes-confusing time-travel excursion, allowing the authors to look at a couple of "what-if" scenarios from the Harry Potter Universe, giving the play a very 'fan-fiction' feel.<br /><br />In general, I must admit, I don't enjoy reading theatrical scripts or screenplays. I feel that they're designed to be seen, not read, and that they're missing the huge, essential half of the equation that talented actors are expected to bring to the stage. There are exceptions, of course, great plays that are amazing both on the page and on stage... but this is not one. <br /><br />Supposedly, this publication is "based on" a story idea by JK Rowling. Obviously, I don't know how much of the idea was hers, but it's worth mentioning that she did not actually write any of the words of this play - it's distinctly not her writing style.<br /><br />I didn't have extremely high expectations of this, but nevertheless, it was still disappointing. I would not bother to go see the play on stage.</span>  <a data-text-id="9899396566296442249" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1745449449" />    <a title="James Trevino" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/52992135-james-trevino"><img alt="James Trevino" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472482820p2/52992135.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1745449449?book_show_action=false">Sep 17, 2016</a>      <a title="James Trevino" class="user" name="James Trevino" href="/user/show/52992135-james-trevino">James Trevino</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781338099133" href="/book/show/29069989-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-parts-1-2">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1745449449" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11691118702852359672">I decided I should not review this book immediately after reading it and it seems like it was the right decision. After a lot of thinking, I came to the conclusion that I am so damn happy J.K. decided to give us a follow-up, even if she did not write it. <br>Cursed Child is a wonderful book IF you are a fan. Like any other Potterhead I made movies in my head about how Harry, Ron and Hermione carried on with their lives and as great as those movies were, they weren't... well, official. Now I have an</span>  <span id="freeText11691118702852359672" style="display:none">I decided I should not review this book immediately after reading it and it seems like it was the right decision. After a lot of thinking, I came to the conclusion that I am so damn happy J.K. decided to give us a follow-up, even if she did not write it. <br>Cursed Child is a wonderful book IF you are a fan. Like any other Potterhead I made movies in my head about how Harry, Ron and Hermione carried on with their lives and as great as those movies were, they weren't... well, official. Now I have an official version and it is a satisfying one... for the most part.<br>Of course I have some problems with it, the main one being the form it is written in. But that's mainly my fault for having such insane expectations. That being said, once you accept it, it is so easy to get sucked in the story. I always loved Harry Potter for it's twists and turns and this book had plenty of those. <br>I started like:<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1474128625ra/20558885.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And then I was like:<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461093882ra/18823744.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And when shit really hit the fan:<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1398353217i/9405100.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And finally:<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474128625i/20558887.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>So yeah, it was a ridiculously entertaining one-sitting read. And while it had it's problems, it still was one of the best books I put my eyes on this year. <br></span>  <a data-text-id="11691118702852359672" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1745449449">  <td itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1545021477" />    <a title="Patricia Bejarano" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25336538-patricia-bejarano"><img alt="Patricia Bejarano" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479213307p2/25336538.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1545021477?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Patricia Bejarano" class="user" name="Patricia Bejarano" href="/user/show/25336538-patricia-bejarano">Patricia Bejarano</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545021477" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3042866104856088574">Tenía muchísimo miedo. Miedo a que no me hiciera sentir lo mismo que el resto de los libros de la saga, pero me ha hecho sentir que volvía a tener 12 años. He vuelto a disfrutar de la magia y de cada página como consiguió la saga original. Obviamente, es una obra de teatro, no está todo tan desarrollado, pero no me ha importado en ningún momento. Sin duda ha sido todo un regalo, jamás pensé que podría ocurrir lo que pasa en este libro y ¡he flipado en muchísimos momentos! Sin duda sería</span>  <span id="freeText3042866104856088574" style="display:none">Tenía muchísimo miedo. Miedo a que no me hiciera sentir lo mismo que el resto de los libros de la saga, pero me ha hecho sentir que volvía a tener 12 años. He vuelto a disfrutar de la magia y de cada página como consiguió la saga original. Obviamente, es una obra de teatro, no está todo tan desarrollado, pero no me ha importado en ningún momento. Sin duda ha sido todo un regalo, jamás pensé que podría ocurrir lo que pasa en este libro y ¡he flipado en muchísimos momentos! Sin duda sería maravilloso ver la obra en directo, ver como hacen toda la magia en vivo. <br />El título puede ser un poco engañoso, porque la obra gira más alrededor de Albus Severus, hijo de Harry, que alrededor del mismísimo Harry Potter. <br />Si sois fans, estoy segura de que lo vais a disfrutar y que no os va a decepcionar. Es un regalo. Id con la mente abierta, para profundización de personajes ya tenemos una saga de siete libros, simplemente ¡¡¡¡disfrutad!!!!</span>  <a data-text-id="3042866104856088574" href="#" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1546857862" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1546857862" />    <a title="Steysha Kravits" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9946057-steysha-kravits"><img alt="Steysha Kravits" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470471485p2/9946057.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1546857862?book_show_action=false">Aug 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Steysha Kravits" class="user" name="Steysha Kravits" href="/user/show/9946057-steysha-kravits">Steysha Kravits</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/29058155-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1546857862" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7977533951585161209">A shitty fanfiction that was made canon. Don`t know how Rowling agreed to this, it doesn`t seem like she`s in a great need of money. The whole time I was like WTF IS THIS SHIT???? Harry is a douche, his son is a dumb douche, Draco sounds smarter than Hermione, Dumbledore, the greatest wizard of all fucking time, became a crying bitch, Snape is a fluffy bear who can`t wait to end his life in order to save the others... Ughhhhhhh, I can`t even. I don`t like fanfiction, and this one made me</span>  <span id="freeText7977533951585161209" style="display:none">A shitty fanfiction that was made canon. Don`t know how Rowling agreed to this, it doesn`t seem like she`s in a great need of money. The whole time I was like WTF IS THIS SHIT???? Harry is a douche, his son is a dumb douche, Draco sounds smarter than Hermione, Dumbledore, the greatest wizard of all fucking time, became a crying bitch, Snape is a fluffy bear who can`t wait to end his life in order to save the others... Ughhhhhhh, I can`t even. I don`t like fanfiction, and this one made me particulary angry. And here I dreamt to read another Harry Potter book... be careful what you wish for, I guess. 2 stars, and only because it`s named "Harry Potter" and because of Scorpius. As much as I dislike fanfiction, I`m 100% sure that there are better fanfics than this rubbish. </span>  <a data-text-id="7977533951585161209" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1546857862">  <td itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1546047684" />    <a title="Penélope " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/23635926-pen-lope"><img alt="Penélope " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450469152p2/23635926.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1546047684?book_show_action=false">Sep 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Penélope " class="user" name="Penélope " href="/user/show/23635926-pen-lope">Penélope </a>          added it                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23635926-pen-lope?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23635926-pen-lope?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1546047684" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14221416443863416879"><b> <i>“Harry, there is never a perfect answer in this messy, emotional world. Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, show your pain. To suffer is as human as to breathe.” <br />― Harry Potter and the Cursed Child - Parts One and Two</i> </b><br /><br /><br />I think I won't rate this book. It was good but you know it wasn't a "Harry Potter book". <br /><br />----------------<br /><br />IT'S THE</span>  <span id="freeText14221416443863416879" style="display:none"><b>  <i>“Harry, there is never a perfect answer in this messy, emotional world. Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, show your pain. To suffer is as human as to breathe.” <br />― Harry Potter and the Cursed Child - Parts One and Two</i></b><br /><br /><br />I think I won't rate this book. It was good but you know it wasn't a "Harry Potter book". <br /><br />----------------<br /><br />IT'S THE DAY!!!!!!!!!!! HAPPY BIRTHDAY HARRY AND JK ROWLING<br /><br />----------------<br /><br />4 MORE DAYS GUYS!!!<br /><br />-----------------<br /><br />July 31st 2016 I NEED YOU.</span>  <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1714763529" />    <a title="Anne" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27340731-anne"><img alt="Anne" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1421046842p2/27340731.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714763529?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Anne" class="user" name="Anne" href="/user/show/27340731-anne">Anne</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar id="reviewTextContainer1714763529" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11145230934486623240">Loved it! I really, really, really want to see it.<br /><br />the special effects must be amazing!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1714763529">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1714763529" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1714763529u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1714763529'><a id="like_count_review_1714763529" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1714763529?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">28 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1714763529" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1714763529" ref="like" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1546127177" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1546127177" />    <a title="twelvejan [Alexandria]" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16210144-twelvejan-alexandria"><img alt="twelvejan [Alexandria]" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1408447698p2/16210144.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1546127177?book_show_action=false">Aug 09, 2016</a>      <a title="twelvejan [Alexandria]" class="user" name="twelvejan [Alexandria]" href="/user/show/16210144-twelvejan-alexandria">twelvejan [Alexandria]</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16210144-twelvejan-alexandria?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16210144-twelvejan-alexandria?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16210144-twelvejan-alexandria?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16210144-twelvejan-alexandria?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16210144-twelvejan-alexandria?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1546127177" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7808384608405498329"><b> <i>The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.</i> </b><br><br>The end. Finito. C'est la fin.<br><br>The Harry Potter series ended at book 7. There is no continuation, no book 8, no spin-offs. Nope. I refuse to acknowledge the existence of book 8. Harry Potter and the Cursed Child (it should have been called <i>'Albus, Scorpius, and the Cursed Child'</i>) is <b>NOT</b> book 8. HPCC, is at best, a canon; the work of someone trying their hands at writing fan fiction. That. Is. It.<br><br>I was surprised when I heard that the</span>  <span id="freeText7808384608405498329" style="display:none"><b>  <i>The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.</i></b><br><br>The end. Finito. C'est la fin.<br><br>The Harry Potter series ended at book 7. There is no continuation, no book 8, no spin-offs. Nope. I refuse to acknowledge the existence of book 8. Harry Potter and the Cursed Child (it should have been called <i>'Albus, Scorpius, and the Cursed Child'</i>) is <b>NOT</b> book 8. HPCC, is at best, a canon; the work of someone trying their hands at writing fan fiction. That. Is. It.<br><br>I was surprised when I heard that there will be a book 8. Then hesitant, when I realised it wasn't <i>really</i> fully written by the beloved J.K. Rowling. Then hesitation gave way to apprehension, when I realised it was gonna be in the form of a script book. <i>Bad idea. Really bad idea</i>.<br><br>A play is a performance put up by actors and actresses who breathe life into the characters they portray. We have props, colours, movements, sounds. The engagement of the audience is central in a play in ensuring that they are captivated and emotionally invested. A script (<i>a rehearsal script, at that</i>) disguised as a book fails to deliver the connection and emotions readers crave for. <br><br>I want to FEEL, but I felt nothing. The years go by really quickly, I didn't get a chance to get to really <i>know</i> Albus and Scorpius. I couldn't comprehend why Albus did what he did - I couldn't deduce the reason for such a reckless act. Because it sure doesn't make things better, nor improve <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[his relationship with Harry <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. Almost everyone was out of character, specifically Draco Malfoy. One optimist reviewer felt that love changed Draco Malfoy to be a better man. The cynical me finds that a total bull. I mean, sure love could possibly make you a better person. But this Draco Malfoy is as sensible as Hermione! That is preposterous. And don't get me started on Harry and <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Albus Dumbeldore <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>! They were ridiculously sappy and I had wanted to smack Harry with my Harry Potter books 4 to 7. But to be fair, all these could have been avoided if book 8 was an ACTUAL NOVELISATION of the play!<br><br>It took me a couple of scenes to really get into the story because i tend to read the names of the characters. It was worse during the scene at the Ministry of Magic when they had the polyjuice and both names appeared at the sideline. But it wasn't so bad after a while. You just gotta bulldoze your way in.<br><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[And Voldemort and Bellatrix getting it on - INCOMPREHENSIBLE! I just cannot fathom this fact. It's like you denying your parents EVER had sex. This feels exactly like that. My childhood story is ruined. *cries* <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>I would have given this a 2.5 stars but Albus and Scorpius deserved some points. They were reckless yet entertaining and hilarious. And Ron, damnit, he was by far the one and only character who remained <i>in character</i> with his dry jokes that are so silly, they were actually funny. Loved it.<br><br>When I read HPCC, it was as if I was reading Rainbow Rowell's <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/16068905.Fangirl" title="Fangirl by Rainbow Rowell">Fangirl</a> where Cath writes fan fiction of her favourite series, which in actual fact refers to the Harry Potter series. I hated those parts in Fangirl and eventually skipped those chapters. This was equally as bad. And yet, I still shelved it under my 'Favourite' shelf. *shrugs*<br><br>All in all, HPCC is entertaining enough to keep you rooted for a few hours. Can be easily completed in one sitting cos even though it's a 330-page book, the actual number of reading pages is lesser than that. Good, just not 'Harry Potter Epic Level'.<br><br><b>Conclusion: Don't let my rating and review influence you. But brace yourself if it doesn't match up to your high expectation.</b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1469972413i/19876289._SY540_.jpg" width="400" height="535" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Update: Many, many months before the release...</b><br><br>I'm waiting for this in trepidation. <br><br>And like what Stephen Colbert says:<br><br><blockquote><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1441446433i/16111232.gif" width="50" height="50" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg">...the play actually takes place 19 years after the last book, and features a thirty-something Harry balancing his job at the Ministry of Magic with being a father. THAT...really sounds depressing. But let's all admit that Harry Potter's life peaked at 17; Captain of the Quidditch team, big Chosen One on campus, now he's just some <i>guy</i>.<br><br>Who's his enemy even going to be? Phil from Accounting? A slowing metabolism? A vague restless feeling when he looks at travel posters?</blockquote><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1436460869ra/15462894.gif" width="385" height="288" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Damn, I don't need a book about that. I could look at my life!<br><br>Oh god, could I handle the disappointment if it suck?</["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="7808384608405498329" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1546127177">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1546127177" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1546127177'><a id="like_count_review_1546127177" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1546127177?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">28 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1546127177" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1546127177" ref="like" class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1546127177/comments?reverse=true">View all 8 comments</a><span
