</div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544318263" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544318263" />    <a title="Tina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6710522-tina"><img alt="Tina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1438609135p2/6710522.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544318263?book_show_action=false">Aug 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Tina" class="user" name="Tina" href="/user/show/6710522-tina">Tina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/29058155-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6710522-tina?shelf=favorites-2016">favorites-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544318263" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4890622749400024812">Wo Harry Potter draufsteht, ist auch Harry Potter drin. Wundervoller, wenn auch überraschend düsterer Ausflug. <br /><br /><br />Inhalt<br />..................<br /><br />Es handelt sich hier streng genommen nicht um eine typische Fortsetzung der Harry-Potter Reihe. "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" ist ein Theaterstück, das zeitlich 20 Jahre nach dem letzten Band spielt. Harry ist erwachsen geworden, doch sein Abenteuer ist längst nicht zu Ende. Nun verheiratet und als Vater dreier Kinder stellen sich beruflich und privat ganz</span>  <span id="freeText4890622749400024812" style="display:none">Wo Harry Potter draufsteht, ist auch Harry Potter drin. Wundervoller, wenn auch überraschend düsterer Ausflug. <br /><br /><br />Inhalt<br />..................<br /><br />Es handelt sich hier streng genommen nicht um eine typische Fortsetzung der Harry-Potter Reihe. "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" ist ein Theaterstück, das zeitlich 20 Jahre nach dem letzten Band spielt. Harry ist erwachsen geworden, doch sein Abenteuer ist längst nicht zu Ende. Nun verheiratet und als Vater dreier Kinder stellen sich beruflich und privat ganz neue Herausforderungen. Gerade sein Sohn Albus hält ihn auf Trapp, beide geraten nicht nur einmal aneinander. Doch diesen Zwist müssen beide begraben, denn die magische Welt wird erneut bedroht und nur einer kann sie retten...<br /><br />Zur Klarstellung: "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" ist ausschließlich in Dialogform geschrieben und kein "echtes" Buch.<br /><br />Mein Eindruck<br />.....................................<br /><br />Ich muss sagen, ich war von Beginn an verzaubert. Natürlich, die Skriptform ist auf den ersten paar Seiten ungewohnt. Doch schon nach ein, zwei Szenen... es ist, als wäre man wieder zu Hause angekommen. All die lieb gewonnen Figuren kommen wieder vor, zwar natürlich um Jahre älter, aber am Prinzip hat sich nicht viel verändert. <br /><br />Großer Dreh- und Angelpunkt ist die Vater-Sohn-Beziehung zwischen Harry und Albus. Wie man sich vorstellen kann, ist es nicht einfach, im Schatten vom legendären Harry Potter aufzuwachsen. Gerade für Albus, der wesentlich sensibler und nachdenklicher ist, als seine zwei Geschwister. Doch auch er muss seinen Weg finden, genauso wie Harry lernen muss, mit einem für ihn "schwierigen" Kind umzugehen. Ich fand die Konflikte sehr nachvollziehbar und es zeigt, dass Harry eben nicht die durchweg perfekte Hauptfigur ist. <br /><br />Gleichzeitig haben, wie versprochen, viele alte bekannte und auch neue Figuren ihren Auftritt. Ich fand es einfach herrlich. Dadurch, dass ein faszinierendes magisches Artefakt durchweg eine wichtige Rolle spielt, werden auch Schauplätze aufgesucht, die ich nur allzu sehr vermisst habe. Allerdings ist das gesamte Buch/Stück überraschend düster. Hier muss ich ganz ehrlich sagen, dass ich mit dieser Intensität nicht unbedingt gerechnet habe. Eigentlich hätte ich es mir denken können, denn im Laufe der Reihe wurden die Bücher von Band zu Band ernster und teils auch grausamer. "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" setzt diesen Trend fort. In vielen "was wäre, wenn" gibt es so einigen harten Tobak zu verdauen. <br /><br />Doch auch das passt zum mittlerweile erwachsenen Harry. Er ist eben keine 11 Jahre mehr alt und hat nun ganz andere Probleme, als früher. Dennoch spiegelt das Stück viele Elemente wieder, die alle Harry-Potter-Bände ausmachen: Freundschaft, Mut der Verzweiflung und ein unerschütterbarer Zusammenhalt. Ganz ehrlich, am liebsten hätte ich mir wieder alle Bände geschnappt und zum x.-ten Mal wieder von vorne angefangen. Harry Potter ist zeitlos, es zu lesen macht mich glücklich - es ist meine Portion Perfektion in Buchstabenform.<br /><br />Fazit <br />..................<br /><br />Ich bin mir sicher, dass man als Fan der Reihe wieder seinen Spaß mit "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" haben kann. Es ist vielleicht nicht ganz das, was sich viele erhofft haben (kein klassisches Buch). Aber es ist ein wundervoller Ausflug in eine Welt, die mir über Jahre ans Herz gewachsen ist und mich ein Stück weit an meine Kindheit zurückdenken lässt. Im Vergleich zu unzähligen Büchern, die mich dieses Jahr kaum fesseln konnten, klebte ich vom ersten Moment hier wieder an den Seiten. Harry Potter ist für mich reine Lesemagie - egal in welcher Form.<br /><br />Ein wundervoller Ausflug "zurück"</span>  <a data-text-id="4890622749400024812" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544318263"> class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544318263'><a id="like_count_review_1544318263" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544318263?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">25 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544318263" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544318263" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=25u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=9u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1544318263u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1697789025" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1697789025" />    <a title="Melanie " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/47129377-melanie"><img alt="Melanie " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469251703p2/47129377.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1697789025?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Melanie " class="user" name="Melanie " href="/user/show/47129377-melanie">Melanie </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/47129377-melanie?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/47129377-melanie?shelf=ya-fantasy">ya-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/47129377-melanie?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1697789025" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2314895903237436117"><blockquote> <i> <b>“It’s tough to live with people stuck in the past, isn’t it?” </b> </i> </blockquote><br /><br /><br /><b>This review has some spoilers. </b>I do recommend that you stay away from reviews if you haven't read it yet. This screenplay is getting such mixed reviews that the only way to truly stay unaffected by all this is to stay away from all the opinions, read it yourself and then you can form your own personal opinion. <br /><br />This book, actually screenplay, is one of the hardest I've ever had to review because I have so many mixed emotions on it.</span>  <span id="freeText2314895903237436117" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <i>    <b>“It’s tough to live with people stuck in the past, isn’t it?” </b>  </i></blockquote><br /><br /><br /><b>This review has some spoilers. </b>I do recommend that you stay away from reviews if you haven't read it yet. This screenplay is getting such mixed reviews that the only way to truly stay unaffected by all this is to stay away from all the opinions, read it yourself and then you can form your own personal opinion. <br /><br />This book, actually screenplay, is one of the hardest I've ever had to review because I have so many mixed emotions on it. I gave it four stars, however, I don't think it deserved it entirely. I know that my rating is based in nostalgia. If I was basing my rating on plot, how solid the writing is and so forth - man <i> Harry Potter and The Cursed Child</i> would easily go down to a two, yes two. <br /><br />I might be in the minority but I was one of the people who was not that excited about this release and did not think it was a good idea. Why didn't I think it was likely going to be a good idea? Mostly because I think sometimes we don't know when we've had enough of a good thing. When something is amazing and changes our lives, of course, we want MORE but that isn't always a great choice. The Harry Potter series is one of the most beloved book series of our generation and it ended on a high note, where we were left wondering and wanting to know more about these characters. I think that is where it should have ended, wanting more is a lot better than feeling "meh" or strange about a new book once you read it. This is not an original thought, many people have said it already, but this screenplay was VERY much a work of fanfiction. <br /><br />Ok, so what gives? How come I gave it a four stars if I have all this negative shit to say about it? Well, I still happened to get caught up in the story because I was loving seeing the characters again. It was like watching a bad sequel but you didn't care that it was kind of terrible, you were just so happy all the cast returned. The positives for me about <i>Harry Potter and The Cursed Child</i> were Scorpious, loved him. His and Albus's friendship was probably my favorite part of the book. I liked <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Voldermont's daughter plot line <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>, even it was cheesy. I loved the ending where all the characters are really all together interacting once again, I completely fangirled out. <br /><br />The biggest negatives for me about the story had to be that I didn't feel that the story was true to the characters we loved and watched grow up. Harry was kind of a douche father, Hermione didn't have any of that sass, but heart that we all loved and Ron - oh where do I even start? They turned him into a total loser, just a joke. The relationship between Ron and Hermione felt like nothing, there was no chemistry. There really wasn't any chemistry between Harry, Ron and Hermione period. I also thought the Cedric story was a very flimsy one to go on. <br /><br />Overall, this is a story was fun if you aren't trying to over-analysis it. It is cheesy, it isn't going to change your world, but you just might be able to ignore all those glaring flaws just to go back to Hogwarts! <br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>    <b>“The world changes and we change with it. I am better off in this world. But the world is not better. And I don't want that.” </b>  </i></blockquote></span>  <a data-text-id="2314895903237436117" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1732203665" />    <a title="Giulia China" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/41126299-giulia-china"><img alt="Giulia China" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1429016749p2/41126299.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1732203665?book_show_action=false">Sep 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Giulia China" class="user" name="Giulia China" href="/user/show/41126299-giulia-china">Giulia China</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781338099133" href="/book/show/29069989-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-parts-1-2">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1732203665" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14731145606631926330"><br>If you have been growing up with Harry, Ron and Hermione, you are probably still waiting for your Hogwarts letter that, for sure, got lost in the mail.<br>As a BIG fan of the series I've been waiting for a sequel forever! Between fear of being disappointed and excitement I pre-ordered Harry Potter and the Curse Child, months before the publishing. I want in it without knowing anything about it, even though spoilers were available everywhere, I've been a good kid and I resisted every temptations. May</span>  <span id="freeText14731145606631926330" style="display:none"><br>If you have been growing up with Harry, Ron and Hermione, you are probably still waiting for your Hogwarts letter that, for sure, got lost in the mail.<br>As a BIG fan of the series I've been waiting for a sequel forever! Between fear of being disappointed and excitement I pre-ordered Harry Potter and the Curse Child, months before the publishing. I want in it without knowing anything about it, even though spoilers were available everywhere, I've been a good kid and I resisted every temptations. Maybe that's what I did wrong.<br>I published a post about the things you should know before reading it, you can find it <a href="http://bookscrumbles.blogspot.it/2016/08/be-aware-10-things-to-know-before.html" rel="nofollow">HERE</a>.<br><br>Since It's hard to talk about the plot of the play without spoiling bits. I will just give you the start point of the story. The story picks up from Harry Potter and The Deathly Hallows epilogue. Nineteen years after the Battle of Hogwarts our heroes, now grown up, are at platform 9 3/4 to send off their kids. From there the story skips forward to Albus, Harry's kid, forth year of school. The play concentrated itself on the relationship between father and son, Harry and Albus.<br>I'm just going to give you some clues about the plot: <b>Time-turner, Cedric, Triwizard Cup.</b><br><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470439607ra/19929317.gif" width="" height="" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>Let me say I was really happy to see our heros back, some even from the dead, and was surprised with the new characters. I loved Scorpius Malfoy, he is a good mix of intelligence and humor, on the other hand Albus Potter felt obnoxious to me and as stupid as his father, sorry Harry.<br>The plot was kind of boring and felt like a bad fanfiction from start to finish. After finishing the Harry Potter series we all said good byes to the characters or made up our own story, I would have like to see their kids in Hogwarts, playing quidditch, going to potion class and making some mischief, we don't get any of that again someone is messing with magic to bring back You-Know-Who.<br><br>I think that most of my problem with this book was in fact that it isn't a book, but a play the only way to judge it honestly is to see it on stage. As a read it was not so entertaining.<br><br><b>3/5 STARS</b><br><br><b>10 things you should know before reading it:</b><br><br><a target="_blank" href="http://bookscrumbles.blogspot.it/2016/08/be-aware-10-things-to-know-before.html" rel="nofollow">http://bookscrumbles.blogspot.it/2016...</a><br><br><b>My blog book review:</b><br><br><a target="_blank" href="http://bookscrumbles.blogspot.it/2016/08/harry-potter-and-cursed-child-by-jk.html" rel="nofollow">http://bookscrumbles.blogspot.it/2016...</a></span>  <a data-text-id="14731145606631926330" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="/user/show/7928538-constanza"><img alt="Constanza" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1330242604p2/7928538.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1715008463?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Constanza" class="user" name="Constanza" href="/user/show/7928538-constanza">Constanza</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7928538-constanza?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1715008463" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10584613245347314531">I'm sure it must be wonderful to see this live on stage, that the production is amazing and the actors are fantastic...the thing is, the story is just bad.<br><br>The times where it felt like an actual Harry Potter book were few and far between, for the most part it was fan fiction. But J.K. Rowling had the idea, it wasn't written by her, but she put her seal of approval so this is now Harry Potter canon, and I'm kind of pissed off about it.<br><br>Rant about some plot lines and characters; <br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br>Harry</span></span>  <span id="freeText10584613245347314531" style="display:none">I'm sure it must be wonderful to see this live on stage, that the production is amazing and the actors are fantastic...the thing is, the story is just bad.<br><br>The times where it felt like an actual Harry Potter book were few and far between, for the most part it was fan fiction. But J.K. Rowling had the idea, it wasn't written by her, but she put her seal of approval so this is now Harry Potter canon, and I'm kind of pissed off about it.<br><br>Rant about some plot lines and characters; <br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br>Harry Potter...our hero. It's the worst parent out there and a complete asshole to his entire family and friends, I mean not just to Albus but where the hell are James and Lily here? they just go around chasing Albus in all of his "adventures" but don't give a damn about his other kids. And another thing, did Ginny lost every coin toss in naming their kids? <br><br>Apparently on a different reality Hermione becames a bitch just because she didn't get married, because one of the most beloved female characters in book history, a strong independent woman as herself needs a man at her side or she will be forever angry at the world.<br><br>Voldemort and Bellatrix had a daughter...by some magical wand insemination or what? like most of the plot lines it's never explain and the character of Delphin was a joke, a stupid, boring unnecessary joke.<br><br>Cedric! the poster child for Huffelpuff the nicest house in Hogwarts, all around nice guy becames a Death eater because he was embarrassed by a prank played by some kids?!?!<br><br>Snape, the bravest man who Rowling said time and time again didn't give a damn about Harry or the bigger picture is brought back just so we can get a moment of "he really was a nice guy right?"..well, no he wasn't, he was a dick in the first seven books and I don't buy for a second that he would join the 2 men army in this parallel universe.<br><br>And lastly, we spend the entire book thinking that Albus and Scorpius are gay, right? I can't be alone here, but at the end, last fucking chapter Scorpius ask Rose out(?)<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1417094064ra/12211951.gif" width="480" height="223" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br> <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>Some things are just too precious and are better left alone. </["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="10584613245347314531" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544948675" />    <a title="Janset Atacan" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7154009-janset-atacan"><img alt="Janset Atacan" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452681737p2/7154009.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544948675?book_show_action=false">Aug 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Janset Atacan" class="user" name="Janset Atacan" href="/user/show/7154009-janset-atacan">Janset Atacan</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7154009-janset-atacan?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544948675" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13978559251973620198">Bazı hikayeler tamamlanmadığı, eksik bırakıldığı ya da okuyucu bir parça da olsa üzgün hissettiği için devam eder. Bir sonraki romanda çift kavuşacak mı, kız hamile kalacak mı diye yazarı sürekli dürtüklediğimizden yeni ve ultra seksi bir kitapla ödüllendiriliriz. Ancak ikinci kitaba asla yüksek puan vermeyiz. Buradan çıkardığım sonuç; aç gözlüyüz. Ne var ki, söz konusu aç gözlülüğün Harry Potter vb hikayeler için geçerli olmasını doğru bulmuyorum. Zira karşımızda yeniyetme bir yazar veya</span>  <span id="freeText13978559251973620198" style="display:none">Bazı hikayeler tamamlanmadığı, eksik bırakıldığı ya da okuyucu bir parça da olsa üzgün hissettiği için devam eder. Bir sonraki romanda çift kavuşacak mı, kız hamile kalacak mı diye yazarı sürekli dürtüklediğimizden yeni ve ultra seksi bir kitapla ödüllendiriliriz. Ancak ikinci kitaba asla yüksek puan vermeyiz. Buradan çıkardığım sonuç; aç gözlüyüz. Ne var ki, söz konusu aç gözlülüğün Harry Potter vb hikayeler için geçerli olmasını doğru bulmuyorum. Zira karşımızda yeniyetme bir yazar veya sıradan bir hikaye yok. Dahası Ölüm Yadigarları ile birlikte ucu açık kalmayan temiz bir son var. O halde şunu sormak istiyorum; neden?<br />Yazarın ve serinin büyük bir hayranı olsam dahi bu soruyu sormaktan kendimi alamıyorum. Çünkü aksi takdirde JK'ye olan saygımdan ödün vermiş olurum. Bir tiyatro oyunu olarak başarılı sayılabilecek Cursed Child neden kitaba dönüştürüldü? Neden Voldemort'un bir kızı olduğuna dair bir diyalog okudum? Ya da yıllarca savunduğum, kaşını gözünü sevdiğim Harry Potter karakteri nasıl böyle bir değişim geçirdi? Voldemort ölmüşken, hortkuluklar yok olmuşken, nasıl bir parçası hayatta kalabildi? Bu parçanın varlığını biz daha önce nerede okuduk? Bella ve Voldemort savaş sırasında vakit bulup nasıl sevişebildi? Görüyorsunuz şimdi hikayenin ucu açılmadı. Hikayede tünel açıldı. Tır geçti o hikayeden.<br />Şunu not düşmek istiyorum. Kendimi büyülü evrende bulmayı bekledim. Ama okuduğum şey yalnızca Harry, Hermione ve Ron adlı karakteriyle ortalama bir hikayeden fazlası değildi. En sevdiğim, taparcasına aşık olduğum yazarın emeğine karşı bu denli sert bir eleştiri yapmak beni üzüyor. <br />Yine de; umuyorum ki oyun Rowling'in isteği doğrultusunda, onun fikirleriyle şekillenmiştir. Jo ''Başka hiçbir yazar böyle harika, farklı ve asil bir okuyucu kitlesine sahip olamazdı'' demişti. Haklı. Çünkü hiçbir okuyucu böyle harika, farklı ve asil bir hikayeyle karşılaşmamıştı. Yıllar önce Part 2'de salya sümük ağlarken mirasını koruyacağıma dair bozulmaz yemin etmiştim. Cursed Child bu yeminin neresinde duruyor, bende bilmiyorum.<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="13978559251973620198" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544948675">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544948675" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1544948675' style='display: none;'></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544131742" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544131742" />    <a title="Raquel Bookish" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6366186-raquel-bookish"><img alt="Raquel Bookish" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466678625p2/6366186.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544131742?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Raquel Bookish" class="user" name="Raquel Bookish" href="/user/show/6366186-raquel-bookish">Raquel Bookish</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Potterheads</span></div>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544131742" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13411951800994507860">¿Me he divertido leyéndolo? Sí ¿Lo volveré a leer? Probablemente ¿Me ha gustado? Ni de lejos como las novelas de Harry Potter, pero lo he disfrutado ¿Me encantaría ir a ver la obra en Londres? SÍ ¿Me parece un buen libro? Por desgracia no, tal vez sea porque el nivel de los 7 libros anteriores dejó el listón muy alto. <br /><br />Intentaré ser breve porque creo que todo lo que se podía decir sobre este el Legado Maldito ya se ha dicho: me ha encantado conocer a algunos de los personajes de la nueva generaci</span>  <span id="freeText13411951800994507860" style="display:none">¿Me he divertido leyéndolo? Sí ¿Lo volveré a leer? Probablemente ¿Me ha gustado? Ni de lejos como las novelas de Harry Potter, pero lo he disfrutado ¿Me encantaría ir a ver la obra en Londres? SÍ ¿Me parece un buen libro? Por desgracia no, tal vez sea porque el nivel de los 7 libros anteriores dejó el listón muy alto. <br /><br />Intentaré ser breve porque creo que todo lo que se podía decir sobre este el Legado Maldito ya se ha dicho: me ha encantado conocer a algunos de los personajes de la nueva generación y ver cómo los sucesos que vivieron en sus años de estudiantes aún repercuten en la vida como adultos de Harry, Ron, Hermione y Draco. Por Albus, Scorpio (que momentos más emocionantes y bonitos nos han regalado, ahí, right in the feels) y por el amor que siento por el mundo mágico le he dado 4 estrellas, pero no estoy segura de si lo habría hecho de haberse tratado de una saga desconocida. <br /><br />Entiendo que por las limitaciones del lenguaje teatral, muy diferente al narrativo, la historia se ve limitada (ni world building, ni decenas de personajes), pero ese no es el problema. Para mí ha fallado el argumento. En la primera parte de la obra a penas ocurre nada y en la segunda parte no dejan de sucederse momentos que rozan lo absurdo, algo parecido a un fanfic improvisado, como si hubiesen hecho un brainstorming de locuras y se hubiesen quedado con todas. No veo ni rastro de las depuradas tramas de JK Rowling en las que todos los detalles de la historia acababan por encajar hasta llevarnos a un final que, mirando hacia a atrás, parecía obvio aunque que nunca lo habrías visto venir. <br /><br />Mi opinión se resume de forma muy sencilla: me gusta pero no porque crea que es bueno, sino porque es de Harry Potter y todo lo que tenga que ver con Harry Potter me toca la fibra sensible. A fangirlear se ha dicho.</span>  <a data-text-id="13411951800994507860" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7264061361278525369">Toto je kniha, na ktorú som čakala asi tak polovicu svojho života. A po troch-štyroch hodinách bolo po nej. <br />Ale vážne, stálo to za to. Bolo to milé, úžasné, emotívne. Aj keď rozhodne úplne iné ako séria. Neviem si síce tak úplne predstaviť ako môže byť toto ako divadelná hra, pretože tam bolo toho tak veľa, ale o to viac by som si ju rada pozrela. <br />Ale tak ako séria, kniha mala úžasný príbeh, úžasné postavy (aj keď mi Harry liezol na nervy), úžasnú Albus + Scorpius bromance (yeah, I definitely sh</span>  <span id="freeText7264061361278525369" style="display:none">Toto je kniha, na ktorú som čakala asi tak polovicu svojho života. A po troch-štyroch hodinách bolo po nej. <br />Ale vážne, stálo to za to. Bolo to milé, úžasné, emotívne. Aj keď rozhodne úplne iné ako séria. Neviem si síce tak úplne predstaviť ako môže byť toto ako divadelná hra, pretože tam bolo toho tak veľa, ale o to viac by som si ju rada pozrela. <br />Ale tak ako séria, kniha mala úžasný príbeh, úžasné postavy (aj keď mi Harry liezol na nervy), úžasnú Albus + Scorpius bromance (yeah, I definitely ship them.) a potom Scorpius... moja nová obľúbená postava. Tiež má v sebe kniha veľa prekvapení ako nečakaný návrat istých postáv. Aj keď to nie je tak úplne návrat, ale keby poviem viac, tak by to bol spoiler. Vlastne vôbec nemôžem riešiť dej, lebo sa to bez spoilerov nedá. Takže si to treba prečítať.<br />Neviem, čo písať. Myslím, že nikoho netreba nabádať k prečítaniu tejto knihy, že do toho sa všetci pustia dobrovoľne. <br />Už aby som ju mala doma!</span>  <a data-text-id="7264061361278525369" href="#" <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544018317'><a id="like_count_review_1544018317" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544018317?resource_type=Review"><span liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543877174" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4035683419179362183">SO..... where do I begin? <br /><br />Before I start, my rating at the moment is 4 stars but it might change because I'm going to take a few days to think through about the book again! <br /><br />So I'm sure everyone has probably heard of / read this book and I've been seeing many mixed reviews, so here are my thoughts on it :) I overall really enjoyed the storyline and there was that nice feeling of nostalgia when reading about the world and all the characters that we love, but there just wasn't this magical feeling</span>  <span id="freeText4035683419179362183" style="display:none">SO..... where do I begin? <br /><br />Before I start, my rating at the moment is 4 stars but it might change because I'm going to take a few days to think through about the book again! <br /><br />So I'm sure everyone has probably heard of / read this book and I've been seeing many mixed reviews, so here are my thoughts on it :) I overall really enjoyed the storyline and there was that nice feeling of nostalgia when reading about the world and all the characters that we love, but there just wasn't this magical feeling that we got when reading the previous 7 books. I feel that it's because all the characters are now adults with kids, and this the story becomes a little more serious. <br /><br />I will be going more into detail in my blog review because I do have a lot of things I want to discuss but overall, it was a good book but it was disapponting too. </span>  <a data-text-id="4035683419179362183" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1543877174">  <td As not-a-book, it is less satisfying although still incredibly imaginative and--true to JKR and most truly great books--it centers on superb underlying themes about family.<br /><br />The script assumes one has read the Harry Potter books.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38427441-azbaqiyah?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38427441-azbaqiyah?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544530761" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7003765389694065978">One word, awsome!<br /><br /><br />Harry don't like pigeon? Kinda cute!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544530761">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544530761" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544530761u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544530761'><a id="like_count_review_1544530761" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544530761?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">26 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544530761" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544530761" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1544530761' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1544530761, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544680418" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544680418" />    <a title="Mary" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/8471229-mary"><img alt="Mary" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1375652458p2/8471229.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544680418?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Mary" class="user" name="Mary" href="/user/show/8471229-mary">Mary</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544680418" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2311082031025164710"><b>I rated this earlier 2.5, rounded up because nostalgia, but the more I think about it, the more problems I have with this book.</b><br><br>It was alright. Cute, but a some of the plot points didn't make sense and <i>a lot</i> of the character pieces were majorly out of character. <br><br>To preface this, I will be 100% honest and say that I <b>loathed</b> the epilogue in the original series. I found it jarring in its placement and felt the series would have ended much stronger without it. I tend to just disregard it whenever it'</span>  <span id="freeText2311082031025164710" style="display:none"><b>I rated this earlier 2.5, rounded up because nostalgia, but the more I think about it, the more problems I have with this book.</b><br><br>It was alright. Cute, but a some of the plot points didn't make sense and <i>a lot</i> of the character pieces were majorly out of character. <br><br>To preface this, I will be 100% honest and say that I <b>loathed</b> the epilogue in the original series. I found it jarring in its placement and felt the series would have ended much stronger without it. I tend to just disregard it whenever it's brought up as "That bonus fanfiction chapter Jo wrote and published."<br><br>I do also read a lot of scripts! Old scripts, mind you. I'm a Shakespeare snob, took drama for six years, and have a thing for Greek drama. So the format of this book doesn't bother me in the least. But this is written in script format, so you know, if that bothers you....something to watch out for. <br><br>On the above script format note...this isn't <i>good</i> script format. It's missing a lot of beats and scenery placement that left me wondering where everyone was. You know those things everyone makes fun of where it's like <b>Hamlet: Word to your mother. (Hamlet exit left)</b>? It's because it actually helps out a lot. Now maybe that is something that modern scripts are doing without, but I found it annoying. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[It was especially troublesome when the Golden Trio, Ginny, and Draco were all in the same room all of the sudden. Or the time traveling placement in the Tri-Wizard Tournament. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>It is really nice to see all the characters we've come to love come back to life again. But to be honest...they get outshone big time by Albus and especially Scorpius. Scorpius is like a dorky Hermione with Draco's looks and it's amazing. Their friendship is also great and it's so nice to see friendship continue to play such an integral part of the Harry Potter world. <br><br>From this point on, my review is going to get ranty and gif heavy. I apologize.<br><br>First, some of the characters were really fucking out of character. To the point where it was nearly offensive. At 12%, we have Amos Diggory demanding Harry to turn over a Time Turner to get his son, Cedric, back. <br><br>First, why was Amos waiting all this time? There's was an additional year after Cedric's death (until the Time Turners were destroyed) where he could have petitioned the Ministry for the Time Turner. Why is he suddenly waiting for it now? <br><br>Second, why are you doing such a disservice to Amos's character like this? Of course he was upset over his son's death. What fucking parent wouldn't be? But the dialogue and the way it played out made it seem like Amos was less a father in mourning and more a petulant man wanting ice cream before he went to bed. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[And I understand if Delphi used a spell of some sort, but for all the things blatantly given to us in the script, to have this not be one of those things, just furthers the disservice to Amos. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>Next, you've taken Ron, of the Golden Trio and turned him into comic relief and...dialogue space taker upper. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1406144718ra/10510860.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Look, some fans don't like Ron because of some reason or another but Ron is Harry's Scorpius! Ron is less of Harry's Scorpius in this book than Draco!<br><br>Which brings us to Draco. I liked him. He was a bit defanged, but I can understand why. <br><br>Who I can't understand being defanged is McGonagall. Have you ever known Minerva McGonagall to take fucking orders from someone if they're orders she doesn't agree with? Like, yeah, she'll eventually have to comply if they're in a position of authority, but she will make sure her displeasure is known because she is Minerva fucking McGonagall. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470120281ra/19888969.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The thing between Harry and Dumbeldore's portrait was weird and forced. It was like reopening a scar that you had naturally let heal just to see if it would hurt again. Like yeah, of course it would, but now it's just a new wound. <br><br>The rest are under spoiler tags:<br><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br><br>Are we supposed to believe that Hermione would become Snape 2.0 just because...why exactly? Because it sounds suspiciously like Hermione became Snape 2.0 because she was alone and literally nowhere in any of the books can I see any hint of that.<br><br>Nowhere. But I'll double check. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470120281ra/19888970.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Cedric fucking Diggory becoming a murderer. Are you fucking kidding me? This. This was enough to drag it down an entire fucking star. Because no. The reason?<br><br>He will murder someone because he's humiliated in front of the school. Yeah. Cedric Diggory. The guy you read about in <i>The Goblet of Fire</i>. That same guy. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1414537995ra/11664984.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Yeah. Go reread that book. I'll wait. Come back and tell me that that fucking guy is capable of murdering someone just because he was humiliated one time in front of a lot of people. Tell me that his handsome face wouldn't be able to play it off. <br><br>And lastly, and the winner of another whole star getting taken off this review; Voldemort. More importantly, the fact that Voldemort and Bellatrix have a kid together. It just seriously reads out of something a thirteen year old writes for bad fanfiction because they don't know how to create a compelling villain. Which is totally great for that thirteen year old because you need a base to start from. It's not okay for JK Rowling. <br><br>Shall I point out some plot holes for this? Do I have time? <br><br>First, Snape. <br><br>Second, Malfoy.<br><br>Third, the timeline just doesn't make fucking sense. <br><br>Fourth, literally all of the inner circle is dead. How did magically the guardians of this kid not get killed?<br><br>Fifth, how was Harry's scar not <i>always</i> hurting? <br><br>There are more, but do you see where I'm going with this? <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>Next were the canon inconsistencies and I'll just say <b>Time Turner.</b> Because I don't know if anything about the Time Turner was not inconsistent with Harry Potter canon. It honestly just opens up a whole can of worms because like....why did no one go back in time and kill baby Tom Riddle?<br><br>The fuck was up with Harry's scar? I mean, I know it had terrible rules in canon, but here it made even less sense. <br><br>We can Transfigure into other people now with little to no prep?<br><br>Albus and Scorpius seriously get around so easily. Like, they must have golden tickets into all the banned places. <br><br>This goes with bad characterization, but after Hermione dealing with Snape's puzzle in <i>The Sorcerer's Stone</i>, what are the chances that she'd hide something with a riddle? Tell me. Look me in the eye and tel me that she'd hide something with a puzzle and not think to herself "You know what, I outsmarted a smart professor's test. I should probably rethink this."<br><br>The Ministry's security is fucking laughable. <br><br>Remember Polyjuice Potion? Remember how it took two fucking months to brew? Yea, apparently it doesn't anymore. <br><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Snape just forgets he can use Legilimency. You know. When Scorpius shows up he just decides to take him at face value instead of interrogating him. <br><br>Draco having a spare Time Turner makes sense and at the same time, no fucking sense. <br><br>The blanket thing also makes some sense, but it's explained so shoddily and so rushed that you're only vaguely aware of it. This is also another point where the stage directions would have been nice because it just sounded like they went in where James and Lily where rocking Harry and it's like.....what the fuck? <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>The writing itself? Not great. This is a script so all the writing is dialogue and this dialogue is heavy handed telling. It's hard to get away from in a script, but it can be done beautifully. Do you know how I know that Scorpius and Albus are friends? The script comes out and tells me. It just says 'Hey, they share a meaningful look. Besties.' I don't see too many interactions that show me they are friends.<br><br>The same could be said about Albus and Scorpius's disconnect from peers. We're told that it's happening rather than shown. Which is alright, but we're told only very briefly and in a montage type scene. This is pivotal knowledge for both these characters. You might want to show just one scene in the Great Hall. <br><br>Now, for the bad telling and not showing, Harry and Albus's relationship is done well. There's a lot of exploration in that relationship and it's explored nicely. <br><br>But for all the crimes the book makes, and it makes a few severe ones, perhaps its worst is that the story doesn't quite seem to know who it belongs to. Is this Scorpius and Albus's story? Or Albus and Harry's story? Or Harry and Voldemort's? Or even Harry and Draco's? It tries desperately to give us the nostalgia of the old books but because of the medium we're presented with, and the nature of the story, it's trying desperately to do too much in too little of a time. <br><br>I really wanted to love this book. I liked it for a revisit into the world and I really enjoyed the new characters, but I disliked what they did with my old characters. It read too much like shoddy fanfiction. <br><br>Now excuse me while I go find fanfiction of the new characters. </["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="2311082031025164710" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544680418'><a id="like_count_review_1544680418" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544680418?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">26 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544680418" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544680418" ref="like" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1545400294" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1545400294" />    <a title="Lisa Vegan" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/83445-lisa-vegan"><img alt="Lisa Vegan" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1243394822p2/83445.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1545400294?book_show_action=false">Aug 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Lisa Vegan" class="user" name="Lisa Vegan" href="/user/show/83445-lisa-vegan">Lisa Vegan</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781338099133" href="/book/show/29069989-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child-parts-1-2">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/83445-lisa-vegan?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/83445-lisa-vegan?shelf=orphaned-and-quasi-orphaned-kids">orphaned-and-quasi-orphaned-kids</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/83445-lisa-vegan?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/83445-lisa-vegan?shelf=plays">plays</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/83445-lisa-vegan?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/83445-lisa-vegan?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/83445-lisa-vegan?shelf=speculative-fiction">speculative-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/83445-lisa-vegan?shelf=1-also-at-lt">1-also-at-lt</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545400294" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer886817774181448392">4  stars<br /><br />I definitely recommend reading this knowing as little as possible, even though any “spoilers” did not have the potential to ruin the reading experience anywhere near as much as I’d imagined. I read it as soon as I could after its publication date, to read it sans spoilers, and it’s why I’ll post the bulk of my review in spoiler tags. I’m not saying anything about the plot or what happens to various characters, but just expressing my general feelings about the book, the story, and especia</span>  <span id="freeText886817774181448392" style="display:none">4 ½ stars<br /><br />I definitely recommend reading this knowing as little as possible, even though any “spoilers” did not have the potential to ruin the reading experience anywhere near as much as I’d imagined. I read it as soon as I could after its publication date, to read it sans spoilers, and it’s why I’ll post the bulk of my review in spoiler tags. I’m not saying anything about the plot or what happens to various characters, but just expressing my general feelings about the book, the story, and especially the characters, might give potential readers more information than they want to know prior to reading the play. I actually would have still enjoyed it if I’d learned too much prior to reading it, but it was more entertaining to go in knowing little. <br /><br />I found this to be an incredibly quick read. I read Part 1, Acts 1 u0026amp; 2 one day and Part 2, Acts 3 u0026amp; 4 the next day. I’d love to see the play, particularly with the original London cast, but reading the play was fun too. I had seen some still photos of the West End production and some details about the sets and cast that I occasionally thought of as I was reading. I’ve always enjoyed reading plays though and don’t absolutely need to see them, though I also find delight in plays I’ve gotten to see as an audience member.<br /><br />I’ve seen many 1 and 2 star ratings of this and I’ve read comments from those who despised it and have many complaints about it. In fact, until I was starting it, and I learned that some people I know did love it or at least really liked it, I was not feeling enthusiastic. I went in with low expectations, figuring I love the seven book series so much that nothing could ruin it for me, that if I hated this, I could just look at it as fan fiction and put it out of my mind. Well, I loved it, and I found it enjoyable from the start. I’ve gotten a couple comments from others who are shocked about that. And at this point I’m really surprised by how many are unhappy with it. Even if I’d heard nothing but good things about this play I’d have greatly enjoyed it. I’m eager to read reviews after I’ve posted this one in the usual three places. I look forward to politely and respectfully chatting with other readers who have similar or different opinions about this play, whether they loved it, liked it, found it mediocre or didn’t like it, or hated it.<br /><br />However, even though I think it’s special in its own way, when I do rereads of the series I don’t know if I’ll feel compelled to reread this book. I do own the hardcover and paperback editions of the seven books, plus the British edition and the illustrated edition of the first book. For this book I read a borrowed library copy. If the play comes to my city I’ll try to see it. <br /><br />I had a lot of fun reading it. I’m really happy that it was written and published.<br /><br />There are no significant spoilers here, but with an abundance of caution the rest of what I say will be in spoiler tags:<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br /><br />As usual with Jo Rowling, as this play is based on a story written by her, a lot of wise and psychologically sophisticated things are said about relationships, people, life.<br /><br />There are smart and heartfelt messages about all sorts of things, including being able to go only forward, about getting over trauma, about everyone needing to receive and give support from and to others, about parenting and trying to be a good parent, about truly seeing and accepting others for who they really are, and about friendship and loyalty, and about how even though parents and children have similarities family (and history) aren’t definite destiny, though I loved seeing the all too real similarities between members of different generations. It’s about growing up. It’s about not needing to be perfect, about the impossibility of perfection. I loved the mentions of the experience of being an orphan as they really resonated with me how they’re never over even when childhood is over.<br /><br />I adored Scorpius and loved Albus, annoying teenager and all. I enjoyed getting reacquainted with characters I knew from the Harry Potter books and meeting the new characters, including members of the younger generation. It was lovely to see what happens to the original gang, in more than one scenario, and I felt that how everyone turned out made perfect sense. <br /><br />In the series, the Time Turner was a favorite part for me, and I enjoyed it having a huge role in this story. <br /><br />I appreciated all the humor, and there was a lot, especially because at times the story does get very dark. There was a lot of suspense throughout the story, and I did worry a fair amount about the fate of various characters and a couple in particular. It’s one reason I zoomed through the story. I was so eager to see what would happen and how it would end. I also made sure to savor what I read. <br /><br />There were some good quotes, though I didn’t officially “like” any of them. At some point I might. Maybe soon!!!<br /><br />A while back I read that J.K. Rowling said if viewers (and I assume readers) of the play don’t cry at the end they have hearts of stone. I didn’t cry but I was very touched.<br /><br />I didn’t really look at the cover until after I’d read the 3rd of 4 acts. It’s intriguing.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />The following are some details of contents and might be considered spoilers by many, much more than the contents of the above spoiler tag:<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br /><br />Scorpius seems to fit much better in Ravenclaw and maybe even Gryffindor and definitely not in Slytherin, and Albus also doesn’t seem to fit in Slytherin but in Gryffindor. I don’t think the reader is really told if Albus tried to sway the sorting hat about his assigned house.<br /><br />I do like how this story sort of starts where the epilogue of book 7 leaves off. It’s obvious that the story is Rowling’s vision and that she must have approved everything in it. I will say that I don’t think the endings in this book and book 7 of the series are the strongest parts of the entire story. They’re a tad anticlimactic, but I’m okay with that. It’s the scope of the entire story that appeals to me.<br /><br />Near the beginning I was so hoping that the whole montage of the sorting and the early Hogwarts years was a dream or a fear and not really real. <br /><br />I was confused by a few things, including why the trolley witch refers to Sirius Black and his cronies Fred u0026amp; George Weasley when they’re a generation apart. Other things I saw that bothered others didn’t bother me, such as polyjuice potion being readily available and ready to use. After all, a good two decades have passed and there are bound to be changes such as possibly the ability to keep it preserved for later use and compelling reasons to always have some on hand.<br /><br />I was so worried as I read about the eventual fates of characters but I was never concerned that there wouldn’t be a meaningful resolution, and once I started reading I knew that I would be entertained. <br /><br />The most common negative word I’ve seen to describe the play is mess. I disagree. I don’t have the patience to write a more perfect review so maybe this review is a bit of a mess but in my opinion the play is not. Not perfect but definitely good enough! <br /><br />Jo Rowling has said this is the last Harry Potter story and I hope that she sticks to that. Even though I’m always curious to know more and more, I thought books 1-7 would be the final word and I was worried about even this story and play. I think it worked and I’m grateful for all the books, but they’re there to always dive back into and in my opinion we need no more. I feel this way even though from this book I took away some considerably worthwhile things to ponder and even though I had a blast reading it.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="886817774181448392" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1545400294">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1545400294'><a id="like_count_review_1545400294" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1545400294?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">31 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1545400294" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1545400294" ref="like" class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1545400294' style='display: none'><textarea </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544122531" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544122531" />    <a title="Thibaut Nicodème" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22674620-thibaut-nicod-me"><img alt="Thibaut Nicodème" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452983758p2/22674620.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544122531?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Thibaut Nicodème" class="user" name="Thibaut Nicodème" href="/user/show/22674620-thibaut-nicod-me">Thibaut Nicodème</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="ebook 9781781107041" href="/book/show/29056090-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22674620-thibaut-nicod-me?shelf=snark">snark</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544122531" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9531677476669074822">Full review (in five parts) on <a href="http://snarktheater.tumblr.com/harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child" rel="nofollow">my blog, the Snark Theater</a>.<br><br><br>…Ooh boy, I am not gonna make friends with this one.<br><br>I'm going to be very unoriginal, but <i>Cursed Child</i> reads like fanfiction. Movieverse fanfiction, I should add, because there are tiny details—freshest in my memory is the lack of a Fidelius Charm, for instance—that just…do not give the impression that the author even read the original books. [Do keep in mind the author of the play is not JKR herself, in spite of her name on the cover]<br><br>And</span>  <span id="freeText9531677476669074822" style="display:none">Full review (in five parts) on <a href="http://snarktheater.tumblr.com/harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child" rel="nofollow">my blog, the Snark Theater</a>.<br><br><br>…Ooh boy, I am not gonna make friends with this one.<br><br>I'm going to be very unoriginal, but <i>Cursed Child</i> reads like fanfiction. Movieverse fanfiction, I should add, because there are tiny details—freshest in my memory is the lack of a Fidelius Charm, for instance—that just…do not give the impression that the author even read the original books. [Do keep in mind the author of the play is not JKR herself, in spite of her name on the cover]<br><br>And it's not a very good next-gen movieverse fanfic, either. Among the common tropes it falls victim to, you can count:<br><br>1) Hating/<a href="http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flanderization" rel="nofollow">flanderizing</a> Ron Weasley into little more than "the fun guy who likes to eat", a trope that was already poked fun at years ago by the likes of A Very Potter Musical.<br>2) The others don't come off much better, since pretty much all three members of the Golden Trio have moments of utter unlikability.<br>3) Focusing on the adults' angst even though the plot should be the kids' story. And when I say "the adults' angst" I don't mean that they have enduring trauma that survives to this day and plagues them in new ways. I mean the Golden Trio, Ginny, and Draco are all stuck with the same angst they had in the original books.<br>4) Making the original cast's development inexistent. Didn't Harry learn that Slytherin House wasn't uniformly bad? Didn't he learn from Dumbledore to have honest relationships with children? Well, apparently not, because he ended up making those mistakes himself!<br>5) Making the <i>plot</i> revolve entirely on the original books' plot. I guess Harryu0026amp;co.'s kids don't get to have a story of their own—it's all about their parents' story. And I don't mean that lightly, the plot literally is all about the original books. Which brings us to…<br>6) Time travel. It's one of many ways in which this play's canon outright breaks the original books' canon. And it's a major fixture.<br>7) Mary Sue, thy name is Delphi. I mean…seriously. How many fics are there where a cool and mysterious girl is revealed to be Voldemort's daughter, and she has all his awesome power? She even has hair that's described as "silver and blue"! Ebony Dark'ness Dementia Raven Way would either be BFFs or archenemies with her and there is no middle ground.<br><br>Here, I think 7 is a good number for some reason, so I'll stop. There's plenty more to be angry about, though. Like…Luna who? Because she's not in this. Like…trying to make Severus Snape redeemable <i>again</i>. We've been through this, book, even if he was a double agent, he was still abusive to fucking children for…like, fifteen years or so. Which was completely unrelated. Like…the most fucking convoluted resolution to the climax. Like…look, just read my full reviews if you want details.<br><br>Some positive highlights: Minerva McGonagall. Wait, did I say highlights plural? I mean that's about it.<br><br>I should talk about the new kids. In the end we really focus on three: Albus Potter, Scorpius Malfoy, and Rose Granger-Weasley. And really only the former two, which is probably for the best, because Rose is kind of the worst throughout the play. Meanwhile Albus and Scorpius range from "adorable nerds" to "oh my god please stop and think about what you're doing already". Also, the shipper in me feels obliged to say that yes, there's plenty of subtext between them. And it is also instantly ruined by Scorpius's very forced crush on Rose and Albus's even worse crush on the actual villain of the book, a woman in her twenties who doesn't mind flirting back if it gets her to manipulate him. It's just…so wrong. And no, I didn't expect Scorpius/Albus to become canon, but at least the book could have done a better job at giving us alternatives. Instead of making Rose so unlikable, how about making another Golden Trio? It would have been perfectly feasible, but instead we got…this.<br><br>Well anyway. That's Cursed Child. Dear J.K. Rowling:<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470272349ra/19908958.gif" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="9531677476669074822" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544122531">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544122531" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544122531u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544122531'><a id="like_count_review_1544122531" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544122531?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">26 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544122531" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544122531" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=26u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=9u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1544122531u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1544122531" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1544122531, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); O_O;</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Sep 01, 2016 01:00PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1544122531' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1544122531, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1544046213" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1544046213" />    <a title="Maria Clara" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/46308842-maria-clara"><img alt="Maria Clara" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1443430801p2/46308842.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1544046213?book_show_action=false">Sep 30, 2016</a>      <a title="Maria Clara" class="user" name="Maria Clara" href="/user/show/46308842-maria-clara">Maria Clara</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1544046213" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5590021228951589149">¿Qué decir o qué no decir de este libro? Primero e importante: que hablando de Harry Potter, no soy del todo objetiva, pues me encanta. Y segundo: que este libro es el guión de una obra de teatro, no una novela. Y, en parte, ahí radica el problema: que esperaba leer una historia y no una obra de teatro, sin sentimientos ni ambientación, ni na' de na'. Peroooo por otro lado, me ha encantado Scorpius y volver a leer sobre cierto personaje ya desaparecido...</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> t<a alt="Sylvia" href="/user/show/10931481-sylvia"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1419301557p1/10931481.jpg" alt="10931481" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a
