class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1528718691" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1528718691" />    <a title="Anya" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6098324-anya"><img alt="Anya" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471190361p2/6098324.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1528718691?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Anya" class="user" name="Anya" href="/user/show/6098324-anya">Anya</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6098324-anya?shelf=made-me-cry">made-me-cry</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6098324-anya?shelf=children">children</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6098324-anya?shelf=frisson">frisson</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6098324-anya?shelf=you-let-me-down">you-let-me-down</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6098324-anya?shelf=plays">plays</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1528718691" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14235396030793155522">Let’s talk about let downs, shall we? <br /><br />I am a hardcore Plath fangirl (my "Golden Retriever on a sugar high" status notwithstanding), so I try to keep my expectations to a bare minimum lest I end up being disappointed. But boy, oh boy, was this one of the biggest disappointments in a long string of disappointments that is my life? I am talking about “the moment you learnt that My So-called Life got cancelled” levels of disappointment here and we all know how much we adored Angela Chase and Jordan</span>  <span id="freeText14235396030793155522" style="display:none">Let’s talk about let downs, shall we? <br /><br />I am a hardcore Plath fangirl (my "Golden Retriever on a sugar high" status notwithstanding), so I try to keep my expectations to a bare minimum lest I end up being disappointed. But boy, oh boy, was this one of the biggest disappointments in a long string of disappointments that is my life? I am talking about “the moment you learnt that My So-called Life got cancelled” levels of disappointment here and we all know how much we adored Angela Chase and Jordan Catalano (even though he was supremely cad-like). <br /><br />I was sorely disappointed, yes but I wouldn’t have a clear conscience if I didn’t confess that I loved it, too. O, the quandary!<br /><br />Like many people of my generation, I grew up alongside with Harry, Ron, and Hermione and picking up this book made me feel like my 11-year old self again-all bright-eyed and innocent-hardly able to put down the newest instalment in the series until she had read it cover to cover. I was drowning in thick syrupy nostalgia. And this is one of the biggest reasons why I can’t bring myself to completely hate this book (despite its many shortcomings/plotholes) because it made me feel things only a few books have been able to make me feel. And that is a big deal for me.<br /><br />My biggest complaint was the format. I know, a play doesn’t translate perfectly well on the page and watching the story being brought to life would be a magical experience in itself altogether but, I just can’t. The conversations were stilted/unnatural and the characters felt like the watered-down versions of their former selves. Where did things go wrong? What happened to the affable trio I loved and grew up with? It feels like a shot to the heart to admit that the script read like one of the many fanfictions I have read over the years. ;____;<br /><br />There were a few hidden gems, though. I liked Draco and his son, Scorpius. Albus was okay, but everything was so fast that going back to Hogwarts didn’t feel as if I was going back home. And Dumbledore, oh.<br /><i>  <blockquote>“Harry, there is never a perfect answer in this messy, emotional world. Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, show your pain. To suffer is as human as to breathe.” </blockquote></i><br />That man. u0026lt;3<br /><br />To reiterate, I suppose it’s a little unfair of me to judge it because it was a script but it was sort of okay and I missed Rowling’s writing.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="14235396030793155522" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1671512949" />    <a title="Zina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15131935-zina"><img alt="Zina" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_50x66-632230dc9882b4352d753eedf9396530.png" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1671512949?book_show_action=false">Aug 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Zina" class="user" name="Zina" href="/user/show/15131935-zina">Zina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1671512949" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7791591482465474569">1) I don't understand why it's possible to rate a book before it's been published and read, thus I give it a 1 to balance the delusion.<br /><br />2) Did I mention you HP fans are delusional?<br /><br />3) Go read some CC spoilers and cry our heart out.<br /><br />4) Can't wait to see the look on your faces when you read that shit.<br /><br />5) You can literally find the basic plot in many fanfictions written many years ago.<br /><br />Edit: Now that I have finished the book, I can safely say that the plot, the characters, the writing of the script, the</span>  <span id="freeText7791591482465474569" style="display:none">1) I don't understand why it's possible to rate a book before it's been published and read, thus I give it a 1 to balance the delusion.<br /><br />2) Did I mention you HP fans are delusional?<br /><br />3) Go read some CC spoilers and cry our heart out.<br /><br />4) Can't wait to see the look on your faces when you read that shit.<br /><br />5) You can literally find the basic plot in many fanfictions written many years ago.<br /><br />Edit: Now that I have finished the book, I can safely say that the plot, the characters, the writing of the script, the way time turners and spells work, the way these characters behave is completely and utterly ridiculous. Never been a fan of these books but at least they had internal consistency up to a certain degree...until now. If you choose to consider the CC as canonical, then you agree that everything in that universe is absurd and has absolutely no rules or logic. <br /><br />Rowling has her name plastered all over the cover of the book, so even if she hasn't written part of it (or just the basic plot), she's still given her stamp of approval on it. Has she not read it? Are we supposed to think that she doesn't know what it contains? Absolutely not! She has been following the play's entire process very closely, as documented in the promo videos of the CC that we've seen so far.<br /><br />What is more, the ridiculous defensive argument that it's "supposed to be a play! That's why it's different!" is merely moronic, because the script's critics (like myself) have no problem with the format. We have read many scripts in our lives that are considered masterpieces, like Euripides's tragedies. It is not required to watch the play (and I personally have never seen a tragedy on stage) to appreciate the mastery of these creations. In no way am I comparing these global and eternal plays of greatness to this shitty fanfiction. I have read many fanfictions that were better written than this. To publish such a kind of crappy fanfic as an official work and charge it for 30 pounds is frankly insulting. The readers' rage is completely justified.</span>  <a data-text-id="7791591482465474569" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1543980269" />    <a title="Andreas" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/41449270-andreas"><img alt="Andreas" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478213885p2/41449270.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543980269?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Andreas" class="user" name="Andreas" href="/user/show/41449270-andreas">Andreas</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41449270-andreas?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41449270-andreas?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41449270-andreas?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41449270-andreas?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41449270-andreas?shelf=adventure">adventure</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41449270-andreas?shelf=magic">magic</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543980269" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer308528425740293345"><i>*Edit*</i><br />My three stars rating has been bothering me since I finished this. I can't. It has to be a two. It was just too much of a... no.<br /><br /><br /><b> <blockquote>“Those that we love never truly leaves us, Harry. There are things that death cannot touch. Paint… and memory… and love.”</blockquote></b> <br /><br />Reading this was one of <i>the</i> strangest things I have ever done in my entire life. Ever. I don’t know how to feel about it. I don’t know what to think about it, or what to say. I didn’t hate it, but I definitely didn’t love it. It was awkward. P</span>  <span id="freeText308528425740293345" style="display:none"><i>*Edit*</i><br />My three stars rating has been bothering me since I finished this. I can't. It has to be a two. It was just too much of a... no.<br /><br /><br /><b> <blockquote>“Those that we love never truly leaves us, Harry. There are things that death cannot touch. Paint… and memory… and love.”</blockquote></b> <br /><br />Reading this was one of <i>the</i> strangest things I have ever done in my entire life. Ever. I don’t know how to feel about it. I don’t know what to think about it, or what to say. I didn’t hate it, but I definitely didn’t love it. It was awkward. Pretty much all of the characters were flat and the interactions between them forced, I was torn between thinking “THIS IS A NEW HARRY POTTER!!” and “This doesn’t feel like Harry Potter”. The plot was… not what I was expecting and certainly not what I wanted. I didn’t feel what I feel when I read the Harry Potter books, I didn’t feel the characters I love so much, the ones I grew up with, coming alive for me, talking friendship and bravery and magic. They were loose here, frayed, wiped out. I don’t know. Like I said, I don’t know how I feel. I’m struggling to rate this. I don’t like saying “oh 3 stars because it’s <i>this</i> or <i>that</i>”, but well… it <b>is</b> Harry Potter. So, three stars. For the memories.<br /><br />And I’m aware that this is a stage play and I’m sure that as such, things will probably look way better with actors acting their parts, the lights, the sounds, the effects, the emotions on stage… I wish I could see it.</span>  <a data-text-id="308528425740293345" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1543980269">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1543980269" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1543980269u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1543980269'><a id="like_count_review_1543980269" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1543980269?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">27 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1543980269" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1543980269" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=27u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=9u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1543980269u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1543980269" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1543980269, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); I'm disillusioned with reviews that give nothing but praise for this book. I don't know how people think this is an okay way to continue the series. To me, I feel like this is just a story for the play and not a proper continuation. I hope I'm right and that Rowling is planning a REAL continuation, but I fear she's not.</span>  <a data-text-id="7624391140236640909" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Aug 03, 2016 10:40PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_155126178" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Rosângela" href="/user/show/45132571-ros-ngela"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478296634p1/45132571.jpg" alt="45132571" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/45132571-ros-ngela">Rosângela</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer378290390422805897"><i>Ryan wrote: "It was painful for sure. class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1558176870" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1558176870" />    <a title="Asha" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/11792174-asha"><img alt="Asha" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457304459p2/11792174.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1558176870?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Asha" class="user" name="Asha" href="/user/show/11792174-asha">Asha</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1558176870" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8868350780768007639"><p>4.45 Oh goodness. Well, I don't want to say much for fear of ruining it for you guys. But man. Rowling has once again blessed us with the epicness that is Harry Potter. And given us plebeians who can't see the London production a chance to still be a part of it all.</p><br /><p>Two lattes and one cup of tea later, I finished this book. There were gasps, eye-rolls, sighs, mental chidings and cheers, and chills as I read. Because it's a screenplay you get to read the scene headings and that just amazed me, env</p></span>  <span id="freeText8868350780768007639" style="display:none"><p>4.45 Oh goodness. Well, I don't want to say much for fear of ruining it for you guys. But man. Rowling has once again blessed us with the epicness that is Harry Potter. And given us plebeians who can't see the London production a chance to still be a part of it all.</p><br /><p>Two lattes and one cup of tea later, I finished this book. There were gasps, eye-rolls, sighs, mental chidings and cheers, and chills as I read. Because it's a screenplay you get to read the scene headings and that just amazed me, envisioning all the effects that will be taking place. I envy those who are seeing the play.</p><br /><p>I could go on and on, nut I won't. So just do yourself a favor and read it. And stay off Goodreads til you do. ;)</p><br /><p>Also, I think it's very important to remember that this is a <i>play</i> and not a <b>book</b>book. So, of course it goes by pretty quickly and we wrap things up in 300 pages of pure dialogue, instead of 300-800 pages of dialogue and description and background and thoughts. It kind of reminds me of the stories Rowling puts on Pottermore, except I rank this one much higher with more weight behind it because it is officially published in book format and because it's going to be a production. Either way, rejoice! And (lovingly) envy those who get to see the play!</p></span>  <a data-text-id="8868350780768007639" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1715264676" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1715264676" />    <a title="Simon" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7232880-simon"><img alt="Simon" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467490736p2/7232880.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1715264676?book_show_action=false">Aug 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Simon" class="user" name="Simon" href="/user/show/7232880-simon">Simon</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1715264676" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1955519198586976382">So I've struggled with my thoughts on this. Lovely to go back to the world. I'm sure it will be amazing on stage. As a piece of literature it feels like fan fiction, because it kind of is. It's an idea of Rowlings that's going to be a huge play written by two respected men. Did I hate it, no. Did I love it, no. Do I begrudge it, no. It's just not another Harry Potter novel. And that's fine, I think.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1543951657?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="☣Lynn☣" class="user" name="☣Lynn☣" href="/user/show/7101656-lynn">☣Lynn☣</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7101656-lynn?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7101656-lynn?shelf=young-adult-fiction">young-adult-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7101656-lynn?shelf=right-in-the-feels">right-in-the-feels</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7101656-lynn?shelf=bleeding-awesomeness">bleeding-awesomeness</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7101656-lynn?shelf=adult-fiction">adult-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7101656-lynn?shelf=blast-from-the-past">blast-from-the-past</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7101656-lynn?shelf=saw-that-coming">saw-that-coming</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1543951657" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5008651350658023228">Of course this is getting 5 stars from me. IT'S FUCKING HARRY POTTER!! <br /><br />It was nice to see the old gang back together again. My only complaint was that this read like fan fiction and the ending was too rushed. Really wish J K Rowling had written this as an actual book too....it lacked her magical writing. Other than that, I loved this. u0026lt;3<br /><br />A must read for all Potter fans! Can't wait for the play to come to the U.S.! Hopefully within the next year or two.....</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" >            <span id="freeTextContainer11126905720726009587">Eu não sei nem o que escrever aqui de review. Inclusive preciso pensar bastante pra fazer um vídeo organizadinho dando minha opinião de uma forma fofa, porque eu jamais imaginei que essa história ia ganhar 2 estrelas. Eu achava que NO MÁXIMO poderia ser 4 estrelas. JK Rowling sendo uma das autoras e tendo aprovado tudo isso. Eu tô em choque de verdade.<br /><br />O ponto positivo: é uma leitura muito rápida.<br />O ponto negativo: o resto</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1544367452">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1544367452" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1544367452u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F29056083-harry-potter-and-the-cursed-child---parts-one-and-two">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1544367452'><a id="like_count_review_1544367452" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1544367452?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">26 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1544367452" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1544367452" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=26u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=9u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1544367452u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1544367452" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1544367452, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;);
